Are you looking for an opportunity to apply your skills and talent to spark both innovation and positive social change? Symend is a rapidly growing fintech company that combines behavioral science with advanced AI, data, and analytics capabilities to enable companies to engage at-risk customers more effectively and humanely. By creating better ways to approach individuals with empathy and dignity at the time when they need it most, Symend's employees are helping to transform the science of customer engagement and improve lives in North America and around the world. The Opportunity The Analyst, Business Operations Intern will be responsible for: the coordination of corporate metrics and sales and operations planning process, supporting priority operations projects, and assist with the quarterly board meeting and planning cycle. Please note this will be a 6-month internship, ending in December 2022. What You'll Be Doing Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Corporate metrics and S&OP co-ordination: Coordinate preparation for weekly business metrics review and monthly S&OP cycle; working closely with operations roles in departments to ensure a standard and consistent approach to reporting metrics, highlighting areas to investigate and any help needed. Work with teams to gather data and prepare reports for weekly deep dives during management meeting review. Support special projects: Project manage special project(s) related to operations initiatives and improving the business. Contribute insights and support in coordination of special project internal resourcing, planning, execution, and status reporting. Drive corporate operations initiatives through coordination of activities and creation of templates and playbooks. Support the quarterly board meeting and planning cycle: Support preparation materials for quarterly board meetings and planning meetings by gathering initial planning materials, partnering with stakeholders on agenda items and coordination of meeting logistics. Following planning off sites, collate materials to develop and iterate board presentation materials. Support financing and corporate development work by partnering with internal stakeholders across a variety of teams. What You'll Need Education Currently working towards a Bachelor's degree in Business or related field. Experience Previous on the job and/or internship experience with project coordination, with the ability to look out toward major deliverables and work backwards with what actions are required, who will complete them, and when they will be done. Experience working collaboratively with project teams cross-functionally within an organization and a track record of building strong trust-based working relationships. Key Competencies & Requirements Ability to think strategically and analyze the current state, developing options, comparing scenarios, and selecting strategic direction. Strong communication skills and ability to influence, previous experience communicating requirements and coordinating delivery without authority. Strong attention to detail to capture inputs and close out open actions. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills inclusive of email, memo, and presentation format. Analytical thinker with the ability to set up and execute analysis in excel Adaptable and open minded, comfortable with change and working in a fast-paced environment. Consistently achieves results, even under tough circumstances. Entrepreneurial and highly motivated to learn. All positions require background screening. This will include criminal and education checks to comply with regulations. Why Symend? We could tell you all about our competitive compensation, flexible work environment, social Fridays, and awesome team events, but working at Symend is so much more than that! Working at Symend means being part of a driven and collaborative team that values trust, accountability and continuous learning. We work hard, but always make time for fun! You get the chance to do work that matters on a product that truly changes lives! About Symend At Symend, we believe that all customers should be treated with empathy and dignity. That's why we leverage our deep understanding of consumer behavior to create personalized interactions that better engage and empower customers at all points of the customer journey. Our digital engagement platform uses behavioral science, data science and advanced analytics to help our clients build stronger relationships with their customers. Symend: The science of engagement.™ Symend's relationship-based approach keeps enterprises attuned to the changing needs of their customers and empowers them to take action. This increases customer satisfaction, lowers operating costs, and helps resolve past due bills before reaching collections. Founded in 2016, Symend's platform is purpose built to serve complex global enterprises in telecommunications, financial services, utilities and media. Symend is headquartered in Calgary and privately held, with global operations across Canada, the United States and Latin America. Symend: The science of engagement.™ Symend's Privacy Policy By submitting your application, you agree that we may use your personal information in accordance with our privacy policy.

Senior Data Quality Analyst – Business TechnologyFull Time, Calgary, AB or Toronto, ON or Remote Be Boring. Make Money.™ is our investment approach, but we are anything but dull. We are a diverse team of professionals—all with a shared goal: to be the best.We celebrate our unique and independent culture. We take pride in doing things a little differently than other investment firms. Our pursuit for excellence means that a career with Mawer is demanding; however, interesting challenges are plentiful, and innovative ideas, diverse opinions, and teamwork are expected and rewarded regardless of title and tenure. The OpportunityAs a Senior Data Quality Analyst, you will be tasked with analyzing data, assessing its quality, reporting on its state, as well as facilitating any corrections or improvements. The ideal candidate will be able to recognize and demonstrate that achieving high quality data is a consequence of data analysis, rather than a pre-requisite. This role will report to the Manager, Data Governance. Primary Responsibilities Perform data quality assessments and in-depth analysis of datasets Perform root cause analysis and impact analysis of data issues, potential issues, and provide recommendations to fix and remediate Work with stakeholders, system specialists, and developers to rectify data errors and adopt preventative mechanisms in data pipelines and/or front-end applications Intake, log, and track data errors and issues at a very granular level through a known error’s lifecycle, from discovery to resolution Perform ongoing monitoring of data quality rule exceptions and breaks at various frequencies (daily, weekly, monthly, etc.) Document data quality rules, business data rules, and problem statements, and how they relate to each other Assist with and consult on data cataloging and business glossary descriptions, especially in the context of the quality state Education, Skills & Qualifications 5+ years in a similar data analysis role within the investment management, portfolio management, mutual fund, or investment banking industry Must possess personal qualities of perseverance, persistence, tenacity, and curiosity; self-driven with a passion for “getting the data right” Strong ability to communicate concisely and in a detailed manner Highly experienced, knowledgeable, and/or skilled in the following subject areas and platforms: Investment management or portfolio management Data analysis Problem-solving Data quality concepts (data governance concepts considered an asset) Data quality analysis and remediation Salesforce CRM SimCorp Dimension Octopai and/or Ataccama (or other data quality tools) Oracle PL/SQL and T-SQL Azure Data Factory Azure Purview Jira Why Mawer? Directly contribute to the firm’s growth as a global investment manager. Learn and work alongside high-performing individuals within a team that has consistently delivered exceptional long-term investment results and the highest levels of client satisfaction (our client retention is 99%). Be a part of a meritocracy in which the quality of ideas supersedes hierarchy. At Mawer, talented individuals can progress quickly, regardless of tenure or experience. We offer the potential for ownership over time based on the firm’s selection criteria. We have a unique culture—one that emphasizes integrity, clients’ interests, excellence, teamwork, and long-term thinking. A flexible, hybrid work environment: we offer our team the ability to choose where they are most productive. About MawerEstablished in 1974, Mawer Investment Management Ltd. is an independent firm that provides world-class, global investment management services to a broad range of institutional and individual clients. We are proud of our reputation as one of Canada’s most respected investment management firms and strive to earn such respect by continually delivering long-term investment excellence, developing strong client partnerships, and living our core values. Mawer currently manages approximately $89 billion in assets and employs over 200 people in Calgary, Toronto, the U.S., and Singapore. Are you ready to be a player who drives Scotford to beat-lead-thrive through the energy transition? Ready to lead Scotford’s transformation beyond our existing ways of working into our Energy & Chemicals Park of the future? Are you ready to bring Scotford’s bold 2030 Vision to life? Where you fit in – When you join the Scotford Digital and Business Transformation team, you are joining a diverse group of pioneers committed to exploring our potential and expanding perspectives to shape our collective future. We are an inclusive team which supports and fosters open dialogue and collaboration as we seek to drive our transformation at pace. We welcome an entrepreneurial spirit and the willingness to experiment, to try new methods, techniques, and approaches as we generate solutions to both anticipated and adaptive challenges. What’s the role – The Digital Business Analyst is responsible for identifying and documenting the business needs of Scotford stakeholders and helping to determine feasibility of digital opportunities that meet business needs and resolve business problems. This position will give you the opportunity to grow to become an active thought partner and solution visionary who shapes the technology demand and direction and supports the digital + business transformation team at Scotford. This role interfaces primarily with Scotford based stakeholders. Applicants in the Scotford or Calgary area preferred with travel to site as needed. Accountabilities: Precisely capture business problems, value drivers, and functional/non-functional requirements, including health, safety, security, usability, data, and supportability considerations. Translate business requirements into functionality and assess the risks, feasibility, opportunities, and business impacts of various solution options In your interactions with business stakeholders, describe technology in terms easily understood and set realistic customer expectations for the project outcome. Adjust customer expectations in accordance with changes in scope. Generate innovative approaches to existing problems or new opportunities Create and present compelling business cases to justify solution value and establish approval, funding and prioritization Assess and model processes, data flows, and technology to understand the current value and issues, and identify opportunities for improvement Create clear + concise documentation to communicate requirements and related information; keep updated to align with the solution over the project lifecycle Ensure traceability of requirements from business needs and requirements, through testing and scope changes, to final solution Interact with the delivery teams (local + global) to understand solution limitations ensuring the business requirements and use cases are addressed Participate in opportunity framing workshops or work process simplification workshops Manage entries for new Digital Workstream opportunities into our central value tracking and prioritization tool to drive opportunities into the Asset Reference Plans/Project Review Teams AND/OR Digital + Business Transformation execution plans Skills and Requirements What we need from you – A legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer. Minimum Education or Certification: 4-year Degree related to IT or business CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional) or PBA (Professional in Business Analysis) certification preferred 4+ years of corporate business or IT experience Experience taking a systematic and analytical approach to problem solving Experience working closely with business stakeholders, capturing digital opportunities, ensuring business value is articulated with clear line-of-sight to cost savings or efficiency gains as it relates to transformational goals + targets Experience analyzing the alignment between business requirements and system capabilities Knowledge of existing digital technology + emerging technology landscapes Understanding of systems engineering concepts and data/process analysis and modeling Experience working in Agile projects is an asset Experience with Agile project tools (like Azure DevOps) is an asset Company description Shell is a global group of energy and petrochemical companies with about 84,000 employees across more than 70 countries. We aim to meet the world’s growing need for more and cleaner energy solutions in ways that are economically, environmentally and socially responsible. We have expertise in among other exploration, production, refining and marketing of oil and natural gas, and the manufacturing and marketing of oil products, chemicals, electric power, renewables and energy solutions. As a global energy company operating in a challenging world, we set high standards of performance and ethical behaviors. We are judged by how we act and how we live up to our core values of honesty, integrity and respect for people. Our Business Principles are based on these. They promote trust, openness, teamwork and professionalism, as well as pride in what we do and how we conduct business. Building on our core values, we aspire to sustain a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone feels respected and valued, from our employees to our customers and partners. A diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment are vital to our success, leading to greater innovation and better energy solutions. An innovative place to work There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change. Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently. An inclusive place to work To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential… We’re creating a space where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there. We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology. We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity. We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application. A rewarding place to work Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice. We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

Data Governance Analyst Reference Code: 105661 Location: Canada (CA) - Calgary, AB Job Category: Information Technology/Systems Employment Type: Employee Full-time Relocation Eligibility: This position is not eligible for our relocation program Application Deadline: 06/12/2022 We all need energy. It warms our homes, cooks our food, gives us light, and gets us where we need to go. It also improves our quality of life in countless other ways. At TC Energy, our job is to deliver that energy to millions of people who depend on it across North America. And we take our job very seriously. Guided by our values of safety, innovation, responsibility, collaboration and integrity, we develop and operate our facilities safely, reliably and with care for our impact on the environment. With our presence across the continent, our people play an active role in building strong communities. We’re proud of how our hard work and commitment sets us apart and benefits society, every day. We’re looking for new team members who share our values and are ready to take on exciting challenges. To remain competitive, support our high-performance culture and allow for more flexibility in the way we work, we offer a hybrid work model and flexible dress code for our eligible office-based workforce in Canada, the U.S. and Mexico. The opportunity Our Enterprise Information Governance team is evolving to meet the needs of our organization data and analytics journey and we are expanding our strength in data and information governance to support our goal of becoming a data driven organization. We are seeking an Enterprise Data Governance Analyst who has knowledge and experience in establishing data management policies and standards and can work with various stakeholders to enable smooth application of standards in their daily tasks. This individual will work very closely with our Enterprise Data Governance Lead to implement the data and information governance model within TC Energy. The individual must have proven skills, competencies, and capacity to guide the stakeholders in proper management of data and information through out the lifecycle. What you’ll do Reporting to the Manager- Enterprise Information Governance and in collaboration with Technical Lead- Enterprise Data Governance, the Enterprise Data Governance Analyst focuses on the development and management of Data Governance tools and artifacts and enables the accelerated adoption and execution of data governance best practices across teams within TC Energy. The Enterprise Data Governance Analyst will work with stakeholders across the organization to assist in delivering a data governance program with the goal of improving data quality. Key responsibilities include but are not limited to: Assist Technical Lead - Enterprise Data Governance in development of policies, standards, and processes in data and analytics space and to support the implementation of data governance framework Represent Enterprise Information Governance team in ongoing data initiatives Partner with stakeholders through ongoing projects to implement data governance program by identifying data domains and formalizing data ownership and stewardship Train data owners, data stewards and data custodians on their roles and responsibilities Assist business units to establish data maps and data quality requirements as necessary Support formation of data governance committees and their activities with the goal of improving data quality Act as liaison between business unit stakeholders and Information Services partners to enable development of tools and processes for easy access to data Minimum Qualifications 4 years of experience as Data Analyst/Data Governance Analyst preferably in Energy sector A wide variety of degrees will be considered but a typical candidate may have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant domain such as Business, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, etc. Previous experience in data governance implementation with solid understanding of data management elements Previous experience developing and delivering data governance training High level of professional judgement; able to gather information and requirements for capturing business rules and apply professional judgement and understanding of TCE’s operations to evaluate the accuracy and reliability of the business rules Proactive, identifies inconsistencies, areas for improvement in business rules and presents recommendations for improvement Ability to build excellent relationships with peers, leaders, technical teams, business users and executives Strong written and verbal communication skills, with experience in business communication and presentations A positive “can do” attitude; works through challenging situations with integrity and dignity Preferred Qualifications Data Governance, Data Management Certification is an asset Experience with data quality improvement initiatives Experience with record management Experience with project data turn over About our business TC Energy is a leading energy infrastructure company in North America. We have three complementary businesses of natural gas pipelines, liquids (oil) pipelines, and power generation. Our operations span three countries, seven Canadian provinces, and 34 U.S. states. Apply now! Apply to this posting by 06/12/2022 using reference code 105661. You must apply through our jobs system at jobs.tcenergy.com. Only applications submitted through our system will be acknowledged. Applications may be submitted using a mobile device or a desktop / laptop computer. TC Energy is an equal opportunity employer. Learn more Visit us at TCEnergy.com and connect with us on our social media channels for our latest news, employee stories, community activities, and other updates. Thank you for choosing TC Energy in your career search. Depending on qualifications, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder. Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions. All positions require background screening. Some require criminal and/or credit checks to comply with regulations. TC Energy is committed to provide employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Overview: At Neo, we’re reimagining everyday financial services from the ground up and shaping the financial future for millions of people in Canada. We’re a tech company consistently pushing for the next best thing, which provides many opportunities to grow and learn personally and professionally. Ready to materialize your passion into a connected purpose? Come join a high-speed startup in a community of high-achieving dreamers and doers, set on innovating the best solutions. Risk Analytics @ Neo Neo’s Credit Risk team works hard to enable a high growth portfolio with sound risk management principles while optimizing credit decisioning across the customer lifecycle. This team of high-performers leads the development and implementation of key credit risk strategies to effectively manage the lending portfolio inline with our business objectives. The Role Neo is looking for a data driven individual with strong knowledge of advanced analytical techniques to join our team in our Calgary headquarters. Leveraging your knack for data and a strong statistical foundation, you’ll make an immediate impact via development and deployment of advanced analytical techniques across our credit and fraud decisioning projects. You’ll be contributing to our innovative, strategic, and high-performance team with a mission to improve the financial experience for all Canadians. What you'll be doing:: Develop reporting capabilities to actively monitor performance, and identify trends to enable strategic business decisions Analyze risk profiles across the credit lifecycle, leveraging advanced analytics and machine learning to best identify exposure/opportunities Forecast key business metrics including vintage loss rates, approval rates, loan conversion rates, and credit quality for new initiatives and marketing campaigns Collaborate with key stakeholders across the organization to integrate foundational risk practices Who we're looking for:: 1-3 years experience in data analytics; experience in risk management considered an asset Strong knowledge of SQL, R and Python Data-driven, eager to understand the numbers and provide meaningful insights Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to adapt communication to different audiences Self-starter, highly focused; driven to achieve business objectives Self-organized, ability to prioritize effectively Able to collaborate with others, engage stakeholders purposefully About applying with us:: At Neo, you’ll be working with industry-leading technology that changes the way we live and realize a better financial future. It’s a serious deal, but that doesn’t mean we don’t know a thing or two about having fun. Our entrepreneurial environment gets our adrenaline pumping and beats the regular 9-5 job. We’re in it together, always. Gain hands-on experience and be part of the future. Neo Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are excited to meet with and hire the top talent out there. We appreciate your interest in working with us; however, only those applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Successful candidates for this position will be required to undergo a security screening, including a criminal records check and may require a credit check.

The Role Shell Trading Canada (STC) offers you the unique opportunity to join its crude operations team and be a part of its global trading network. Currently we are seeking a new member to join the team as an Operations Support Analyst. This role offers a challenging opportunity to support the traders by analyzing many sources of information with the goal of maximizing efficiencies. We are interested in attracting people to our business that share our core working values of honesty, integrity and have respect for others. We also want those who can build on our business vision and can achieve great results through teamwork. The position is one of 8 positions within Crude Trading Operations Support Team. Together, the team is responsible for managing the settlement of all transactions of Crude product movements. This position is a primary link between the Calgary group and Chennai, India based financial management groups, and oversees the settlement process. The position interfaces with external trade counter parties related to pricing, volume, and invoicing. In addition, this role is a key resource in support of STC's growing lease business. Responsibilities: Interpret lease agreements, monthly pipeline statements, tariff, and related commercial documents to assist in the process of analyzing and reconciling data variances Execute monthly lease stream settlement plan through maintaining pricing components, setting up customer master data, and confirming pricing with customers Manage entry of large volume of WIO (working interest splits), shipper balances, single shipper statements (tariffs and EQs) Manage invoicing for purchases/sales of crude and tariff/transportation cost Support with inventory reconciliation and reporting Investigate settlement adjustments Interface with Traders, Commercial Operators, Contract Management Team and Accounting Teams based in Chennai Resolve customer and vendor issues or questions regarding monthly settlement Refer to and comply with various government reporting on lease volumes group records management policies Support continuous improvement initiatives Contributes to maximizing commercial added value through meeting timely and accurate payable and receivable invoicing targets What we need from you Must have legal authorization to work in Canada on a full-time basis for anyone other than current employer Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma preferred but not required Minimum 3 or more years of experience with data analytics Advanced MS Excel skills with ability to create and manage macros Ability to manage multiple concurrent issues and problems and apply a high level of energy to their resolution Understanding of settlements and accounting is desirable As this is an operational role, the incumbent may be requested to work outside office hours during heavy time demands and certain times within the payment cycle Disclaimer Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Shell jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Business Analyst Are you looking for an inviting and exciting career opportunity? Do you have a passion for information systems, analysis, collaboration and making a difference? If you are someone who understands Enterprise Resourcing Planning (ERP) and Case Management systems, how they contribute to improving the business’s operations and are motivated by being a part of making that happen, we want to hear from you. Do you want to be part of a team that is embarking on Digital Transformation in the non-profit sector? If the answer is “Yes”, this is the job for you! Catholic Social Services (CSS) is currently recruiting for one (1), full time, forty (40) hours per week Business Analyst to join our talented team! You will be joining an established Agency that is guided by faith to care for and bring hope to people in need with humility, compassion and respect. With more than 50 years of service delivery, Catholic Social Services is one of the largest multi-function social services agencies in Canada, with more than 1800 staff, and hundreds of volunteers delivering 130+ programs throughout Edmonton and Central Alberta. About the Role Reporting to the Manager, Digital Transformation and Projects, the Business Analyst supports the Digital Services and Innovation area by working on various information technology projects. The incumbent will partner with the services areas to identify business requirements for Human Resources (HR), Finance, and Case/Client Managements projects and research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements. This role also makes recommendations, documenting solutions, and allocating requirements to achieve the desired future state, preparing use case for system configuration, developing test plans and assisting with User Acceptance Testing (UAT) processes. Job duties include, but are not limited to: Facilitate and manage business requirements elicitation, analysis, validation and documentation throughout opportunity assessment or concept phase and all subsequent project phases. Working collaboratively with subject matter experts in the analysis of business requirements and provide information, support, and recommendations for implementing new programs, processes, systems or for improvements to current system functionality as they relate to our technology systems. Project manage, lead, or participate as part of the team to implement new programs, processes or technology solutions, system upgrades, and new features as part of service pack releases Define, document and present the desired future state vision and processes Translate business needs, business processes and requirements to enable technical resources to develop or configure the solution to meet business needs Develop impact analysis and implement strategies to manage change for large new system implementations or small functionality changes Standardize process and procedures with a continuous improvement mindset to effectively and efficiently maximize the use of technology systems and improve the user experience Information Strategy: Assisting in the development of performance measurement frameworks; evaluating available technology improvements that would allow for more streamlined data collection while supporting the team lead to design business cases accordingly; identifying and implementing industry trends and best practices; Document business processes, procedures and methodologies used in creating new processes, programs or implementing technology, analysis and reporting; identifying areas for improvement and risks to data quality and efficiency, and recommending potential solutions; communicating with colleagues to ensure consistent practice Provide end user support to the organization on technology, and troubleshoot, resolve, and manage service requests Develop, deliver, and facilitate system, process or program training for new system users Continually update and learn new technology best practices and functionality via research, events, and networking with industry subject matter experts Other related duties, as required Knowledge, Skills, and Ability: Demonstrated commitment to Catholic Social Services mission, vision and values Strong organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly Knowledge of project management and change management principles and practices Excellent facilitation and consulting skills. Comfortable working with diverse groups of people with competing needs. Very strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build relationships with internal and external stakeholders Detail oriented and organized, with good judgment and resource management skills Computer proficiency and experience using HCM, CRM, HRIS, or other equivalent systems Proficiency in using Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) with adaptability to learn new applications Strong problem solving skills with the ability to analyze a situation, consider all options, and anticipate outcomes before providing recommendations High degree of integrity and professionalism by being reliable, courteous, responsive and punctual Education and Experience: Bachelor Degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, Finance Management, Human Resources, Social Sciences or an acceptable related field 4 years diversified and progressive experience in I Information Technology environment, implementing Human Resources Information System (HRIS), Human Capital Management (HCM) systems, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Systems or other technology solutions Demonstrated business analyst and project management experience leading cross functional teams Demonstrated experience analyzing business processes, process improvement and managing data with the ability to map them into technology solutions Demonstrated experience in implementing large change initiatives and knowledge of change management and communication practices Business Analyst certification is considered an asset Project Management certification is considered an asset Change Management certification is considered an asset Equivalent combinations of education and experience may be considered The starting rate for this position is $38.31. Please apply online at www.cssalberta.ca/careers to competition number 2836. This requisition will remain open until a suitable candidate is found. We offer flexibility, a comprehensive benefits package and a supportive working environment. We embrace diversity and offer equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless of origin, culture, ethnicity, age, ability, gender identity and people of faith or no faith. We thank all applicants. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Corrosion Service Company Limited (CSCL) was founded in 1950 by Thomas R.B. Watson as the first Canadian firm to specialize in cathodic protection. Our founding philosophy was based on the principles of providing great customer service and developing a deep understanding of customer needs, these same core principles still guide our company today. Throughout our history we have always been privately owned by successive groups of employees that have risen through the organization. This ownership structure gives us a unique perspective on business and ensures that our stakeholders (customers, employees and partners), rather than shareholders, always come first. This is vital for a company such as ours, given that we exist primarily to protect the environment, our citizens and the prosperity of the communities in which we live. Position: Technical Assistant – Data Analyst GENERAL FUNCTION: The Technical Assistant – Data Analyst for Edmonton Operations will be responsible for the field support and review of depth of cover data, and preparation of such for turnover to the client. RESPONSIBILITIES: Operations: Review of data collected by field personnel Combination and preparation of data for turnover to the client Work closely with team members to meet or exceed our customers’ expectations Assist other team members on projects and on tasks as necessary. Follow Corrosion Service’s and clients’ operations and HSE procedures and policies. Work with other technical staff in a supportive and positive manner Complete tasks to Corrosion Service Quality of Work Standards Develop the culture of employee’s attitudes towards work and each other, Code of Conduct, etc. Communication: Effectively communicates with assigned supervisor and other members of the project team to ensure client requirements for data are being fulfilled while maintaining productivity Offer effective feedback to any assigned field crews regarding the quality of their data submissions QUALIFICATIONS: University graduates from an accredited engineering program. Eligible for EIT membership with APEGA and other engineering professional associations as required. OR College graduates with an Engineering, Science, or Data Science background Strong analytical, problem solving and computer skills (MS Office; Google Earth) are required Good initiative, adaptable, flexible, and a team player Careful attention to detail Overtime and an adjusted work schedule may be required to meet customer expectations Edmonton Office Address: 100, 9871-279 Street, Acheson, AB T7X 6J4 Please advise the Human Resources Department to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process. We are an organization where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging and interesting projects nationwide. It is a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes Corrosion Service a great place to work and grow. Corrosion Service is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Job_Title: Data Management Analyst, Social Serving Sector
Summary: Use your Data Management skills to facilitate PolicyWise's research projects Don’t miss this exciting role that inspires change and action for improving the lives of people! Enjoy a competitive remuneration package, PLUS a great host of benefits About Us PolicyWise is a charitable, non-profit corporation established in 2003 to support the development of effective policies, programs, and services to benefit the well-being of children, families, and communities. We have a reputation for collaboration, inclusion, and broad stakeholder engagement approaches and strategies. Our research and policy team has an in-depth understanding of the domains of well-being, the child and youth serving sector, provincial and local service delivery contexts, and the application of knowledge across these sectors and systems. Our Vision Children, youth, and families thrive in respectful, safe, and supportive environments shaped by wise decisions. Our Mission To inform, identify, and promote effective social policy and practice to improve the well-being of children & youth, families, and communities. For more information about our work, please visit our website: www.policywise.com About the Opportunity Currently, we are seeking a full-time Data Management Analyst to join our team, in either Edmonton or Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Research and Policy Manager, you are responsible for conducting a wide variety of collection, analyses, and management of data from various social and health services, utilizing advanced understanding of data collection infrastructure, analytical, and quantitative skills to support PolicyWise’s research projects. PolicyWise is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and recognizes that those ideals are embedded in governance and organizational performance. As an essential element of their culture, PolicyWise welcomes the unique contributions that candidates can bring in terms of diverse backgrounds and lived experiences, and encourages applications that represent the diversity of the community they serve. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Data Management: Co-designing data collection protocols with non-profit partners that match service delivery and research needs Working with large sets of data from a variety of government and non-profit partners Maintaining and optimizing databases Performing complex data commands (data linking, linkage quality assessment, and data manipulation) Supporting with consent forms, information sharing, governance to promote effective and sustainable data management Building capacity among partners to practice good data management Developing and monitoring data governance policies Conducting needs and opportunity assessments to inform data collection and data management planning Application of relevant privacy, legislation and ethical considerations to guide data collection across sectors Data Collection and Analysis: Supporting project teams in data analysis, preparing tables/charts/graphs, and presentations Analyzing quantitative data (including administrative data) Developing data capture tools (surveys, forms, etc.) and data management plans Documenting processes Synthesizing and summarizing data patterns Writing and collaborating drafts and summaries Applying advanced analytics skills in large/complex datasets More About You To qualify, you will need a Bachelor's degree, with a very strong quantitative emphasis. A Master's Degree in any related field will be considered an asset. Due to the nature of the role, we require a strong understanding, interactions, and experience in the social serving sector (e.g. non-profits, children/youth groups, Indigenous communities, and other marginalized groups). Moreover, you will be required to visit the communities you serve from time to time for data collection and as such, a valid Driver's License will be required. In addition, we require strong skills, experience, and knowledge in the following: Managing large datasets and using statistical packages (SPSS, SAS, R software, Stata etc.) Quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills Attention to detail and good interpersonal skills Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks Desire and ability to learn and develop new skills Demonstrated computer skills (e.g., advanced Excel, data visualization software) Ability to work both individually and as a team member Above all, we are seeking a socially-conscious individual who is eager to use their skills to make a difference and provide value towards our clients, the communities we serve, and our valuable programs. For the safety and well-being of our clients and employees, we require proof of COVID-19 vaccination before commencing employment. Accommodations will be made for those exempt from the COVID-19 vaccination, based on grounds protected by relevant human rights law. About the Benefits In exchange for your hard work and dedication, you will receive a highly competitive annual salary plus a great host of benefits, including: 50% employer-paid extended medical, dental, and vision benefits $200 reimbursement for parking or transit Work from home / remote work hybrid until further notice $500 allowance to set up home office at the start of hire 3 weeks vacation Holiday break during Christmas and New Year on top of vacation time And that's not all! You will be welcomed into a supportive and highly collaborative environment. If you think you've got the skills to take on this rewarding and challenging role, apply today!

Company Overview Stream Systems (www.streamsystems.ca) is a leading-edge technology company that enables enterprises to optimize and make better decisions. Our SimOpti intelligence platform brings AI, machine learning and simulation to power business intelligence across complex operations, in any industry. Reporting Structure/Department Reporting to the Director, Customer Services, this position is a key role within the Customer Services Group that has direct impact on company strategic goals and company success. Our entire team of talented individuals is growing quickly; we are targeting 50-75% growth over the next fiscal year. We are expanding our simulation and analyst team to address the growing number of exciting projects. Position Summary As a Simulation & Modeling Analyst, you will work directly with our customers and with Stream’s simulation and research teams to understand our customer’s operations, collect and analyse their data, design and develop simulation models, and translate business needs into technical requirements. Using the resulting models, you will analyse their operations, find correlations within and between systems, identify operational bottlenecks and develop insights using our simulation and optimization software. We are looking for people that highly analytical, great problem solvers and enjoy working with high level thinking teams. What you’ll be doing When it’s all said and done, your job is to interactively work with our clients, help build or tune simulation models, and work with data scientists to deliver results that meet our customer’s needs. A typical day will involve the following activities: Developing use cases and project proposals. Requirements gathering (including interviews, requirements surveys, site visits, workplace analysis, etc.) Conducting simulation model data verification and validation with the research team. Conducting experiments towards finding data relationships and insights. Working in data analysis applications such as Power BI and Excel. Interacting with our clients to present results and facilitate user training. Requirements To ensure success in the role, you will need the following: Experience and formal qualifications in a STEM related discipline, such as Engineering or Mathematics, or equivalent work experience in a related role in Mining, Oil & Gas, or Energy. Experience with simulation analysis projects and data analysis. A demonstrated ability to work with data analysis tools, including MS Excel and BI tools such as Power BI. Driven to be involved in the full project lifecycle within a team environment, including client requirements, data analysis, simulation model development, and software deployment and configuration. Strong communication and problem-solving skills. Self-starter who is comfortable working in a demanding environment. Experience with Python, T-SQL and SQL Database queries is an asset. Project Management designation would be considered a great asset Work environment/Hours/Location This is a full-time position based on a flexible 40-hour work week. We are driven by objectives, however, not timesheets. Stream’s head office is location in Calgary, Alberta with remote workers located across the country in British Columbia, Ontario, and Quebec. We are happy to provide a hybrid work environment, enabling you to work remotely as needed. We encourage a strong collaborative culture and provide workspaces in office for team collaboration, design, planning sessions and social activities. Benefits Company benefits are available to our full-time, permanent employees and include extended health care, dental, long-term disability, AD&D, and life insurance for you and your dependents. The real benefits, in our opinion exist in the ability to become part of a flexible, passionate, and dedicated team where we continue to learn from one another every day. If you love that small-company feel with big-company goals, Stream just might be a fit for you. Background Screening/Intellectual Property As a business intelligence and optimization company, we work with a large amount of customer Intellectual Property. Therefore, successful candidates will be required to complete a background check including employment references, education verification and criminal record check. Come do great things with us! INDONA

Company Description We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable. Job Description We are looking for a Research Analyst to join our Lower 48 Upstream Team in Calgary. This role is uniquely positioned at the front lines of our Lower 48 upstream and commercial analysis. US tight oil is a dynamic and evolving market. Your analysis will underpin our views of Lower 48 upstream oil and gas, a sector central to global oil and gas production and the energy transition. The nature of our work is challenging but also purposeful. In this role, you will lean on a strong analytical foundation to analyze companies and build views of productivity, carbon emissions, ESG, and key operational trends. You will leverage your curiosity, analytical skills, and network to gather valuable insights and author reports which challenge conventional views. You will present these views to a wide range of clients including national and major oil companies, operators, investment banks and institutional investors. About the Day to Day Responsibilities of the Role You will join a team of analysts and subject matter experts that produce views for the US Lower 48 plays and company asset valuations. You will analyze the geologic and economic drivers of a play, assess company strategies and forecast development. You will be highly resourceful and call on a wide range of sources to feed into your analysis. You are comfortable and efficient at manipulating data. You will collaborate with analysts from across teams to develop analysis that is objective, integrated and data driven. You will leverage and build your network, working closely with clients to identify emerging trends. You will share your analysis through written research and regularly present these views to internal stakeholders and clients. You will also form and share opinions on a variety of sector topics as they relate to supply, corporate strategies, ESG, business environment, M&A deals, play economics, government energy policy and regional geopolitics. You will be able to prioritize what matters to clients and the team, having regular interaction with senior business stakeholders. You will ensure that we embrace new technologies or techniques to improve data processes and workflow. #LI-SM1 Qualifications About You and How You Can Excel in this Role Industry experience: 0-5 years in upstream oil and gas, energy finance or consulting. Recent graduates are encouraged to apply An educational background in Engineering, Geosciences, Economics, or Finance Strong analytical skills, curiosity, and a passion for the energy industry Strong writing skills and the ability to put together impactful analysis and create visuals conveying an interesting story, often working to tight deadlines Able to work effectively in a fast-paced work environment and with ambiguity at times Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to build and develop relationships with people at all levels in an organization Effective communication skills with an ability to clearly present a view along with the arguments and data that support it You are looking for a role where you can build on your knowledge and learn from others in a collaborative, commercial and client-centric environment The way in which you work is productive and driven, striving to be best in class Preferred Exposure to economic modeling (DCF), forecasting and/or asset valuations in relation to petroleum economics Experience with Lower 48 unconventional developments Experience working with state reported well data to analyze well designs and productivity trends Additional Information Wood Mackenzie is the global leader in data, analysis and consulting across the energy, chemicals, metals, mining, power and renewables sectors. Founded in 1973, our success has always been underpinned by the simple principle of providing trusted research and advice that makes a difference to our customers. Today we have over 2,000 customers ranging from the largest global energy companies and financial institutions to governments as well as smaller market specialists. Our teams are located around the world. This enables us to stay closely connected with customers and the markets and sectors we cover. Collectively this allows us to offer a compelling combination of global commodity analysis with detailed local market knowledge. We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging. We are committed to creating a workplace that works for you and encourage everyone to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join. Hear what our team has to say about working with us: https://www.woodmac.com/careers/our-people/ We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies! At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions. Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues. But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger. It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems. At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do. At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work. Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer. All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability. http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. Consumer Privacy Notice

The insurance industry is one of the oldest and biggest industries in the world. In some shape or form, insurance is embedded in all our daily activities. The site that you are currently reading this job posting from has insurance. The server hosting this site has insurance as well. You may be asking yourself: I am a Senior Business Data Analyst, why does this matter to me? Because insurance extends to every possible industry on Earth, the nature of insurance products became very complex; hence the compounded layers in the day-to-day operations to sell and manage insurance products. Here at Trufla, we are on a mission to redefine how insurance should be distributed and serviced. We understand that this is not an easy task, and it requires us to push the boundaries of software engineering. That is why we are looking for talented Senior Business Data Analyst's - like you - who thrive through challenges and excel in discovering creative solutions. What is it like to work at Trufla? You will be part of a diversified family that has talented people across the globe driven by the same purpose. Our team is excited to face any obstacle that comes our way, and we take on hardships with a smile. We practice the agile mindset, and believe it’s better to get something done than wait for it to be “perfect”. Learning from our mistakes and putting our best work forward are values we live by every day. You will be an integral part of what we build, but most importantly, we will ask for your input on how we build it. We value everyone’s opinions and encourage open communication. Trufla is always growing, which means there is plenty of opportunity for career growth. We promote education, collaboration, and monthly check-ins to make sure you are on the right track. Senior Business Data Analyst About You As a Senior Business Data Analyst you are familiar with the business intelligence and visualization workflow as well as statistical analysis principles. Your attention to detail and drive to create informative dashboards and reports can be relentless. You understand that in your position you must stand at the center between multiple parties who hold different vocabularies and priorities and become a data-expert and translator. You have tremendous patience and can work with people to help them communicate their own requirements and queries clearly. You have both the skills and knowledge required to mentor other data analysts. As a Senior Business Data Analyst you are flexible in how you communicate ideas – you are comfortable crafting insights into any form your customers and team require in order to understand the concepts and problems. You use one-on-one conversation, conference calls, presentations, meetings, spreadsheets, diagrams, flowcharts, email or complex documents in order to collect and express ideas in the manner your audience prefers. Because of your flexible communication style, you are familiar with various popular applications and business intelligence tools which are commonly used in corporate environments. You are extremely well organized and can balance multiple tasks and competing priorities. RESPONSIBILITIES - Translate business requirements and queries into actionable insights- Develop business intelligence dashboards and reports for both internal and external stakeholders- Work and communicate effectively with various technical (data science, software engineering, etc), and non-technical (leadership, account and project management) teams- Make business decisions independently and execute on deliverables in a self-reliant manner- Lead and mentor Junior/Intermediate Data Analysts QUALIFICATIONS - 3+ years experience providing professional business and data analysis- Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative or business field, preferably business analytics, economics, actuarial science, statistics, or engineering (MBA / graduate degree preferred)- Strong statistical foundation- Excellent verbal, written, and visual communication / presentation skills- Thorough knowledge of data visualization software (Tableau preferred)- Strong organizational skills and attention to detail- Experienced with SQL and other querying languages- Comfortable with Python- Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work well both independently and in a team environment with stakeholders at all levels of the organization- Ability to handle multiple priorities and manage deliverables on tight timeframes- Experience leading and mentoring others- Working knowledge of the insurance industry would be a plus- Automation abilities for multi-tenant analytics and understanding of ETL / data engineering processes would be a plus VALUES & COMPETENCES - Positive attitude and enthusiasm for employee training and development- Flexible and adaptable with proven problem solving ability- High degree of professionalism and integrity- Demonstrated accountability and reliability in the quality and timeliness of work- Ability to work well within a team and independently- Critical thinker with strong attention to details Do you think we match? Apply Now! If you have what it takes, apply to the job through the "Apply Now" button above. *After applying, complete your application by taking the required assessment below: Take Assessment Here Trufla Technology is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to all forms of diversity in the workplace. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply. Job Type: Full-time

Overview: FMC has increased their crop protection business, bringing about a larger manufacturing footprint, enhanced supply chain complexities and a greater demand for tracking, reporting, and analyzing business performance in a timely, accurate manner. This position will ensure that material, operations, and business partner master data is created and maintained in compliance with the Global Design to support our business. This position will support the SC, Operations, Finance, Procurement and Customer Service organizations to ensure that data is provided accurately and timely in the preferred systems and tools as well as manage all master data queries and tasks in compliance with Data Governance global standard processes & procedures for Materials, operations and Business partner data. Reports to the Global Master Data Management Supervisor. Responsibilities: Creating and maintaining material and business partner master data including material masters for all material types and operational data objects (bills of materials, recipes, production versions, resources, quality data, customer, plant, intercompany business partners etc. in the SAP-S/4 Hana system in compliance with Master Data Governance processes & standards. Working on technologies such as SAP S4 Hana, Master Data Governance - Central, and Legacy Workflow Review master data quality reports and take appropriate action to correct deficiencies Implement, maintain, and monitor processes related to master data creation, maintenance, and quality. Guarantee assurance and consistency. Communicate with internal business partners as necessary to obtain information and documentation needed to process requests Possesses strong knowledge of policies and procedures to ensure compliance. Works effectively with teams to determine solutions to problems with ability to handle escalations of issues. Communicates policies, procedures, and standards Communicate decisions to Global Master Data Management Supervisor if the decision involves changes to systems and/or master data policy. Hands-on Data Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) of Master Data Management Provide master data and related subject matter expertise required to test process and/or system improvements, upgrades, service packs, patches, and enhancements as defined by Global Master Data Supervisor. Interface with Regional Data Stewards for escalations on process or technical questions Participate and contribute to daily/regular sub-team and team meetings (Daily Monitoring Systems), Incident/Problem or Tactical meetings. Required Education: Bachelors or advanced degree required, preferably in related field (e.g., Customer Service Customer Operations, Engineering, and Materials Management) or equivalent relevant work experience. Qualifications: At least 1 years of experience in SAP master data maintenance, preferably manufacturing operations, logistics, customer service, commercial, operations or comparable valuable experience from other areas (shared service, marketing, sales, customer service, etc.) Strong MS Excel skills. Experience navigating with a variety internal business stakeholder relationships Strong English-speaking skills, able to speak and write in the English language Agile and able to adapt to fast-paced and continuously changing organization, landscape, scope, process, and schedule (able to work at different shifts) Ability to invoke problem solving and troubleshooting skills when issues arise; able to use best judgement to know when issues need escalation. Ability to properly articulate and communicate issues, problems, and solutions to non-technical customers Strong team player with excellent attention to detail and follow-up skills and the ability to multi-task in a changing environment. Experience communicating intermediate level topics to diverse audiences. Customer Service skills.

Darkhorse Analytics is looking for a data visualization designer with a keen interest in turning data into beautiful, revealing, and engaging visuals.What we do...Darkhorse Analytics is an Edmonton-based consulting firm specializing in predictive analytics and data visualization. Our visualization team is internationally recognized for building custom interactive visualizations with a focus on impact and clarity. We've analyzed hockey, public health, social mobility, housing, and open data, to name a few. We are actively seeking to grow the visualization community's capabilities through our blog with articles and educational material.What you will do...We're looking for someone to be involved with all aspects of the design process, including ideation, UX, wireframing, and visual design. We want someone who is excited by the idea of bringing clarity to the complex and has the design chops to ensure 'clear' doesn't translate to 'boring'; someone who knows how to engage an audience. As a member of the team you will: Hand sketch, wireframe, and mockup application interface and visualization designs Work with clients to understand requirements and develop use cases, user profiles, visual narratives, and guidelines to help bring our vision to life Work with developers and analysts to create stunning custom visualizations for our clients Clean, explore and analyze data sets to validate assumptions and discover new patterns, trends, and insights. Brainstorm and develop new ideas and methods for visualizing client data Polish, tweak and perfect the team's work Help define the design guidelines for our organization Learn from the talented people surrounding you and work hard to help them learn from your unique skill set Collaborate with clients to create effective solutions that exceed expectations Lead internal teams to ensure the vision becomes a reality. What we look for...We're looking for someone who is passionate about their work and the contribution they can make. You genuinely enjoy problem-solving and finding patterns. The harder the challenge, the harder it is to put it down until you crack it. The perfect candidate should: Have experience developing interfaces that are both easy to use and engaging Have a portfolio of designs that express your passion for this field and display your ability to bring clarity to the complex Have an eye for what needs changing in a design and be able to explain how and why those changes will be effective Be able to point to one of your favourite visualizations/interfaces and explain what makes it so good Have the skills in Sketch, Illustrator, Figma or an equivalent application to develop high-quality graphics Be excited to dig into data and ideally have familiarity with Excel, R, Tableau or Python Be unafraid of code and maybe know how to do a little HTML and Javascript yourself Be well-organized, able to communicate with clients, able to effectively manage development team members Believe in our values Working at Darkhorse…Darkhorse is not like other companies. We eschew titles and power structures. Your career is not a ladder from designer, to senior designer, to lead designer, to chief creative officer. Instead, it is a path toward mastery. You will gain skill, confidence, reputation, and influence all the while having substantial autonomy. Your work will be viewed by millions, and your voice will be heard and respected by the wider visualization community. You will have an impact.Darkhorse provides an environment that enables and recognizes success. Our competitive compensation package will include a salary commensurate with your skill and experience. Remote work allowed. Job Type: Full-time

Can you bridge the gap between the business of forestry and the information/data/analysis required to support informed decision making? Are you analytical by nature and understand data, statistics, and a range of analytical tools? Forsite is looking for a Senior Forest Analyst (Edmonton) with solid communication skills to support our clients in Western Canada. The successful applicant will become a key team member supporting the delivery of strategic planning and landbase analysis projects. The position requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience, a post-secondary education with a natural resource management focus and professional forester accreditation (or eligibility). Forsite is a dynamic forest management services company serving government and industry clients since 1987. We are a collaborative project-focused organization that strives to provide opportunity for our employees and value for our clients. Forsite has been SAFE certified since 2007 and is committed to providing a safe work environment. Working within Forsite’s Resource Management and Technology business area you will lead and work with project teams to provide forestry business knowledge and technical analysis that offers cost effective, innovative, and meaningful solutions. You will have exceptional problem solving, written and oral communications skills with an ability to translate complex analysis results into practical knowledge that supports informed decision making. Potential project types include forest management planning, timber supply analysis, cumulative effects analysis, landbase reporting for timber and non-timber resource values, carbon reporting / management strategies, economic viability and operability, inventory projections, growth and yield analysis, strategic silviculture investment analyses, etc. The ideal candidate will have a background in operational forestry, strategic planning, timber supply, growth & yield tools, and GIS analysis. You must have excellent data manipulation skills using databases, geodatabases, and scripting languages (SQL, Python, etc). You will be expected to produce clear written and verbal communications to document project inputs and explain project results. Forsite is looking for the most suitable individual for the position available with the skills and knowledge to effectively complete the duties required of the position. Applications are welcome from anyone. At Forsite, we foster and sustain an environment of diversity & inclusion where everyone can reach their full potential. Only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.
