Your Opportunity: Alberta Health Services (AHS) has an excellent opportunity available on our Continuing Care Audit team. The Data Analyst on the team is a key position reporting to the Senior Consultant, Continuing Care Audit that provides information and decision support to the Provincial Continuing Care (CC) Audit team. The successful candidate will apply their knowledge of the Continuing Care sector in Alberta, performance analytics and reporting at all levels of AHS, from local quality teams to senior leadership, executive and the AHS Board, as well as a variety of external stakeholders. As the Data Analyst, you will work under guidance from the Senior Consultant, while focusing on information management that includes managing the Continuing Care Health Service Standards (CCHSS) audit-related data including collection, analysis and reporting. Using your advanced content knowledge and highly developed analytical skills, you work with databases, spreadsheets, and other analytical software packages to extract data, prepare information/reports for the team and identify trends and potential issues in the data. As the Data Analyst, you serve as the subject matter expert for the team of clinical audit professionals regarding data analysis and performance reporting and provide consultative support to the audit team and a variety of stakeholders, both internal and external to AHS. If you are passionate about the opportunity to help influence and contribute to the development of AHS strategies regarding the delivery of continuing care in Alberta through the sharing of reports, we invite you to apply! Description: Reporting to the Senior Consultant, Continuing Care Audit, you will: Develop and maintain accurate and complete databases for the team. Input audit data and ensure data integrity. Perform advanced qualitative and quantitative data analysis. Develop strategic reporting based on the needs of various stakeholders. Maintain audit tools and audit methodology for the team. Engage others (internal and external) to develop networks to resolve issues and exchange information. Classification: Analyst Union: Exempt Unit and Program: Provincial Continuing Care Audit Team Primary Location: Southport Tower Negotiable Location: Provincial Temporary Employee Class: Temp F/T Benefits FTE: 1.00 Posting End Date: 14-JUN-2022 Date Available: 24-JUN-2022 Temporary End Date: 31-MAR-2023 Hours per Shift: 7.75 Length of Shift in weeks: 2 Shifts per cycle: 10 Shift Pattern: Weekdays Days Off: Saturday/Sunday Minimum Salary: $28.20 Maximum Salary: $48.45 Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable Required Qualifications: Degree in Statistics, Information Management or Business. Minimum four (4) years’ relevant experience. Equivalencies of education and experience will be considered. Additional Required Qualifications: Working knowledge and understanding of the Continuing Care sector in Alberta. Advanced user of Excel, with ability to adapt easily to new software. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Outlook and Teams. Intermediate or advanced data visualization skills (Tableau preferred). Experience working with large databases and varied data sources. Strong organizational skills. Ability to cope with demanding timelines – works well under pressure. Excellent communication, presentation and report writing skills. Knowledge of Continuing Care Health Service Standards. Ability to build rapport with stakeholders. Strong commitment to work collaboratively in a team environment to achieve common goals. Able to work independently. Experience in an organization of significant size, complexity and diversity. Advanced ability to synthesize and analyze data and compile meaningful reports. Must use critical thinking and creative problem solving when approaching tasks. Must be able to adapt to change quickly and incorporate altered business processes. Preferred Qualifications: Experience within the Health care environment while preference will be given for Seniors’ Health or continuing care. Intermediate to advanced understanding of data sources and information sources within continuing care.

The Finance department loves when the math balances out — so we’re looking to add to our team. If you have a nose for numbers and believe your skills and passion match our requirements, you will have our undivided attention and we want to meet you. The Opportunity The Business Solutions team in the Finance department bridges the gap between business needs and technical solutions. This team is responsible for various finance integrated systems used across the institution. Reporting to the Supervisor, Business Solutions, Finance, you will work closely with the other Business Analysts and other stakeholders across the institution to provide both technical and business process support for the Banner ERP and all other technical systems both used and supported within the department. You will work with leaders in the department to refine and enhance current processes and assist in the development of a technology plan for the Finance department. This position will be the main support for the Banner ERP Finance module, our banking applications and integrations, the feeds from other modules at SAIT (employee, student, and A&D). Expect to be a contributing member of fast paced and exciting projects in the Finance department. Among other support related activities, this role will focus on troubleshooting any issues, documentation, training, support integrated systems reconciliation with the Finance ledgers, and all of this while identifying areas for process improvement and system enhancement. The Role Business Analysis Planning and Monitoring Plan stakeholder engagement sessions. Identify the right people to get the job done. Plan and document the ongoing management of business requirements in the department. Identify areas for improvement in the department. Represent the Finance department in discussions with Information Technology Services (ITS) with respect to implementation of additional functionality and modules within Banner and integrated applications. Support the configuration and enhancement of Ellucian Banner and all other systems to support the goals and processes of the department. Elicitation and Collaboration Build and maintain collaborative working relationships with key business owners, Banner Systems Analysts in ITS, and Business Analysts in other Banner functional areas. Collaborate with ITS and in other departments for overall improvements and enhancements to business processes and configuration of Banner. Coordinate with owners of other Finance systems to develop knowledge of systems and understanding of integrations with Banner. Contribute to the development of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), quick reference guides (QRGs), and other supporting aides for staff. Collaborate with process owners inside and outside of the department to gather business requirements and understand challenges for use in design sessions. Requirements Life Cycle Management Analyze business and user needs, documenting requirements and revising existing system logic difficulties as necessary. Review system updates and assist with fit/gap analysis, make recommendations on updates that will benefit business processes. Strategy Analysis Monitor Banner provider (Ellucian) website (Banner Hub) for releases notes and system patches while networking with other Banner User Institutions. Provide recommendations for enhancements and improvements based on this information. Research and resolve difficult or technical problems presented by using knowledge of common problems and of department functions. End-to-end knowledge of Accounts Receivable critical business processes, dependencies, and related risks. Troubleshoot problems and suggest solutions; resolve routing questions and problems and refer more complex issues to higher levels. Assist in bringing maturity and rigor to the department’s process, data, and reporting. Requirements Analysis and Design Definition Recommend and participate in the development of new procedures and policies related to operations of the Finance department. Contribute to the development and training staff during the roll-out of new systems and processes. Assist in the documentation and design of specifications for reports and dashboard that support business processes and decision making. Solution Evaluation Support end users to perform key business operations in Banner Production environment and test environments. Perform system testing for new solutions, defect resolution and upgrades. Examine technical solution designs with Information Technology Services (ITS) and contribute to the design of technical solutions to support the business needs. Qualifications Minimum Post-secondary degree or diploma in Information Systems, Technology, or Business 2 or more years of direct experience with financial systems. Preference will be given to candidates with both business and technical Finance module ERP experience. Experience with data management, business process improvement or software development an asset. Experience as a Business Analyst in a Project Management lifecycle Demonstrated familiarity with project management and change management principles. Strong communication skills – written and verbal Strong relationship building and relationship management skills Ability to stay calm and focused while on complex projects with tight timelines Preferred 5 or more years of direct experience with financial systems. Preference will be given to candidates with both business and technical Finance module ERP experience. Business Analyst designation or certificate is desirable Advanced understanding of systems analysis, ERP management of Ellucian Banner products within a post-secondary. Meet Benevity Benevity's award-winning corporate purpose software empowers companies and their people to take social action on the issues and causes they care about. Through giving, volunteering, grantmaking and positive actions, we help 650+ clients (and counting!) build better cultures and engage their employees and customers to create greater social and business impact. We're also one of the first B-Corps in Canada, meaning we're as committed to purpose as we are to profits. We are seeking a highly engaged Data Analyst, Client Success Management to support a dynamic, evolving and rapidly growing Client Success Management Team as we scale. In this full-time position, you will report to the Manager, Revenue Analytics with our Client Success Management Leadership team as your main stakeholders. You will also work cross-functionally and build relationships within the "Go To Market" organization (Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success) as well as Finance. You will act as a business partner to the Client Success Management leadership team, working cross-functionally across the client journey to surface insights that can help improve the client experience. You will improve operating processes and accomplish high-priority projects. The most important attributes for success include a deep curiosity rooted in data combined with the ability to partner across a disparate set of stakeholders. What you will do: Develop deep understanding of the metrics that improve Client Success and build the analytics around it with the goal of driving insights to actions. Partner with the Client Success Management leadership team to determine and define requirements as well as project scope. Ensure data quality across multiple systems of record and flag areas of continuous improvement for our data lake (ea. Salesforce, Gainsight, …) Own the relationship with the Client Success Management leadership team, be the subject matter expert, and address deep-dive questions with follow up insights and recommended actions. Own and champion high impact projects across the Client Success Management Organization. Own various special data-focused projects to support planning/forecasting, and ongoing operations. Support day-to-day inquiries from the team, providing prompt and efficient resolution to a wide range of issues and developing operational processes. What you bring: This position requires a Bachelors' degree in finance, accounting, business administration or related field and/or minimum of 5 years' experience in data analysis, reporting and process improvement preferably in SaaS operations Knowledge of data and data manipulation in typical SaaS products such as Salesforce, and traditional spreadsheet software such as Excel Experience using analytical frameworks, data, and tools to work on complex projects, facilitate alignment across multiple senior stakeholders, and reach, actionable answers to challenging and ambiguous problems. Well-developed analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills are required Prior Salesforce and Tableau experience will be preferred Prior Adaptive or similar Finance Reporting tool will be a plus Comfort and experience working with very large, complex data sets is a must Ability to make independent decisions, manage projects and present findings Results-oriented individual who is conscientious of their quality of work and has ability to work across the organization Strong personal and interactive skills with all levels in the organization Ability to envision the "big picture" while managing the details and focusing on multiple objectives or assignments Promotes teamwork and cooperation to resolve conflicts and ensure achievement of organizational objectives Responds to shifting priorities while maintaining progress of regularly scheduled work Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment Demonstrated organizational skills with the ability to set priorities, meet deadlines, and work in a multi-disciplinary team environment Manages multiple projects at once while paying strict attention to detail Discover your purpose at work If you're a passionate problem solver and want to put your skills to use helping the world's coolest companies do more good in the world, Benevity is the place for you. You'll be part of a team with a 99% client retention rate — the highest in the SaaS space — so you can learn and grow with the best. You'll get that competitive salary, flexible health benefits, mental health support, a generous bonus program, stock options, a hybrid office/home work environment and so much more. Plus, Benevity's very own MyGoodness program inspires our people to donate, volunteer and take action for the causes and issues they care about. If you want meaning, purpose and growth, you belong at Benevity. Join a company where DEIB isn't a buzzword The diverse backgrounds, experiences, skills and passions of our people make it possible for us to keep innovating as the market leader in our space. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging are part of Benevity's DNA. You'll see the impact of our massive investment in DEIB daily—from our Black Employee Network making space for us to have difficult conversations to our Pride events and the exceptional diversity on our leadership and tech teams. We strive to build a strong culture of Belonging so that every Benevity-ite feels included and can thrive as their authentic selves — in a place where everyone has an equitable opportunity to shine! Here at Benevity, we are committed to creating a culture of belonging and that starts with a fair and accessible hiring process. Any candidates with disabilities who may require accommodations throughout the hiring or assessment process, are encouraged to reach out to accommodations@benevity.com. Job_Title: Data Analysts - Pipeline Inspection (MFL/GEO), All Levels
Summary: Onstream Pipeline Inspection Services Inc is a growing provider of inline inspection services to pipeline operators in Canada and the USA. Due to continued growth, Onstream is now accepting applications for the positions of Data Analysts (ILI, All Levels), based in Calgary, AB. The successful candidates will show a progressive work history of ILI Analysis along with having an analytical background, ability to learn/use proprietary software, and apply technical concepts quickly. This position requires the analysis of data recorded by Onstream Pipeline’s MFL/Caliper/IMU in-line inspection (ILI) tools, correlation to verification measurements, and final report generation. We have a fulltime position available for a Business Intelligence Analyst in our Edmonton head office. The terms detail oriented, an i_ndependent thinker_ and an ‘out of the box’ problem solver describe you well. You are passionate about turning data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. In order to be successful, the candidate must be able to: · Design and develop complex datasets, reports and dashboards to support recurring business needs · Provide data visualization expertise that facilitates business understanding of outcomes and recommendations · Apply a variety of data science techniques and algorithms to build out complex models and data driven solutions · Critically requirements · Lead or coordinate small, informal team(s) to expedite completion of various projects · Contribute to developing business intelligence and data modelling standards and guidelines · Knowledge of data warehouse, data mart and database technologies, standards, and methodologies · Strong technical knowledge and experience with Power BI, SQL Server and Microsoft Excel · Experience with gathering and documenting business requirements · Demonstrated communication and presentation skills for an Executive audience · Technical knowledge and experience with Python, R, GIS software and the knowledge and experience to implement machine learning algorithms are an asset · Certified Business Intelligence Professional (CBIP) certification is an asset · Experience working in the insurance industry would also be an asset Working at Peace Hills Peace Hills understands that by reducing work-life struggles, individuals can enjoy a healthier lifestyle while improving productivity at work. Let’s impact lives for the better! Alberta Blue Cross® is Alberta based, not-for-profit and dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experience and community leadership. We’re committed to providing the best health coverage to over 1.8 million members and take an active role in promoting the wellness of all Albertans. We believe in what we do—and place trust in our employees to deliver our vision. Working at Alberta Blue Cross® means having a career where you’ll be recognized for your contributions. We value diversity, encourage our employees to maintain a healthy work-life balance and provide opportunities for training and career growth. OVERVIEW: Reporting to the Director of Analytics, Research & Pricing, the Pricing Analyst will be primarily responsible for supporting the broader CX and Marketing Team in the development and management of Group and Individual Products. The position is accountable for processing information requests pertaining to financial performance, modelling, compiling statistical information, investigating and solving data integrity issues, preparing reports and analyzing trend information. WHAT YOU WILL DO: Utilize in-depth knowledge of corporate data structures and reporting environments to produce pricing solutions, with the goal to provide quality information for fact-based decision making. Collaborate with various stakeholders to gather requirements, perform analysis and develop meaningful reporting. Develop and maintain a wide variety of business-critical financial models (daily, weekly, monthly and ad hoc to meet business requirements) using Excel, Access, SQL and Business Intelligence Tools. Collect, trend, analyze and report statistical data. Respond to incoming ad hoc pricing requests around new and existing products. Maintain an awareness of changing business needs and recommend enhancements to rating methodology for both quotations and renewal business. Analyze current processes and implement solutions to streamline and improve productivity. WHAT YOU WILL HAVE: Bachelor’s degree in quantitative discipline (i.e., Actuarial Science, Statistics, Economics, or Mathematics). Actuarial designation (FSA, FCAS, ASA, ACAS) would be considered an asset. Skilled in using database software (Access, SQL, Oracle or another server database platform). Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel and Access is required. Understanding of benefit plans and Alberta Blue Cross products is preferred. Excellent analytical, organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills as well as attention to detail are required. Ability to interpret data and convert mathematical findings into pertinent business insights. Ability to multi-task and prioritize activities in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment. Ability and desire to work independently and communicate effectively at all levels in the organization. Demonstrated ability to contribute within a team environment. Alberta Blue Cross® is an inclusive employer committed to a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We empower and are advocates for our employees by welcoming, respecting and valuing their unique perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the opportunity to work in an innovative, high-energy team-focused environment. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, apply online at careers.ab.bluecross.ca COVID-19 Vaccination Notice: Alberta Blue Cross has a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that applies to all of its employees. As a condition of employment, successful job applicants will be asked to confirm their COVID-19 vaccination status and may be required to provide proof of a valid negative COVID-19 test or a valid exemption pursuant to applicable human rights law if not fully vaccinated.

What do you think of when you hear the name MNP? Most likely tax and accounting, but as one of Canada’s largest consulting organizations, we’re so much more! We’re also serious about technology. At MNP Digital, we’re a team of highly skilled and creative thinkers that continuously support and learn from each other. We pride ourselves on translating our clients’ challenges into real results by leveraging technology – and that all starts with having the right people to deliver. We’ve created an environment where you’ll continuously grow, always have a voice and collaborate on work that’s meaningful and fulfilling. If you’re ready to take your career into your own hands, you’ve come to the right place. You Can Expect To: Collaborate with a dynamic team Contribute in a fast-paced environment Learn from our professionals Grow your abilities and your confidence Gain an understanding of MNP’s services, businesses and industry Tackle multifaceted problems Be challenged and exposed to a range of projects Have a flexible office and home work arrangement Have fun! Job Duties include: Consulting Services Design Help the team design service plans around client’s needs advertised or offered by potential clients by: Using previous proposals to create the base of a response, Checking our proposal content and formatting against client requests to ensure we meet and exceed their expectations and needs, and Helping ensure proposals are submitted in a timely and efficient manner. Engagement Planning Collaborate with the client engagement team prior to commencement of client work to discuss roles and responsibilities, risk areas, materiality, and deadlines. Monitor project timelines against targets, adjust where necessary, and advise clients of project status and seek clarification on discrepancies where applicable. Fulfill project management and coordination role, tracking project budgets, deliverables and scope. Conducting Business Analysis Assist in the delivery of Digital Advisory services from both a business perspective. Assist in the develop digital strategy and implementation roadmap, and Perform business analysis including: Gathering information by participating in the preparation and facilitation of interviews and focus groups, Preparing correspondence, technical reports, and surveys, Conducting detailed research, interpretation, and analysis of the data gathered, Analyze financial data and perform cost-benefit analysis, and Supporting the design, development, formatting, and proof-reading of the resultant reports, proposals, and presentations. Contribute Positively to MNP’s Workplace Culture Develop a thorough understanding of MNP’s services, businesses, and industry through experiential learning with clients. Contribute to the development of new ideas and approaches to improve work processes. Participate in a hybrid work environment that contributes to a balanced lifestyle and high standard of team wellness. Responsibilities Facilitate and run effective meetings Requirement elicitation from stakeholders via workshops Business process modeling of the current and to-be state Requirement analysis, defining all types of requirements to define the business need Requirements management and prioritization Organize and coordinate stakeholder engagement System integration analysis, including creating system interface specifications Data analysis and design, creating logical data models and specifying lookups Solution design and prototyping; creating user interface specifications Be familiar with standard BA techniques as defined in the BABOK Engage business stakeholders and write formal documentation such as business cases, requirements definition specifications, project glossaries, non-functional requirements specifications and communication plans Engage developers and solution implementer and write formal technical documentation such as request for proposals (RFP) test cases, technical specifications and technical models MyRewards@MNP More than a paycheque, MNP is proud to offer customized rewards for our team members. With a focus on health and wealth, we provide an extensive list of benefits that support our unique culture and foster work-life integration. Our MyRewards@MNP program offers benefits that allow you to thrive at work and outside of the office. Be rewarded with generous paid time off including 4 personal days, firm sponsored social events, a group pension plan with 4% matching contribution, voluntary savings products, bonus program eligibility, a wellness subsidy, health and dental benefits, mental health resources, exclusive access to perks and discounts, professional development assistance, learning opportunities through MNP University, a flexible ‘Dress For Your Day’ environment and more!

AMA: YOU never MET A PROBLEM YOU COULDN’T SOLVE. Posted: 2022-05-30 Closing: When Filled Location: Edmonton South In fact, you don’t know if you’ve ever met a problem because you only meet opportunities. You love the thought of turning ideas into real applications. You’re always on the hunt for innovative new technologies that can help people work smarter not just faster. You have a knack for data and details, without losing sight of the big picture. You’ve got the skills to coordinate a project from start to finish; you work well with a broad group of people and communicate clearly every step of the way. WHAT MOVES YOU You’re kind of obsessed with finding simple solutions to complicated problems, and you love explaining them in an uncomplicated way that helps others see the possibilities too. When it comes to documenting processes, workflows and test scripts, you know the value of words and pictures and the importance of making sure everyone understands — even the technically-challenged people on the team. Your curiosity kicks into high gear when you talk to clients and end users because you’ve got to fully understand the business problem they are trying to solve before you can offer solutions. You handle even the tightest deadlines with a cool head and clear vision. You’ve always been passionate about how technology can help solve business problems. You enjoy being the middle man — the glue between the people that use a system and the technical team that builds it. You love to share thoughts and ideas — after all, you know that two heads are always better than one and you understand the real value of teamwork. WHAT YOU’VE DONE You have a college diploma in information technology, business or an equivalent. Even better, you’ll have BA certification. You have at least three years under your belt and are ready for you’re next big challenge. WHAT YOU’LL DO Report to the Associate Vice President, Digital Member Experience - Member and Travel Services. Gather, define and document business, financial and operational requirements. Research and propose processes or technology-based solutions to meet business needs. Help manage requests for new technology solutions or enhancements to existing technology. Analyze the effectiveness of existing systems and develop improvement strategies. Plan and coordinate technical/user testing, deployment, client/user acceptance and reporting. Lead or support projects. Please note, during the pandemic our Marketing and Analyst teams are working remotely from home. WHAT YOU'LL GET Competitive salary. Flexible benefits. Outstanding employer-paid Pension Plan. Great AMA discounts. Unlimited learning opportunities. Paid vacation and floater day. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

They assist in investigating data quality issues, respond to and improve data and system reliability, and support ad hoc analysis, reporting, and inquiries. They are relied upon to be a data source Subject Matter Expert within their assigned area. Role Responsibilities: Database and systems development and maintenance (75%) Maintain SQL servers and databases. Build and maintain tools for Data Analysts. Write scripts to automate processes. Support and maintain Visual Studio and legacy VB6 programs Perform Quality Assurance actions on data, ensuring extreme levels of accuracy and consistency. Explore data error issues, recommend improvements. Monitor and optimize high-traffic indices Integrate new systems and new data from multiple sources, Assist with report development (10%) Create and maintain Excel-based reporting. Process change requests on existing data sets. Meet ad hoc user needs Work with customers to ensure requirements are being met, Address user concerns, questions, and problems. Other Functions (15%) Software development and life cycle management of in-house developed programs Open communication with Data Architecture Manager to manage deadlines, project coordination, workloads, problem resolution, and general support. Assist, fill in, back up, and support Business Services as needed Responsible for compliance with all Policies and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) comprising Sysco’s Food Safety Program, specific for the assigned role. Assist Food Safety Program Manager in ensuring compliance to Sysco’s Food Safety Program that leads to compliance with third party certification and customer requirements. Is willing to work safely with minimal environmental impact and understands the importance of reporting all hazards, incidents, and environmental spills immediately to their Supervisor. Understands that they play an integral role in their own safety and that of their colleagues and is willing to speak out when hazards are present. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications/Skills/Job Requirements: Minimum 3+ years of experience maintaining databases, creating software, and/or programming TSQL procedures. Completion of post-secondary education required. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Analytics, or similar is preferred. Strong comprehension for writing SQL, TSQL, and working with databases. Experience with MSSQL 2016+ Experience with Visual Studio and/or VB6 programming required Self-reliant exploring, extracting, analyzing, and presenting information with Excel (PivotTables, writing VBA code, etc.). Strong communication skills; ability to effectively communicate with internal and external teams High degree of trust handling confidential information Excellent organizational and project management skills, including the ability to execute multiple initiatives at the same time Flexible; readily accepts change; open to new ideas Proactive, self-directed, with the ability to structure a weekly schedule to be successful Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate with all levels within the Sysco organization. Must be extremely detail and deadline oriented, a fast learner, and can handle multiple tasks. Internal candidates apply via the Career Centre on your HR Portal / ADP Workforce Now. As part of PETRONAS, a Fortune 500® company, we produce and deliver energy solutions in a responsible and sustainable manner. We pride ourselves on our commitment to our employees, partnerships with First Nations and our respect for the environment. People are fundamental to our success. We foster a culture that depends on trust, honesty and empowerment. Because of this, our people are able to collaborate, innovate, find opportunities and make them happen. With our ambitious growth plans, we are looking for new team members who are up to the challenge of making PETRONAS Canada a global leader of unconventional energy, all while making an impact in the industry and communities in which we work. *THE ROLE:* We’re expanding our Supply Chain Management (SCM) team and have an opportunity for a Systems & Master Data Analyst, located in Calgary, Alberta, reporting to the Manager, SCM Optimization. The Systems & Master Data Analyst is responsible for providing functional support for our recently implemented GEP SMART software and upcoming ERP implementation. This includes: stewardship of SCM data maintenance in all applications (SAP, GEP SMART and Enverus OpenInvoice) and supplier profile management & communication. This role will also support the implementation and continuous improvement of enterprise applications to ensure systems are effectively meeting business objectives. This individual will collaborate with internal and third-party stakeholders and vendors. The analyst will provide ongoing application, data and integration platform support and responsibilities may include performing changes to business application configuration and programs. Recommendations made by this position result in changes in methods, processes, system configurations and operating procedures.HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE: Systems & Training Lead and design SCM system enhancements and workflow adjustments and act as SCM system interface troubleshooter Work with Digital Technology Services (DTS) and operational teams to validate technical processes and system performance to provide continuous improvement Develop content for SCM systems training, deliver training and provide guidance to system users Respond to and resolve user problems, requests and issues within defined service levels Detailed knowledge of standard ERP processes to support supply chain projects (procurement, manufacturing, warehousing, inventory management, etc.) Review, analyze and define current/future state system processes and develop functional and technical specifications, diagrams, and flowcharts for identified development, system modifications, and implementation tasks, configures platform workflows. Collaborate with technical and subject matter experts to analyze trade-offs between usability and performance needs. Act as point of escalation for SCM team to provide support for business application incidents and requests Develop and maintain technical documentation, including technical support procedures and reference materials Master Data Management Facilitate system implementation and data migration tasks in support of projects Test and validate data transformations and load results Develop material/service master data best practices and guidelines standard, including abbreviation list and data dictionary, to enable effective analytics Maintain master data by analyzing and applying appropriate data review and cleanse master data Stewardship of SCM data in all applications (SAP, GEP-SMART and Enverus OpenInvoice) Understand data mapping and data flow within the supported systems Supplier Communication Coordinate supplier onboarding/offboarding requests and approving profile updates Support in planning and executing the testing for future functionality deployments Support the sustainment of Supplier Master Data WHAT YOU BRING: University degree in Business, SCM, Information Technology or related field Minimum 10 years of experience in eProcurement systems and master data management. This includes systems like Enverus OpenInvoice, SAP Ariba, GEP SMART or equivalent Previous ERP/e-procurement implementation experience is strongly desirable Some experience in managing data migration efforts including data mapping and loading Solid understanding of relational databases, entity-relationship diagrams, data normalization, data analytics, data migrations, business intelligence Ability and passion for training delivery, troubleshooting challenges, as well as collaboration with internal and external stakeholders Job postings are typically only open for applications for two weeks so please submit your resume today. WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR TEAM: Flexible arrangement options including working from home and a compressed work week with Friday afternoons off (office-based roles) Dress for your day - a casual yet professional environment Ability to contribute to a dynamic organization with large growth ambitions Competitive compensation and bonus programs Top tier benefit package, including a generous Health Spending Account and Savings Plan Making a positive difference in our communities through volunteerism, community support and providing opportunities to those in the areas where we operate Annual employee-directed charity donation program Support for training and professional development PETRONAS Canada would like to thank all applicants for their interest in joining our team; however only the candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Job Type: Full-time

Master Data Management Analyst Job Number : 43842 Reporting to the Manager, Data Management and Governance, the Master Data Management Analyst works as a core member of the corporate Data Management & Governance Unit to ensure that the City’s data is leveraged to achieve corporate objectives and goals. Data Management encompasses the people, processes and technology required to create a consistent and proper handling of an organization's data and information across the corporation. Working with key stakeholders, the Master Data Management Analyst’s primary focus will be to assist leading and developing data governance and management methods that can be leveraged by staff and citizens, while simultaneously ensuring the necessary framework and processes are in place. This work will also require a significant experience in designated data governance and management technologies including an awareness of integrations with adjoining technologies or applications. This position generally specializes in multiple technologies. This position leads system/solution design activities for applications within their scope and enhancements to large and complex systems. The staff may participate in large multisystem solution design and implementations. Your success will be measured by achieving timely results in a respectful, inclusive and service-minded style. With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments to be Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will: Implement data management strategies, frameworks, processes, standards based on research and analysis of current trends Build strong relationships across the Branch, Department and other areas of the City to ensure alignment and support integrated data governance and management Help drive, implement and maintain best practices across master data domains Drive end to-end solution design, technical spec preparation, realization and deployment for master data solutions Independently take up and participate in requirement gathering, document preparation, technical design and development approach Have a functional & technical understanding of one or more master data objects with respect to business capabilities Have the ability to work with business customers to establish the master data objects governance processes Be able to translate business requirements into functional and technical design documents Accept responsibility for creation of test cases using in-depth technical analysis of both functional and non-functional specifications Qualifications : A related Bachelor degree and a minimum of four (4) years combined experience in business analysis, requirements gathering, strategic planning, conceptual and functional designing Certification/coursework in strategic planning, data governance, data management, public administration, project management, change management, computer science or other professional designation would be an asset. Demonstrated experience with implementing data management initiatives Demonstrated experience leading and managing change and empowering resources to achieve outcomes Demonstrated experience in technical and business communications, including the ability to effectively consult with clients on a delivery range of business activities Experience in Tableau software, Business Intelligence suite of tools such as Web Intelligence, BI Launchpad, Data Services, information design tools, data modeling, dimensional modeling, Crystal Reports is highly desirable Knowledge in Scripting Language such as T-SQL, PL/SQL is highly desirable Experience in Oracle RDBMS or SQLBase is highly desirable Experience in End to-End Solution design, technical spec preparation, realization and deployment for SAP Master Data solution (i.e. Material Master) using SAP Ecosystem (SAP MDG, SAP S/4, SuccessFactors etc.) is highly desirable Experience in cloud environment is highly desirable Strong conflict resolution and negotiation skills with experience in solving complex and sensitive issues Strong verbal and written communication skills, including report writing and presenting Hire is dependent upon a Police Information Check satisfactory to the City of Edmonton Embrace the Cultural Commitments of Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent and foster an environment that encourages others to do the same Applicants may be tested The City of Edmonton is committed to inclusive, respectful and equitable workplaces that represent the communities we serve. We continuously improve our systems, policies and practices to remove barriers and ensure our employees, in all their diversity, can succeed. JOB SUMMARY This position is the point of referral for all transaction-based customer issues referred by Customer Care Representatives or by Third Party escalation. Being the last line of resolution, this role is responsible for the complete, accurate and timely resolution of escalated customer issues. The highly complex issues require multiple cross-functional skill sets to achieve resolution. The specialist must demonstrate strong analytical problem solving abilities, possess a knowledge of market transactions and be able to independently resolve issues. Must also demonstrate the ability to learn quickly, apply new methods of resolution and assume broader execution capabilities currently distributed throughout the operations organization. Essential Duties and Responsibilities · Resolve highly complex issues concerning residential customer accounts · Requires strong analytical skills to review data, analyze information, diagnose a resolution and perform all system and/or market corrections Requires the ability to execute complex resolution paths that require various skills currently exhibited in organizations such as Transaction Management, Billing, Credit, and the Utility Commission Team Requires interaction with market entities such as the Distributors and other competitive retailers in efforts to fully research, diagnose and resolve customer issues Responsible for the complete internal and external (market) resolution of all issues assigned. Requires extensive research and review of accounts to determine the origin of customer issues identified within SAP, which includes enrollments, meter reads, move-outs, switches, metering issues, etc. Interact with customers who are typically more difficult to satisfy, must be able to diffuse customer frustrations to resolve issue quickly and accurately Requires the ability to work/interface with a wide variety of teams in order to centralize transaction related communications with external parties and resolve customer issues Requires strong mathematics skills in order to perform bill credit calculations based off of research and diagnosis of the issue Review and understand customer’s payment and consumption usage history in order to calculate adjustments to process invoices and/or render corrected invoices to customers Requires the ability to accurately document the issue classification and error origination in order to aid in the tracking of issue trends Requires the ability to maintain a balance of new daily issues and ‘pended’ issues Responsible for the complete, accurate and timely resolution of every issue assigned EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE The minimum education requirements are: High school diploma or equivalent math and English skills required. Bachelor’s degree preferred The minimum experience requirements are: 2 to 3 years experience working directly with customers in a problem solving, issues resolution or other experience in resolving customer issues required Experience with SAP/CRM in development or execution is strongly preferred Experience in performing advanced research and diagnosis of customer issues is strongly preferred SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES · Excellent problem solving skills and ability to use good judgment to make decisions · Possess exceptional people skills enabling effective interaction with internal, external customers, peers, and management · Must have knowledge regarding how to perform advanced research and diagnosis on customer issues · Strong analytical skills and desire to research problems to seek resolution · Exhibits an advanced level of understanding deregulation and systems, while utilizing internal and external processes for effective customer issue resolution · Exceptional verbal and written communication skills · Exceptional customer service abilities to handle difficult customers · Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite to include Excel · Work effectively in a team environment · Strong time management and organizational skills needed PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS · Long and irregular hours · Use of a PC, computer terminal and/or telephone over 4 hours a day · Operating in a fast-paced professional office environment Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Benefits: Dental care Extended health care Flexible schedule Life insurance Paid time off Work from home Schedule: 8 hour shift

Job_Title: Data Management Analyst, Social Serving Sector
Summary: Use your Data Management skills to facilitate PolicyWise's research projects Don’t miss this exciting role that inspires change and action for improving the lives of people! Enjoy a competitive remuneration package, PLUS a great host of benefits About Us PolicyWise is a charitable, non-profit corporation established in 2003 to support the development of effective policies, programs, and services to benefit the well-being of children, families, and communities. We have a reputation for collaboration, inclusion, and broad stakeholder engagement approaches and strategies. Our research and policy team has an in-depth understanding of the domains of well-being, the child and youth serving sector, provincial and local service delivery contexts, and the application of knowledge across these sectors and systems. Our Vision Children, youth, and families thrive in respectful, safe, and supportive environments shaped by wise decisions. Our Mission To inform, identify, and promote effective social policy and practice to improve the well-being of children & youth, families, and communities. For more information about our work, please visit our website: www.policywise.com About the Opportunity Currently, we are seeking a full-time Data Management Analyst to join our team, in either Edmonton or Calgary, Alberta. Reporting to the Research and Policy Manager, you are responsible for conducting a wide variety of collection, analyses, and management of data from various social and health services, utilizing advanced understanding of data collection infrastructure, analytical, and quantitative skills to support PolicyWise’s research projects. PolicyWise is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and recognizes that those ideals are embedded in governance and organizational performance. As an essential element of their culture, PolicyWise welcomes the unique contributions that candidates can bring in terms of diverse backgrounds and lived experiences, and encourages applications that represent the diversity of the community they serve. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Data Management: Co-designing data collection protocols with non-profit partners that match service delivery and research needs Working with large sets of data from a variety of government and non-profit partners Maintaining and optimizing databases Performing complex data commands (data linking, linkage quality assessment, and data manipulation) Supporting with consent forms, information sharing, governance to promote effective and sustainable data management Building capacity among partners to practice good data management Developing and monitoring data governance policies Conducting needs and opportunity assessments to inform data collection and data management planning Application of relevant privacy, legislation and ethical considerations to guide data collection across sectors Data Collection and Analysis: Supporting project teams in data analysis, preparing tables/charts/graphs, and presentations Analyzing quantitative data (including administrative data) Developing data capture tools (surveys, forms, etc.) and data management plans Documenting processes Synthesizing and summarizing data patterns Writing and collaborating drafts and summaries Applying advanced analytics skills in large/complex datasets More About You To qualify, you will need a Bachelor's degree, with a very strong quantitative emphasis. A Master's Degree in any related field will be considered an asset. Due to the nature of the role, we require a strong understanding, interactions, and experience in the social serving sector (e.g. non-profits, children/youth groups, Indigenous communities, and other marginalized groups). Moreover, you will be required to visit the communities you serve from time to time for data collection and as such, a valid Driver's License will be required. In addition, we require strong skills, experience, and knowledge in the following: Managing large datasets and using statistical packages (SPSS, SAS, R software, Stata etc.) Quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills Attention to detail and good interpersonal skills Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks Desire and ability to learn and develop new skills Demonstrated computer skills (e.g., advanced Excel, data visualization software) Ability to work both individually and as a team member Above all, we are seeking a socially-conscious individual who is eager to use their skills to make a difference and provide value towards our clients, the communities we serve, and our valuable programs. For the safety and well-being of our clients and employees, we require proof of COVID-19 vaccination before commencing employment. Accommodations will be made for those exempt from the COVID-19 vaccination, based on grounds protected by relevant human rights law. About the Benefits In exchange for your hard work and dedication, you will receive a highly competitive annual salary plus a great host of benefits, including: 50% employer-paid extended medical, dental, and vision benefits $200 reimbursement for parking or transit Work from home / remote work hybrid until further notice $500 allowance to set up home office at the start of hire 3 weeks vacation Holiday break during Christmas and New Year on top of vacation time And that's not all! You will be welcomed into a supportive and highly collaborative environment. If you think you've got the skills to take on this rewarding and challenging role, apply today!

Opportunity The Client Relations team plays the lead role in delivering service excellence to 32 diverse client groups across the Province of Alberta. The team works with each client and multiple teams across AIMCo to attain the objectives identified in client investment policies, including strategic asset allocation and performance targets. The team also collaborates with Risk and Investment Strategy teams in informing clients on a range of topics from risk tolerance to providing insight on new investment strategies or market events as they happen. As a Analyst focusing on the data aspect within the Clients Relations team, you will gain exposure to client reporting, develop advanced-level presentations, and gain an extensive understanding of the organization and our clients. You will leverage your technical skill set with coding, modelling, and data visualization to develop valuable client and internal reports and communications. Your passion for data analytics will allow the Client Relations team to deliver timely, precise, and advanced analytics to our clients. Responsibilities Compiling client decks and collating information for client queries from data available through reports, commentaries and discussions, utilizing AIMCo’s data systems to extract and analyze client data and provide valuable insight related to client portfolios Transforming data sets, quantitative and qualitative analysis into compelling visuals to enhance client presentations, including ad-hoc reporting to clients and deeper analytics of client feedback Automating current process to increase efficiency for the client relations teams Creating client profiles and fund fact sheets Collaborating efficiently and effectively across the Client Relations team and AIMCo to deliver on important initiatives such as the Client Portal Embracing accountability, enhanced decision making and integrity to deliver on our cultural commitment of Doing Business the Right Way Ideal Candidate Qualifications University degree in Finance, Business, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Quantitative/Data Analytics, Information Technology or a related field Experience in business development or client service, preferably in financial services is an asset Well versed with data visualization tools such as Power BI and Tableau Proficiency in Python, SQL, R will be considered an asset Demonstrates a clear ability to analyze, interpret and articulate financial data. Superior problem-solving skills, exceptional initiative and thrives under pressure and deadlines Familiarity with Client Relations Management System is a plus Advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite Knowledge of institutional investments, portfolio management, pension and endowment financing is advantageous Demonstrates a strong commitment to AIMCo’s core values of excellence, transparency, humility, integrity and collaboration, and inspires the same in others Success Measures Your success will be seen in your ability to work independently and collaboratively to create and enhance reports and communications, as well as in your contributions to Client Relations projects and initiatives. Benefits and Rewards Exciting special project work and stretch assignments Ongoing training, coaching and educational reimbursement programs Health care spending account and onsite fitness facilities About AIMCo AIMCo is one of Canada’s largest and most diversified investment managers, with over $168 billion of assets under management for 32 clients, a diverse group of Alberta public sector pension plans, endowment funds, and government accounts representing all Albertans. We are guided by the core values of excellence, transparency, humility, integrity and collaboration. AIMCo is mindful and responsive to actively evaluating, assessing and optimizing risk to achieve superior performance for Albertans. We believe that every employee is empowered and accountable for managing risk. AIMCo is committed to building and supporting a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment. We believe that fostering a culture of belonging allows our people to bring their best selves to work. We actively encourage applications from persons who identify as women, visible minorities, persons with disabilities, Indigenous peoples and members of marginalized sexual orientations, gender identities and gender expressions. Next Steps We are excited to meet you. Please submit your resume or CV to be considered for this opportunity. Applications are being reviewed on a rolling basis and we will be in touch with any questions. Final candidates will be asked to undergo a security screening, which includes a credit bureau and a criminal record investigation, the results of which must be acceptable to AIMCo. We are committed to keeping our employees safe and reducing the spread of COVID-19 in our workplace. As such, AIMCo has implemented a mandatory vaccination requirement where any employment offer will be conditional on providing proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (subject to accommodation requirements) and agreeing to ongoing testing and booster shots. ALERT - Be on the lookout for AIMCo career opportunities advertised through third parties that request an application fee or too much information. To verify, all opportunities are posted on aimco.ca/jobs Job Reference: CA00431

SAIT’s Business Intelligence and Analytics department supports the institution with market intelligence and business analysis. Our unique in-house research team, through consultation and the study of industry changes, labour markets and SAIT’s programming and products, helps inform essential business decisions. *The Opportunity* At the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology (SAIT), we are the shapers. The makers. The originals, driven by a passion for excellence and results that count. We offer action-based learning, solution-focused research and enterprising collaborations with partners from around the world. We are a global leader in applied education, an Alberta Top Employer and a destination workplace empowering people to make a difference in the lives of students. Now is an exciting time to join this one-of-a-kind place … SAIT.Business Intelligence and Analytics creates and oversees institution-wide business intelligence and market research strategies. The Business Intelligence and Analytics team plays an important role at SAIT by conducting research, gathering industry insights and measuring student and customer perceptions to directly support and inform strategic business decisions. Information and analytics are utilized to develop business cases to back institutional investments in support of student success.Reporting to the Manager, Market Research and Product Support, the Senior Market Research Analyst designs, implements and conducts major market research and feasibility studies. This will include conducting primary research using a variety of market research techniques as well as analyzing secondary research. The information collected is used in the decision making process at various levels within the SAIT organization. Research studies are conducted for all areas of SAIT and they encompass a comprehensive evaluation of all issues addressed in the research.The ideal applicant will possess a professional record of accomplishment in market research work, with emphasis on assessment methods, both quantitative and qualitative The Role Determine the appropriate research methodology based on project objectives; devise sampling methods, and design instruments for primary research. Responsible for managing all aspects of market research process, including questionnaire design, data collection, statistical analysis and presentations of the results. Develop moderator guides and recruitment guidelines for focus groups, moderate groups as well as write reports for key stakeholders. Responsible for trend analysis and reporting on a variety of primary and secondary research initiatives such as Satisfaction Surveys, Customer Behaviour surveys and reports, including 3rd party reports. Program and launch surveys using the SAIT Insights research panel as well as other online survey software tools. Manages SAIT Insights research panel including recruitment strategies, panel health monitoring and purging of inactive panelists. Assist with the implementation and management of a student assessment tool. Responsible for conducting competitive scans and analysis as well as market scans as they relate to post-secondary education and SAIT programming. Identify market and industry needs and future trends to assist with development of new SAIT program offerings Conduct research related to the Program Quality Assessment process of SAIT programs. Responsible for maintaining quality control and data integrity. Contributes to the annual market research plan and provides recommendations with respect to potential research initiatives and directions, and methodological improvements. Generate ideas for improving SAIT from the perspective of an unbiased consultant. Keep abreast of current trends in education as they relate to SAIT. Respond to ad hoc inquiries for information and analysis of issue from SAIT’s community. Qualifications The minimum level of education required is a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree with an emphasis on analytical thinking. Preference for those with courses in market research, statistical analysis, data analytics, economics or social sciences. Minimum of 5 years related experience, preferably in a client service capacity, with a professional record of accomplishment in market research work. Advanced knowledge using SPSS statistical software, Excel and PowerPoint. Proficient in online survey programming and study management. Strong problem solving and analytical skills, with ability to synthesize, interpret, analyze and report on data findings. Extensive experience and creativity in reports creation and presentation of data to various audiences. Excellent project management, administrative, and organizational skills, with ability to balance competing priorities. A serious interest in both the educational field and in market research is fundamental in keeping abreast of current issues. Focus group moderator skills would be a definite asset. Experience and/or working knowledge of market research panel management would be an asset. Experience and/or working knowledge of business intelligence tools like Tableau would be an asset. Highly motivated individual, with a strong sense of responsibility, and a high level of integrity. Classification: Research Officer II# of Position: 1Hours Per Week: 36.25Salary Range: $72,098 - $78,724Position closing date: Until suitable candidate is found About SAIT SAIT is a global leader in applied education. Named one of Alberta’s Top Employers, we offer the chance to work with a purpose — preparing the next generation of industry leaders, entrepreneurs, advocates and explorers. Building on our 100+ year history, we’re looking for innovative, bold and collaborative employees who embrace change and deliver world-class customer experiences. Your future starts now at SAIT. Equity, diversity and inclusion (EDI) is essential to achieving SAIT’s vision to be a global leader in applied education. It creates the conditions for a healthy campus where everyone feels welcome, respected and empowered to succeed. SAIT values fairness, shared accountability and the importance of representation. The institution expects a commitment from its students and employees to continuously develop an equitable and inclusive mindset that celebrates diverse experiences and perspectives. Learn more about EDI at SAIT. For information on the collection and use of your personal information, please see our Privacy Policy.**BEWARE FALSE POSTINGS AND RECRUITING OFFERS SAIT has been made aware of individuals or organizations posing as SAIT using false postings to attract job seekers and collect personal information. Champion Petfoods is expanding! We are excited to announce that we are looking for an IT Business Reporting Analyst to join our rapidly growing company. With thirty years of growth in the global pet food sector, our ORIJEN and ACANA brands define our vision of being The Global Leader in Advancing Premium Food for Pets. If you are passionate about personal and professional growth and see yourself as a key player contributing to our continued success by working in our award-winning company – we would love to hear from you. Summary The IT Business Reporting Analyst’s primary responsibility is the growth and support of the ongoing, reliable, efficient and effective operation & enhancement of Champion’s Enterprise Data Strategy. The IT Business Reporting Analyst is a technical figure responsible for the development of reports, data warehousing, and a key figure in the growth of Champions Data Strategy. Using a variety of technologies to turn data into information and create tools to solve the business needs and drive insight to all levels of the organization. Additionally, provide support for the enterprise applications team as required and collaborate on the design and creation of new tools and technologies. Ensuring integrations, security, and data integrity are paramount when designing, implementing, and updating business intelligence tools, configurations, and enhancements. Working within a community of disciplines (e.g. IT Operations, IT Enterprise Applications, the Project Management Office, various Champion business units, and diverse consultants), the IT Business Reporting Analyst must be an excellent communicator and be able to synthesize many views of problems into cohesive solutions. The IT Business Reporting Analyst will be the principal resource in managing the full lifecycle of the design & development of business intelligence projects, including requirements gathering, customer & vendor relationships, technical development, status reporting, implementation, quality assurance, and testing. This position is located in the Champion corporate office and requires some travel to other Champion locations. Responsibilities Define and implement technical solutions involving Business intelligence tools and data warehouse growth and development. Including the integration with other applications and projects (on premise or cloud-based). Who we are: Validere is the leading all-in-one commodity management platform for the energy industry. We believe the future of energy requires a modernized supply chain, so we’re reducing the barriers to actionable insights to make the energy landscape better for everyone. Through people and technology, we bring clarity to commercial, operational, and environmental challenges, provide ways to act on the learnings and facilitate predictions for the future state. Founded at Harvard University, Validere has since raised $70M+ from leading technology and energy investors, including Mercuria Energy America, BlackRock, Wing VC, Greylock Partners, and Y Combinator. With offices in Houston, Calgary, and Toronto, our 100+ employees focus every day on delivering the highest value, removing friction, and scaling results for every one of our customers. In 2022, Validere and Phoenix Energy Marketing joined forces to empower the industry to easily execute on data analytics insights. Learn more. Who you are: To support our rapid growth, we are looking for a Crude Oil Marketing Analyst with focus on executing, improving, and expanding the existing suite of client services of our newly acquired subsidiary, Phoenix Energy Commercial Services. You’re just as excited as we are about building the most high-tech and innovative marketing platform and tools in Canada. Reporting to our Professional Services Manager (Commercial), you will work closely with our Services team to deliver value to clients, spearhead onboarding of new clients, helping to identify and leverage value from Validere products and technologies, as well as reporting on account health and performance. Let’s give you a purpose: Own the crude oil marketing, transportation and blending activities for clients to deliver commercial value Provide front, mid & back office Crude Oil marketing support, such as submitting Form “A” volume forecasts, monitoring & balancing positions, price reporting, netback analysis, assist with revenue accruals, contract negotiation and administration. Coordinate shared goal-setting with our clients and execute on plans to achieve key commercial milestones and report out on account health/status to the Services Manager Support seamless onboarding experiences for new clients Work closely with our product team to (a) improve existing processes and streamline key marketing tasks leveraging technology, (b) evolve our marketing toolkit with new and exciting offerings for clients by leveraging your industry expertise and feedback from clients & prospects Provide support to senior team members and share your industry knowledge and experiences to help drive product development Assist sales efforts and pitches to prospects with your technical expertise as required What you’ll bring along: University degree or College degree in a related field, such as Accounting, Commerce, or Business Management/Administration, or equivalent experience 3-5 years of progressive responsibility and experience working with oil producers and/or oil marketing companies. A deep knowledge and a robust skill set around the following: The upstream crude oil industry in Western Canada. The monthly crude oil marketing and sales cycle. Lease purchase contracts Crude oil feeder pipeline systems, storage operators & rail terminals. Crude oil truck transportation service providers. Professional designation is considered an asset What sets you apart: You’re a great communicator and a meaningful relationship builder with clients and other stakeholders alike You are keen to work in a dynamic tech-environment; you’re excited to build new tools to revolutionize the marketing space Solving problems in a creative way excites you You like identifying opportunities to improve existing processes and services You’re a team player, and aim to be an integral part of shaping our Commercial Hub Sales & Product strategy by leveraging your deep industry expertise You’re a problem solver at heart; your success is your client’s success Our shared values: Deliver (the highest) value Remove friction Make it more scalable everyday Be fair and transparent Stay well & safe Validere is an equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from everyone regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the interview process and beyond. We are committed to providing an inclusive, open, and diverse work environment.
