Job_Title: Data Analyst, Valuation & Advisory Services (Western Region)
Summary: Our Story: About You: You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career. If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young! About Us: Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization. Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people. We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work. Overview: As a Data Analyst in Western Canada, you will work closely with internal and external stakeholders in the multiple market across all business lines. Leveraging your passion for data, technology and real estate, you will capture, review and enhance transactional real estate data. Responsibilities: This role which will require data entry & broader data importing, data analysis/management, and strong researching skills and will include the following regular tasks: reviewing core real estate data and importing it to the technology platform including properties, images, documents, leases, sales and ensuring accuracy & consistency. engage with local resources to capture and enhance transactional real estate data researching local cities, businesses, economic, demographic and real estate market activity and consolidating it into concise reports. meeting/speaking with both internal and external stakeholders around market activities adding/updating data on internal technology platforms utilizing publications, public filings, public records and third-party data providers searching and pulling data from public records around ownership, sales, debt, permits, zoning and tax assessments. adding/maintaining data from internal systems and processes by reaching out to industry insiders to track down missing data points. Qualifications: To be successful in this role, an individual must be able to perform each essential task at an above average level. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Post-secondary education and/or pursuing post-secondary education is considered an asset 1+ year experience in commercial real estate or real estate course work preferred Passionate about data, technology and real estate Dedicated to data as an art and science Sound knowledge of provincial geography and economic landscape Ability to learn new technology applications quickly & advanced knowledge of Microsoft excel preferred Possess characteristic traits of independent thinking, self-starting initiative while working well in a team-oriented environment Must be able to handle flexibility in task management while having a keen eye for detail Our Equal Opportunity Commitment: Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law. For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

Position Overview Number of Positions: 1 Language: Bilingualism in English and French is an asset. Work Model: Hybrid Alternate Title: n/a Additional Information: The work location for this role is flexible to Montreal, Chicoutimi, Quebec, Guelph, Burlington, Moncton, Regina, Calgary, Vancouver. The work model can be hybrid or remote. Our Business Intelligence team empowers decision making using leading edge science and analytics. We champion a scientific culture through our passion for continuous learning, diversity and innovation. We strive to deliver a single version of truth, by providing our business partners with access to comprehensive data and valuable insights to help our organization achieve operational excellence. This intermediate role contributes to this mission by researching and developing solutions to new analytical problems, using a scientific approach. People in this role are expected to autonomously complete projects and tasks of medium complexity and size as well as to provide coaching and support to other team members. What you’re responsible for: Extract data as required for project analysis or analysis of our book of business using BI tools or programming language. Analyze data and find complex insights. Understand, develop, maintain and improve predictive statistical models used in BI. Measure and document the performance of statistical models used in BI and Recommend the appropriate type of model to be used for a BI problem between a variety of common models (regressions, decision trees, etc.). Support Actuarial Research projects, including developing and testing non-standard and innovative approaches for modeling insurance risk. Support Non-Actuarial Research projects, including delivering predictive analytics solutions to support marketing, operations, and product. (E.g. Claim fraud detection models, Client Long-Term-Value index, etc.). Using a scientific approach, research and develop solutions to new analytical problems. Use the latest technologies and techniques such as geo-spatial analytics (GIS), text mining, big data, etc. What to expect: You will be subject to a Criminal Record and Consumer History background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate. To be successful: You have an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiencies and ability to influence change, with a primary focus on client needs. You use critical thinking skills to recognize assumptions, evaluate arguments, draw conclusions and proactively propose solutions. You have strong communication skills to clearly convey messages and explore diverse points of view. You build trusting relationships and provide guidance to support the development of colleagues. To join our team: 4 years of relevant experience OR 2 years with a graduate degree in a relevant field. University Degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics or relevant field. Property and Casualty insurance experience is preferred. Exposure to the use of job related applications, appliances and programming languages (SAS, SQL, Netezza, MicroStrategy) is an asset. What we offer: Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Employers. Flexible work options and paid time off to support your personal and family needs. A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health programs and a supportive workplace culture. Paid volunteer days to give back to your community. A comprehensive total rewards package, including competitive salary, bonus, pension and benefits. Interested in applying? Click 'apply now' to submit your current resume and cover letter. CanaDream provides memorable vacations for people who want to experience Canada at their own pace. We're open year-round, but our stations really come alive in season (May through October), when we play host to visitors from around the world. At CanaDream you have the ability to make a real difference to our Guests and Customers. Work with a great team; people who know how to have fun while getting the job done to the best of our abilities. Ignite your passion by joining our team! CanaDream is proud to employ individuals who embrace our core values: Be happy to Lead the way Enjoy the ride We are seeking an experienced analyst with experience in both data analysis and finance/business analysis to join our Finance team. Our ideal candidate must possess the ability to progress through tasks with minimum supervision. They must also have a strong team mentality, analytical skills and a willingness to learn and adapt to an ever-changing environment. About CanaDream’s Employees We are a team of experienced, passionate, and dedicated people and we welcome employees from all around the world and with all sorts of life experiences. About the Company From humble beginnings in the mid-‘90s, CanaDream has steadily grown into a leading RV rental and sales business in Canada. Our market-leading brand position has been achieved through a combination of investments in experienced employees across all our locations, with unique build RV floor plans, proprietary technology, continual investment, continual growth and expansion plans, and a fleet of over 1,000 modern RVs for rentals and previously experienced units available for sale. Our vibrant locations are choice locations for customers and guests who are seeking adventures in untamed and breathtaking surroundings and looking to explore the untamed wilderness, wildlife, awe-inspiring mountains, coastal hike trails, bright and bustling landscapes, gorgeous lake views & vast parks. CanaDream’s culture is based on being “Happy to” in every corner, we seek positivity and teamwork; working together to put our Guests at the center of everything. CanaDream’s employees work hard and enjoy the ride. Fun is at the core of our business with monthly staff appreciation BBQs, regular team celebration events, milestone awards and more. What’s in It for You: In addition to joining a dynamic and supportive team that focuses on staff well-being, you will receive a competitive salary, staff discounts for RV travel, benefits, growth opportunities & comprehensive on-the-job training. We also provide a referral bonus to staff who refer people to come and work with us. Our stations enjoy social events, and you will be welcomed in like family. Our stations all have free employee car parking. We are a pet-friendly environment and at some of our locations, some employees with their supervisor’s permission can bring their pets to work. More About the role: Those who are most successful in this role are detailed oriented, possess business acumen and are great at planning, budgeting, forecasting and conducting variance analysis. Job Duties: You will be responsible for the following: Providing financial and operational analysis that adds value and allows for the making of strategically sound decisions Presenting data in a meaningful way to stakeholders and making insightful recommendations Participating in the annual budget and monthly forecast preparations Management reporting, performing variance analysis, investigating discrepancies, and identifying key trends and drivers Business scenario modeling Develop and report on KPIs Working on multiple projects simultaneously Entering, retrieving, transforming, and analyzing data Qualifications: Have at least 1-3 years of experience in a related analytical role in finance/accounting or data analysis University Degree in Finance/Economics/Statistics background is highly regarded Demonstrated advanced knowledge, skills, and experience working in Excel (Power Pivot, Index-Match, VBA, Arrays, etc.). Experience in producing Excel models, what-if scenarios, data collection, cleanup, and data mining Knowledge of relational databases and SQL Experience with business intelligence tools (SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Alteryx, Zap BI, etc.), analysis tools (R or Python), or FP&A tools would be considered an asset Understanding of accounting principles and comfortable understanding financial statements Have an analytical mindset and the ability to process high volumes of data and interpret complex business issues accurately to non-financial and data users Ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment is essential to this role including recommending changes to improve process efficiencies Experience with financial modeling; able to translate the impact of analysis to the business Be detail-oriented, able to juggle multiple requests under pressure, and effectively prioritize tasks at hand to meet tight deadlines If you like the sound of all of this and are ready for a challenging yet rewarding role within a supportive team, and you believe you possess the required skills and experiences, then please apply to https://www.canadream.com/careers/job-openings/. CanaDream treats applicants on individual merit and abides by provincial legislations. We maintain equal opportunity employment for all applicants. Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.

Here's the impact you'll make and what we'll accomplish together You will build foundational data assets enabling sales teams across channels You will drive cross segment sales channels' performance through valuable insights Here's how You will develop new analytical solutions to provide timely insights to the business You will work on Salesforce (CRM) Customer data, business wireline productsYou will collaborate with cross functional teams: TBM Sales channel enablement team, Sales team, IT and other BI teams to develop foundational data assets that will drive sales' performance, measurement, and finally compensation. You're the missing piece of the puzzle You have an extraordinary ability to build relationships, collaborate, and influence across multiple teams You are inherently curious to understand how things work, have ability to think outside-of-the-box and work around constraints You focus on continuous learning and development across multiple domains including telecommunications industry, technology, and customer experience You have advanced Structured Query Language (SQL) skills and hands-on experience working on Oracle and / or SQL server databases with more than 5 years of experience You have intermediate to expert level proficiency in SAS with at least 5 years of hands on experience Great to haves Prior telecommunications or B2B marketing experience University degree in Engineering or Commerce and/or equivalent combination of experience and education Working knowledge on Google cloud platform (GCP) and BigQuery is an asset

Reporting to the VP – Sales, Marketing and Business Development, the Market Research Analyst is responsible for conducting and analyzing market and customer data to identify new markets, products and customers for the business. WHO WE ARE Argus is an employee-owned organization that embraces diversity and the benefits it brings. Innovation and progress are achieved through valuing the ideas of our people, two-way communication, and being open to change. Please visit the ‘About Us’ and ‘Careers’ sections of our website to learn more. WHAT YOU'LL DO: Define the parameters for conducting market research in conjunction with the BD Specialist and the Marketing Manager. Build the Argus market research processes. Research and report on production-related activity to our Product Account Managers. Train stakeholders on the Argus Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and processes for the department. Identify opportunities for improvement. Systematically gather, record, and analyze data about customers, competitors, products and the market. Collect data and information using a variety of methods, such as interviews, questionnaires, focus groups, market analysis surveys, public opinion polls, and literature reviews. Analyze data to identify deeper consumer insights and opportunities, integrate insights to provide a holistic analysis that tells a story Translate data into information for stakeholders through impactful storytelling. Interpret data, formulate reports, and make recommendations for market, product, and customer identification. Present research results in a visual and impactful user-friendly fashion. Manage all aspects of delivering monthly reports to Marketing and Business Development leads. Measure the effectiveness of Brand/marketing strategies and report on this. Support the overall company strategy by providing insights based on market analysis to the business to grow our customer base and deepen the connection with our existing customers. Provide information to support the planning and development of Brand, eCommerce, digital and retail strategies as needed. WHAT YOU BRING: Bachelor’s Degree in economics, commerce or business administration preferred. 3-6 years’ experience working in market research, preferably for a manufacturing organization. Demonstrated strong interpersonal, communication, organizational and Project Management skills. Excellent verbal, written, and analytical skills. Knowledge of marketing analytical tools such as Google Analytics is required. Understanding of marketing concepts, product positioning and competitive analysis. Familiar with Marketing principles and SEO (Search Engine Optimization) practices and methods. Competent in using Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe, computer software related to business operations (ERP) and CRM systems. Strong knowledge of products and services in relation to the oil and gas industry. Strong knowledge of safe work practices, Quality Assurance requirements, and Continuous Improvement (Lean Manufacturing) principles and the ability to impart that knowledge to others. Functional knowledge of Argus information and network platforms including Microsoft Office and Dynamics AX.

Job Description Dynasty Power trades electricity across North America. Dynasty is active in all the major power trading markets including CAISO, IESO, ISO-NE, NYISO, PJM, MISO, SPP and ERCOT. Dynasty Power is looking for a highly motivated, self-sufficient and enthusiastic individual who has a strong desire to grow within the company to fill a new junior power analyst role. We are looking for a self starter looking to thrive in a high paced ever changing environment. Analyzing large amounts of data and keeping a pulse on the 24hr power markets are some key roles of the position. Communicating market information to the senior traders on the desk and working in a team environment are some of the critical elements of this position. This position is located in our Calgary office. Responsibilities Analyze data to look for profitable trading strategies Develop custom analysis and modelling for power trading. Proficiency in programming language is required. Understanding of risk and reward, previous trading experience in any market is preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Finance, Mathematical Sciences including Computer Sciences, Engineering, or related fields An outstanding academic record Passion for trading, financial derivatives and financial data analysis considered an asset Required Skills Strong programming experience and knowledge of SQL and VBA/Excel Proficiency in another programming language considered an asset Strong statistical and quantitative analysis abilities Strong communications, multi-tasking and time management skills

Digital Inventory Analyst AutoCanada Home Office Edmonton, Alberta As part of the Marketing team, this position will play a key role in how we manage one of our largest assets, inventory. With over 10,000 vehicles currently in stock, you can imagine this is a big job. To use a sports analogy, we’re looking for a player who hustles and has some grit. We need someone to basically do all the little things that don’t show up on the scoreboard but may be the difference between winning or losing. As a Digital Inventory Analyst, you’re a curious, motivated, self-starter who can work through problems methodically and efficiently. We’re in the business of selling cars; so, there’s a lot going on and it’s a fast-paced environment. It is important that you can prioritize appropriately, sift through as much data as you can get your hands on, and never stop asking questions. We like to be successful, so we ensure that hard work and results are recognized and rewarded. From merchandising, inventory feeds and stocking processes, to data mapping, trend analysis, and supply management, you will become an inventory expert who works closely with our dealerships and marketing team to ensure we are setting ourselves up for success! You are responsible for: Taking ownership of our Inventory Management Systems (IMS) to monitor the performance of the vehicles with regards to age, pricing, photos, and descriptions Tracking inventory pipeline activity and aligning incoming inventory with marketing goals and objectives Following how data moves throughout dealerships to identify and alleviate bottlenecks and increase process efficiency Gathering and analyzing data to support dealerships with the latest shopping trends and competitive pricing ranks Utilize the tools and reporting within our IMS to maximize our online exposure Understanding the DMS, CRM and reporting systems to ensure our data is accurate Analyzing market trends and competition to assess growth points and adjusting our position accordingly Training new team members in the dealership on our best practices and available tools relating to merchandising and pricing Reporting twice a month on the health of each dealer’s inventory from the back-end to online Reviewing and analyzing inventory mix to mitigate risk and get ahead of any potential issues Working with the dealerships to present the data maintain acceptable benchmarks for inventory merchandising and marketing results Ensuring that dealerships have a strategy to stay on top of aging and high-risk units Staying on top of 3rd party marketplace data to help the dealers make optimal purchasing decisions Anything and everything to do with how our vehicles look online Your capabilities: We’d prefer if you have been in sales or a car dealership for 2 to 3 years University diploma or degree in business, supply chain, computer science, or related field would be considered an asset We’d prefer you have some experience in data mapping and understand what goes into efficient inventory management processes Strong analytical skills and understanding of Microsoft Excel Capable of quickly learning and becoming proficient at several different ERP systems You’re adaptable and a quick learner, who can get stuff done yourself and use other team members proactively when you need help You can work on your own and don’t need to be hand-held through your daily tasks You’re comfortable talking to people and know how to discuss data and results You have an ability to juggle a whole bunch of jobs at once and can sort out what is a priority and what is not What’s in it for you? Competitive pay, bonus, and pretty great group of people to spend time with every day Health and dental benefits, obviously Access to all the training and support you need to get the job done An opportunity to be part of an exciting, growing company Apply Now! We are in pursuit of an elite team to take our publicly traded, Canadian-born and raised company, to the next level in automotive excellence. Founded in 2006, AutoCanada started with 19 dealerships managed by our head office team out of a tiny office in Edmonton. Fast forward 15 years and we currently operate 63 dealerships in eight provinces and the United States. Our once small team has grown to over 4,200 strong! For more information about AutoCanada we invite you to visit www.autocan.ca, @AutoCanada or www.facebook.com/autocan/. To join our elite team please submit your resume and cover letter on the Careers Portal of our website www.autocan.ca/careers/

Overview As a Data Analyst in Western Canada, you will work closely with internal and external stakeholders in the multiple market across all business lines. Leveraging your passion for data, technology and real estate, you will capture, review and enhance transactional real estate data. Responsibilities This role which will require data entry & broader data importing, data analysis/management, and strong researching skills and will include the following regular tasks: Reviewing core real estate data and importing it to the technology platform including properties, images, documents, leases, sales and ensuring accuracy & consistency. Engage with local resources to capture and enhance transactional real estate data Researching local cities, businesses, economic, demographic and real estate market activity and consolidating it into concise reports. Meeting/speaking with both internal and external stakeholders around market activities Adding/updating data on internal technology platforms utilizing publications, public filings, public records and third-party data providers Searching and pulling data from public records around ownership, sales, debt, permits, zoning and tax assessments. Adding/maintaining data from internal systems and processes by reaching out to industry insiders to track down missing data points. Qualifications To be successful in this role, an individual must be able to perform each essential task at an above average level. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Post-secondary education and/or pursuing post-secondary education is considered an asset 1+ year experience in commercial real estate or real estate course work preferred Passionate about data, technology and real estate Dedicated to data as an art and science Sound knowledge of provincial geography and economic landscape Ability to learn new technology applications quickly & advanced knowledge of Microsoft excel preferred Possess characteristic traits of independent thinking, self-starting initiative while working well in a team-oriented environment Must be able to handle flexibility in task management while having a keen eye for detail Our Equal Opportunity Commitment Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity. The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law. For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially. Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

Status: Full-time, 12 Month Contract role with possible extension up to 6 months Schedule: Monday - Friday, Standard 38.75 hour work week Location: Primary Care Network Wellness Centre at #4000, 1800 194 Avenue SE; Calgary, AB Reporting Structure: Reports to the Information Management Manger Position Summary The Data Quality Analyst is responsible for proactively reviewing the corporate data warehouse content to identify data quality issues and implement strategies to resolve them. In addition, the post holder will be responsible for testing new data feeds into the corporate data warehouse and developing business logic to optimize the data infrastructure. The incumbent will have great attention to detail, able to produce high quality documentation, brings strong SQL scripting skills, and has knowledge of MS Excel and data warehousing concepts. What Does the Role Do? Data Quality Identification of data quality issues within the corporate SQL Server based data warehouse Formulate tactics and strategies to resolve data quality issues through front-end process changes or backend data cleansing processes Work closely with the DW & BI Lead, DW & BI Developer, Clinical systems (EMR) Analyst, Evaluators, and Practice Facilitators in identifying and finding solutions to data quality issues to optimize use of the corporate data infrastructure and meet business requirements Develop and manage the data quality issues log to ensure registration and resolution of all identified data quality issues Information System Testing Responsible for the testing of new information system developments to support the expansion of the corporate data warehouse Lead on the development and technical testing of business logic to optimize data use capabilities to support business requirements Work closely with clinical data entry teams and the Clinical systems (EMR) Analyst to coordinate changes to front end data entry Documentation Deliver high quality documentation for data sources, data warehousing, and BI applications. Mapping data sets and developing data dictionaries for tables and field Produce regular data quality reports to operational teams Who Should Apply? University degree or college diploma in Computer Science/Computer programming/Software Engineering or related field 1+ years of experience in SQL Server, designing, developing, scripting queries in a medium complex data warehouse environment Experience with leading Business Intelligence tools (eg. Qlik Sense or QlikView) is an asset Experience of primary health care data and/or health care EMR (e.g., Wolf, MedAccess, Practice Solutions) is an asset Experience with application development is an asset What Will Help You Succeed? Experience with data warehouse structures and relational databases Strong experience with MS Excel Strong attention to detail Work independently as well as in a team-oriented environment Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal with an emphasis on client satisfaction and clearly communicating solutions to both technical and non-technical team members Strong analytical skills to solve and model complex business requirements with the ability for creativity and innovative problem solving Knowledge of project management methodologies Working Conditions Onsite and Remote Workforce Long periods of concentration and working on a computer required Two supervisory references required Criminal background check required Proof of COVID vaccination required Why Work At SCPCN? It takes an outstanding team to deliver exceptional care. Hello, we’re the South Calgary Primary Care Network. We are change makers, innovators and community builders. We are a uniquely Alberta approach to primary care delivery. We are a group of interprofessional teams and need you to be part of the movement to bring innovative primary health care programs and services to the residents of south Calgary. Established in February 2006, the South Calgary Primary Care Network (SCPCN) includes the areas south of Anderson Road to the southern, western, and eastern city limits. Employees of the SCPCN enjoy a comprehensive total compensation package that includes: Health, vision, and dental benefits Health spending/wellness account Personal development account Flexible work options Generous vacation, sick and flex days Professional development opportunities Parking available at site The SCPCN culture is defined by 5 core values: Innovation, accountability, integrity, collaboration and wellness. They provide a foundation on which we perform work and conduct ourselves. Our mission is to build healthier communities in south Calgary through the evolution and transformation of primary care in collaboration with our wellness partners. Are you ready to join us lead optimal personal and community wellness now and into the future? If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, simply apply online with your resume and cover letter. We thank all candidates for applying, however only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about information and can accelerate our business intelligence reporting. Data is everywhere at Yellow Pencil and cutting through the noise is important to making healthy decisions. We need someone who can help us get there, we have the data, we need the insight. We are looking for someone who can build useful dashboards for mission critical business intelligence. You should have experience building dashboards and analyzing data from multiple sources. We need your ownership and support. You don’t have all the answers but you are resourceful and great at problem solving and figuring things out without supervision. In this role, you’ll work collaboratively with directors, content strategists, project managers, designers, and developers to produce high-quality business intelligence. You need to be proficient in both written communication and meeting facilitation. Most importantly, you need to be able to translate data into meaningful business intelligence. Your responsibilities Understand our business’ needs and translate them into useful dashboards using Klipfolio Analyze data from multiple sources Owns the requirements gathering and definition process Turn feedback from team members into actionable tasks Craft training and/or support documentation to facilitate a successful hand-off Identify bugs/problems during the test cycles, and report defects in a clear and concise manner The thanks you’ll get Competitive compensation Work within a tightly knit team Location Our team is fully remote and distributed across Canada. Who you are We care about our culture here at YP. Your personality is just as important to us as your qualifications. We’re looking for somebody who is: Interested and motivated Our industry is changing every second. We need you to be curious, and excited to keep up with it. Already awesome, but ready to be awesomer Be ready to get your hands dirty (not with actual dirt. Intellectual dirt). We won’t tell you what to do, we’ll collaborate with you to discover the best way to do it. Always trying to get better Training and development is a huge part of our values. We want you to be good at what you do, but we also want you to look for ways to get even better. Ready to make an impact The best part of Yellow Pencil? Anyone can help change how the company works. Got a better idea? Shout it out. Thought of something new? Make it happen. Good on paper Okay, your qualifications are important too. 3+ years of experience working in a data analyst role, business analyst role or related field Experience building intelligent dashboards Experience facilitating requirements gathering meetings Experience working in an agency environment Ability to understand and translate customer’s needs into user stories Experience using Klipfolio, Looker, Tableau or similar dashboard software. Detail oriented with strong analysis and problem-solving skills Ability to work with minimum or little supervision Excellent written and verbal communication skills But hey, if your background doesn’t quite match up with this list, but you know you’ll be a perfect fit – tell us why. We’ll listen. Who we are Yellow Pencil is a full-service web design agency based out of Edmonton. We work on big content problems for big (and big-ish) organizations. Our mission We help good people do good work. Our values We value both collaboration and empathy We value both integrity and impact We value both craft and growth Working at Yellow Pencil means A constant commitment to learning and growth Delivering the highest quality work possible on every project A people-first workplace. We want you to love being here as much as we do Work/life balance. We like that people have lives outside of the office Job Type: Full-time Schedule: Monday to Friday

VER Strategic Communications Competition No. - S100347487D1 Posting Date - May 02, 2022 Closing Date - Will remain open until filled. Position Type - Full Time - Operating Funded Salary Range - $62,321 to $85,429 per year Grade - 09 Hours - 40 This competition is open to all applicants however internal candidates and applicants who were former employees of the University of Alberta in the past 18 months will be given priority consideration before external candidates. Please indicate your internal status using the "Advertisement" drop down menu when applying. This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA). This position offers a comprehensive benefits package which can be viewed at: Faculty & Staff Benefits. Location: Work primarily takes place at North Campus Edmonton. Please note: this role is temporarily remote. Working for the University of Alberta The University of Alberta has earned the reputation of being one of the best universities in Canada based on our teaching, research and service, with an international reputation for excellence across health and life sciences, social sciences, agriculture, business and law, engineering, natural sciences, arts, and the humanities. We are home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs with over 13,000 faculty and staff. Our innovative and dynamic environment provides you with boundless opportunities for engaging work within diverse and multidisciplinary teams. A high level of collaboration within the university allows you to build professional networks with meaningful relationships, and cultivate new skill sets through our well-established learning and development programs. Our greatest asset is people who make up the U of A community. We are proud that our campuses, buildings, labs, and research stations are primarily located on the traditional territory of Cree, Blackfoot, Métis, Nakota Sioux, Iroquois, Dene, and Ojibway/Saulteaux/Anishinaabe nations as part of Treaties 6, 7, and 8 and homeland, of the Métis. The Strategic Communications/Issues Management team is a part of the U of A’s External Relations portfolio. We raise awareness and enhance understanding of the University of Alberta, internally and externally. We bring to light stories that showcase our faculty, staff and students, connect the university with its many communities and advocate for the U of A as we advance our promise of uplifting the whole people. Position summary You will provide communications coordination and content in a fast-paced environment driven by external media needs, breaking news cycles and social media discourse. You will monitor the news (print, digital, broadcast, etc.) and social media for mentions of the University of Alberta and other topics of interest. You will help gather and analyze information, intelligence and metrics for U of A internal stakeholders and External Relations products and reports on community and audience reach, engagement, content and impact. You will also be a part of a dynamic, best-in-class team developing proactive communications strategies and digital communications campaigns that support strategic objectives, and those that respond to current issues and crises. You will work alongside experts in media relations, news and magazine writing, video production, social media, digital design and development, communications planning and brand marketing. We’re constantly evolving to meet the 24hr news cycle, stakeholder needs, and new media developments. Duties Lead active monitoring of news, digital and social media channels and platforms for U of A activities and content for the External Relations team. Create and submit concise reports and summaries, on key stories, such as incisive assessments and evaluations. Analyze campaign performances, and research results using a variety of tools. Perform research activities to discover new PR opportunities, and scan the horizon for potential media users. Create presentations, and information sessions, ensuring that media monitoring activities are appropriately communicated. Provide summaries of news and media coverage, and social media discourse, on the University of Alberta and other topics of interest, and circulate clippings. Ensure the timely dissemination of time-sensitive information, news articles and transcripts to internal stakeholders. Administer and maintain news media monitoring platforms, including communications with suppliers to signal issues, update keywords and search terms, in accordance with the terms of the service agreements. Consult with internal stakeholders to identify news and media monitoring needs, and provide customized reports and dashboards. Ensure news and media monitoring products (distribution and online) meet needs. Research and prepare in-depth news and media analyses of university-related issues highlighted in the media, including stakeholder reactions to issues of interest to the U of A, on a periodic basis and in a proactive manner. Provide timely and complete analysis of trends, comments and issues relevant to university business. Track and monitor media and social media analytics, analyzing metrics to identify trends and inform decision-making. Work collaboratively with digital channel managers to facilitate online conversations, respond to queries, and engage in digital community management. Drafting and editing content for print and/or online communications channels. Minimum qualifications Undergraduate degree and minimum 3 years experience in a field related to journalism, public relations, communications, political science, and/or communications technology. Knowledge of the public environment, including the media and the political system, and how they function. Comprehension of the Canadian post-secondary environment. Ability to quickly grasp the relevancy for University of Alberta news stories. Strong writing skills with the ability to be concise and to write analysis of news and media coverage. Strong digital communications skills, including preparing text and visual content for web and email platforms. English language editorial skills. Ability to produce results under pressure quickly and reliably. Ability to take initiative and to work autonomously. Aptitude to learn and keep pace with new web publishing technologies. Knowledge of and proficiency with news alerts and media monitoring tools. Knowledge of and proficiency with digital and social media tools and platforms. Proficiency with online content publishing platforms such as WordPress, Medium, etc. Proficiency using Microsoft Office and Google’s suite of office product. Preferred qualifications Previous experience in a professional communications or public relations role. Comprehension of the University of Alberta, its stakeholders, partners, and governance structure. Experience conducting data analysis, and interpreting news/media data activities (i.e. mentions, sentiment, engagement). Knowledge and experience navigating U of A Library services. Experience building dashboards. French language skills How to apply To apply, please click the Apply Online button and attach the following: Resume and Cover Letter How to Apply Note: Online applications are accepted until midnight Mountain Standard Time of the closing date. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted. The University of Alberta is committed to an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from all qualified persons. We encourage women; First Nations, MÃ©tis and Inuit persons; members of visible minority groups; persons with disabilities; persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity and expression; and all those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas and the University to apply.

Job_Title: Residential Market Studies Analyst, Economic Consulting
Summary: Job Category: Economics Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group! The opportunity Reporting to the Director, Economic Consulting we are looking for a Residential Market Studies Analyst, to join our National Economic Advisory team. You will play a pivotal role conducting research, analysing data, and contributing to studies for our residential feasibility consulting practice. Who you are You are a recent grad with an interest in economics, planning, urban development or policy analysis; with exceptional research, data analysis, and writing skills. You are detail oriented and have an interest in consultative report writing and working as a trusted advisor in residential or mixed-use studies - and you are looking for an opportunity to be trained and mentored in this field. You want to join a national team at a scaling industry leader offering competitive analysis and advice founded on data and integrity. You have an entrepreneurial spirit, the growth mindset, and the willingness to roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to learn and make an impact. What you will focus on Conduct research. You will collect data from both internal and third-party sources regarding economic, demographic, real estate market, and other topics as required. You will correspond with industry participants to elicit and compile real estate market data. Prepare information for reporting and analysis. You will perform data entry for analytical models and prepare preliminary analysis. You will support complex consulting reports by writing, editing, and proofreading assigned sections under the supervision of a Senior Analyst. Build and create. You will use GIS software to perform spatial data analysis and provide high-quality graphic outputs and mapping. You will assist with the development and maintenance of analytical models. You will create informative and visually compelling tables and charts for consulting reports. Learn. You will continuously upgrade your knowledge regarding the market and industry trends. As our new Analyst, Residential Market Studies, you bring: The education and motivation. You have a university degree in Economics, Statistics, Urban Geography, Urban Planning, Business, or a related discipline. You take ownership of your tasks, are detail-oriented, and comfortable supporting the efforts of a team acting as a key contact for disseminating information. The technical skills. You have basic research, quantitative and analytical skills. You are proficient in MS Office, including Excel. GIS software knowledge is a benefit. The interpersonal skills. You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills. You are collaborative and can build relationships with internal teams and external stakeholders. You are comfortable reaching out via email or phone to obtain information and confirm details. The flexibility. You have a valid driver’s license and access to a vehicle. You are willing to work the occasional weekend or evening to complete studies or attend client meetings, forums, and information sessions when it is safe to do so. What’s in it for you ? Impact, reputation, and collaboration . Our National Economics Advisory Team conducts more than 100 feasibility studies a year, and we are ramping up. We have a top-end product, continuously evolving to meet the needs of our clients and backed by a reputation for delivering services with independence and integrity. This is a chance to be part of an organization with one of the largest repositories of real estate data, inhouse built tech products to access and analyze the data, and experts in appraisals, construction costs, and valuation. Exposure. We work on projects across the country, presenting new and unique challenges with leads generated through marketing and a reputation that precedes us. This is an opportunity to gain an incredible amount of exposure and hands-on opportunity working with renowned experts in the field, including VP and Chief Economist, Peter Norman, supporting your work and learning as you go. Career development. We have a year-over-year mandate to develop the broader team; you will have endless possibilities for growth with the chance to move up to a Senior Analyst, Consultant, and beyond, across the group into commercial real estate studies, or into another line of the business. We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to grow your career and do some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what's new by following us on LinkedIn . Come realize your potential at Altus Group! Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

Joining Suncor means you will work for one of the best companies in Canada, providing tremendous future potential where talented people thrive and lead. As our business evolves, so do our employment opportunities. Our work culture includes a dynamic mix of professionals, with a diversity of skills and expertise. We are living in an era of transformation – as a company, as an industry and as a global community. Suncor is evolving and technology and digital solutions are a big part of this. Unleashing the full potential of our people is what will get us where we need to be. An essential part of our evolution is creating value through data and becoming a data-informed enterprise where employees can apply their knowledge, draw insights and make the best possible decisions. Hiring specialists like yourself will help us implement our Advanced Analytics strategy and transform our business. It’s all about strengthening our future through digital technology, unleashing the full potential of our people, and creating an engaging and productive workplace. By joining our Advanced Analytics team, you will have the opportunity to apply your graphical development expertise to design, build, translate and communicate statistical data insights into easily understandable visualizations useful for both subject matter experts and business users. You will collect business requirements and establish the need, scope, goal, key stakeholders and success criteria by facilitating visualization workshops and requirements gathering sessions with multiple attendees. Minimum Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Art, or related technical or visual discipline Five years of progressive experience in graphics design, data visualization, geo-spatial tools, and data analysis software Experience in one or more data visualization libraries, frameworks, and tools Experience in one or more programming/web development language Ability to translate complex technology into compelling visual storytelling Ability to mentor and coach a broad and diverse audience on analytics topics and new ways of working Knowledge in information/visual communication and presentation Responsibilities: Design and develop impactful and informative visual content, work with clients and subject matter experts to conceptualize requirements, and present them clearly and concisely, using your visual design, storyboarding, and data visualization skills Develop graphic layouts and geo-spatial mapping to create compelling deliverables for analytics use cases Apply information architecture, interactive visual design, quantitative analysis, and qualitative user research to create User Interfaces (UI) for an informed User Experience (UX) Develop and deliver training on data visualization in support of the Analytics Academy and educate clients on data visualization methods and techniques to enhance the business decision-making capability Support the Analytics centre of excellence to establish data visualization, design standards, and good practices to create insightful visuals to increase business impact Support product development at a tactical level with hands-on engagement as required based on complexity; collaborating with product owners, analytics practitioners, and the business to identify opportunities and participate in the development and implementation of analytics strategies related to data visualization Location and other Key Details: You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W. Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday, with the potential for extended work hours based on business needs #LI-Hybrid Why Suncor? Our operations include oil sands development and upgrading, conventional and offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and our product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our renewable energy portfolio includes investments in four operating wind farms and the operation of an ethanol plant. And our use of innovative technology has made us an industry leader in the energy business. With a strong strategy for growth and our long-standing approach to sustainability, operational excellence, capital discipline and technology and innovation, Suncor offers a solid foundation for you to continue building your career. We offer rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions – all of which means tremendous potential for your future. We are focused on deepening our commitment to inclusion and diversity and creating a respectful workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We have numerous employee inclusion networks to help foster an inclusive and respectful culture and drive positive change within Suncor. Current networks include both workplace inclusion networks (focusing on inclusion and respect for all), and identity-focused networks (focusing on building community and a sense of belonging and allyship). Through the Journey of Reconciliation, we are progressing the way we think and act to build greater mutual trust and respect with the Indigenous Peoples in Canada. Please note we will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.

An eagerness to learn all aspects of commercial real-estate as well as the knowledge you gained from your undergraduate degree. Experience with Argus. Who we are: Validere is the leading all-in-one commodity management platform for the energy industry. Founded at Harvard University, Validere has since raised $70M+ from leading technology and energy investors, including Mercuria Energy America, BlackRock, Wing VC, Greylock Partners, and Y Combinator. With offices in Houston, Calgary, and Toronto, our 100+ employees focus every day on delivering the highest value, removing friction, and scaling results for every one of our customers. In 2022, Validere and Phoenix Energy Marketing joined forces to empower the industry to easily execute on data analytics insights. Learn more. front, mid & back office Natural Gas and NGL marketing support, including but not limited to: optimize firm & interruptible gas transportation , placing nominations, monitoring & balancing positions, Coordinate shared goal-setting with our clients and execute on plans to achieve key commercial milestones and report out on account health/status to the Services Manager Support seamless onboarding experiences for new clients Work closely with our product team to (a) improve existing processes and streamline key marketing tasks leveraging technology, (b) evolve our marketing toolkit with new and exciting offerings for clients by leveraging your industry expertise and feedback from clients & prospects Provide mentorship guidance to team members leveraging your industry knowledge and experience Assist sales efforts and pitches to prospects with your technical expertise as required What you’ll bring along: 3-5 years working with natural gas/NGL producers and/or natural gas/NGL marketing companies in a scheduling or trading role University degree or College degree in a related field, such as Accounting, Commerce, or Business Management/Administration, or equivalent experience Knowledge of the upstream natural gas/NGLs industry in Western Canada Knowledge and familiarity with the natural gas/NGLs marketing and sales cycle Understanding of plantgate gas sales processes Familiarity and ability to use GasEDI contract templates Knowledge of Western Canada gas pipeline systems & storage operators, including TC (NGTL), Enbridge (WEI), Alliance (APL) and TransGas (TGL) Proficiency & experience using ICE/NGX gas trading platform Understanding of NGL recoveries at gas plants, liquids trucked, pipeline, fractionation, netback calculations and back-office support or ability/eagerness to learn Professional designation is considered an asset What sets you apart: You’re a great communicator and a meaningful relationship builder with clients and other stakeholders opportunities to improve existing processes and services You’re a team player, and aim to be an integral part of shaping our Commercial Hub Sales & Product strategy by leveraging your deep industry Experience working with and supporting Enterprise Applications like JD Edwards, Kronos, Symphony Point-of-Sales, Incorta or similar systems. Process and systems experience in hospitality industry is highly desirable. Experience in task prioritization either independently or in a team-oriented collaborative environment. Software development exposure or experience is considered an asset. Advanced analytical skills in gathering system requirements, logical data & process modeling, use case modeling, workflow modeling. Maturity of judgment and on-demand decision making to resolve problems immediately and/or to seek support when required. Experience performing upgrades of business applications / systems and/or related 3rd party applications highly regarded. Proven experience in translating business requirements into creative functional and technical specifications. Skills & Abilities Excellent verbal & written communication skills. Demonstrated project management skills. Advanced analytical skills in gathering system requirements, logical data & process modeling, use case modeling, workflow modeling. Self-starter and highly motivated to achieve results. Propensity to innovate and challenge the status quo. Maturity of judgment and on-demand decision making to resolve problems without delay and/or to seek support when required. Demonstrated organization and time management skills. Ability to juggle multiple projects & tasks and prioritize and deliver results in the face of competing business interests. Detail oriented, but also able to view a big picture and understand strategic context. Proficient in MS Office products. Ability to work independently and proactively to develop and implement solutions with minimal guidance. Ability to build relationships quickly and work as part of a team. Business acumen – ability to quickly grasp how a process works and leverage that knowledge to drive business results.

AMA: IT'S all ABOUT THE DATA... Posted: 2022-01-26 Closing: Until Filled Location: Bridgewater Bank, Calgary *Please note that remote work is offered temporarily during the COVID pandemic. Only candidates that live in Calgary will be considered for this position.* You understand that knowledge is a powerful thing – and for you there’s nothing more fulfilling than promoting and enabling data-based decision making. You love diving into the data to better understand the situation. You have a knack for data and details, without losing sight of the big picture. You’ve got the skills to govern, and master manage data all while advocating/working with stakeholders; you work well with a broad group of people; and you clearly communicate every step of the way. In this position, your role will be primarily responsible for Bridgewater Bank’s data assets as well as an advocate for the consistent and correct use of those data assets. You will manage the lifecycle of data assets and develop clear definitions of data elements, values, and metadata. As Business Data Analyst, you will provide expertise, guidance and advice for data process improvements, efficiencies through data analysis and reporting of information extracted from a variety of databases and promote continuous improvement as well as identify and gather requirements withing project initiatives and provide recommendations to meet objectives. Sound like you? If so, we should talk! WHO IS BRIDGEWATER BANK? Unlike a traditional bank, we have no branches. This means less time managing logistics and more time focussed on you and our ‘why’ – helping you succeed. Our focus is providing honest, straightforward service and financial solutions for everyday living and important life events. We’re financial service experts with flexible mindsets. Being a smaller bank makes us nimble, and that means we can respond quickly with innovative approaches that don’t need to go through multiple levels of approvals. Our customers are everything. When you become a customer of Bridgewater Bank you’re like our neighbour – even family – and we treat you that way. WHAT MOVES YOU You’re an adaptable team player who excels in a fast-paced environment and thrives on challenge. You’re an excellent communicator (both verbal and written), an even better listener to provide direction on how to optimize our data. You strongly believe there’s no such thing as an insignificant detail – you keep at it until every “i” is dotted and every “t” is crossed. You’re organized – there’s no clutter in your workspace or in your brain. You have the natural ability to reduce a complex concept or task into something that is manageable and clearly interpreted. Finding simple solutions to complicated problems and explaining them to others comes as naturally to you as breathing. Deadlines? No sweat. You’ve got strong time management skills, so you always deliver on time. You think that important stories are buried in data, and you want to be the one that finds them. WHAT YOU'LL DO Reporting to Senior Team Lead BI, you will be responsible for analyzing the business needs of our internal and external stakeholders and gather requirements for specific projects related to Data Management, Business Intelligence, and Reporting. Collaborate with stakeholders from various business units and Partners as well as Data Engineers, Data Scientists, Business Intelligence team members, and Enterprise Integration Analysts to gather effective requirements and prepare specifications for IT team. Establish effective communication to ensure business stakeholders expectations are clearly understood and communicated. Work close to key business stakeholders to develop and maintain BwB KPIs and metric definition/derivation portfolio and work with business unit leads, front-line managers, supervisors, and other staff members to understand how our data gets utilized, consumed, and provide optimization suggestions. Perform Data Steward duties. Develop and manage relationships with data source providers for data collection enhancements, ticket issues related to data quality process and support. Advocate the value of data and help recruit data owners among key major business units. Responsible for overall records management, document control related to data management and Business Intelligence reporting. Providing guidance and support for project teams during the development and implementation of data management by identifying opportunities and solutions for improving data management, data quality, and Business Intelligence reporting services. Review and analyze the effectiveness of existing Data Warehouse and related processes and propose strategies for data quality improving and to further leveraging data. Develop and maintain an expert level understanding of the AMA’s data assets and business processes. Understand data from multiple angles including how we collect, store, and utilize data and apply high standard of data governance through the entire process. Analize and improve standards for exiting Data Quality engine and set expectations with business partners. Inspect data to identify data anomalies, trends and patterns in order to propose solutions which will improve data quality. Provide orientation and training to end users. Engages in quality assurance processes to maintain a high standard of deliverables. Liaise and develop productive and collaborative working relationships with all business areas. WHAT YOU'VE DONE You have a degree or diploma in computer science, computer engineering, or information systems. You have the skills and excellent experience as business analyst in a Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence environment. You have the skills and excellent experience as data analyst in a Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence environment. You have the skills and good experience as Data Steward. You have excellent experience in enterprise applications, data integrations, data quality standards, process mapping, data structures and reporting systems. You have excellent experience with MS BI Stack- SQL SERVER 2012 and up technology. You have strong T-SQL and ETL skills and the ability to develop your own tools for data analysis, quality, monitoring and produce statistics. Experience with Business Intelligence tools such as PowerBI and WebFocus is an asset. You have strong knowledge of fundamentals of Data Warehouse, ETL, Data Quality, Master Data, and Reporting in different enterprise-wide architectures. You are well organized, self-motivated, and proficient in all areas of data strategy and best practices. You have strong analytical, problem solving and decision-making skills, as well as demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences You have strong knowledge data analysis, statistical analytics, data analytics, performance metrics, and data visualization. Strong analytical and communication skills, quick learner, self motivated, along with the ability to learn and adapt quickly to changing priorities and to adjust to a changing environment. You’ll get bonus points if you have experience defining and managing Master Data Management You’ll get bonus points for experience in Agile/Scrum. Banking industry experience is an asset. WHAT YOU'LL GET Competitive salary. Flexible benefits. Outstanding employer-paid Pension Plan. Great AMA discounts. Unlimited learning opportunities. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Technical Analyst - ( 2200023Q ) Description Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that accomplishes operational excellence. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our 25,000 team members in over 400 locations worldwide are vital to making our Company stronger. Your Opportunity We are looking for a Technical Analyst to join our Integrated Business Applications team. Using a combination of technical and functional system knowledge rooted in a disciplined approach, the Technical Analyst resolves Tier 2 and Tier 3 incidents/problems and creates system solutions to improve operations and implement operational development initiatives. The Technical Analyst maintains an in-depth understanding of the functional configuration, system flows, technical architecture and development & extensibility options and works collaboratively with Business Analysts, Functional Analysts, Database Administrators, Software Developers and external vendors to develop technical solutions. Stantec offers a flexible work environment and we are open for this role to be based out of any US or CA location. If you’re looking for a workplace and a position you can grow with, we would love to hear from you. Understanding of data model and system flows for one or more application domains. Experience developing and supporting technical solutions and reports for Oracle Fusion Cloud Experience developing and supporting technical solutions for supplier and procurement systems.
