Core-Mark is one of the largest marketers of fresh, food, and broad-line supply solutions to the convenience retail industry in North America. Founded in 1888, Core-Mark, part of Performance Food Group’s family of companies, offers a full range of products, marketing programs, and technology solutions in the U.S. and Canada. At Core-Mark, you will discover a culture that enables you to grow, challenges you to achieve, and embraces you as family. Show us your power and come explore your opportunities with Core-Mark. THE POWER OF ONE. STRENGTHENED BY ALL. Position Summary: The Category/Space Planning Analyst is responsible for providing analysis utilizing multiple data sources to create optimized assortments for specified categories as well as merchandising the data in planogram form for Core-Mark Center of Excellence customers. Responsibilities: Through data analysis, the Category/Space Planning Analyst will highlight localized assortment differences, regional trends, assortment gaps and new product opportunities. Will develop clear and concise category assortment strategies to improve process efficiencies. Identify planogram merchandising standards and requirements per category. Utilize Blue Yonder Space Planning and Assortment Optimization software to: Produce best in class planogramming strategies and merchandising principles. Develop reports, highlights and customized planograms. Work closely with Category Managers/Directors, along with vendor partners, and customers to finalize both corporate and customer facing planograms. Coordinate with category representatives to gain critical category insights. Maintain Corporate program tracking & communication Requirements: Statistics or related discipline; or commensurate experience. Experience with analyzing large data sets. Blue Yonder Space Management software suite: Floor Planning, Open Access and Assortment Optimization a plus. SQL experience a plus. Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to prioritize projects. Retail, CPG, C-store experience a plus. Core-Mark Benefits: At Core-Mark, we know your power comes from your overall well-being and the well-being of your family. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package that supports the health of you and your family. As a part of our family, your benefit offerings include: Highly Competitive Medical, Dental, & Vision Coverage Health Savings & Flexible Spending Accounts Core-Benefits: Life, Disability, & Employee Assistance Program all paid for by Core-Mark Work/Life Balance: Sick Leave, Vacation Time, Holidays, & Tuition Reimbursement Financial Wellness: 401(k) Plan, Group Voluntary Benefits, Pet Insurance, Commuter Benefit, Employee Discounts, & Scholarship Opportunities for children of employees

Overview: Business & Data Analyst Are you an enthusiastic and experienced Business Analyst with drive to solve real business problems with practical solutions? Are you passionate about leveraging technologies and processes to improve the way we work? Are you eager to help us use data in making better decisions? If this is you, please apply to join our talented team in driving digital transformation for our business. Reporting to the Director of Business Systems Development, you will interact with key business teams (primarily sales and marketing) while supporting, improving, and extending our business system capabilities across our autonomy and positioning portfolio. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a dynamic, fast-paced, highly collaborative team in driving tangible and measurable results. You will have high visibility while making a large impact for our business partners. Come see why we are recognized as one of Alberta's Top 75 Employers in 2020! The Company : Hexagon is a global leader in digital reality solutions, combining sensor, software and autonomous technologies. We are putting data to work to boost efficiency, productivity, quality and safety across industrial, manufacturing, infrastructure, public sector and mobility applications. You’ll be joining over 22,000 people in 50 countries on the leading edge of your field. This position is with Hexagon’s Autonomy & Positioning division, a global technology leader, pioneering end-to-end solutions industry leaders rely on for assured positioning and autonomy on land, sea and air. Our work touches every aspect of life, from sustainability on Earth to enabling autonomy. Within the Autonomy & Positioning division your work will contribute to the operation of our brand(s) NovAtel, AutonomouStuff, VERIPOS and Antcom. The Location: Hexagon is a global company with locations around the world. This position is based in Calgary, AB. Responsibilities: As a Business and Data Analyst, you will: Engage with business teams to understand their needs and processes Become the primary liaison between business stakeholders and the technical team Manage customer relationships and expectations by developing a communication process to keep others up-to-date on project results Assume primary BA role for key, strategic projects; driving requirements, scope, acceptance planning and change management Work collaboratively with other team members and stakeholders to improve our systems, capabilities, and processes Help to define and evolve our Business Intelligence and data analytics competency and capabilities Act as the primary point of contact for second level support, using your broad system knowledge to triage and dispatch customer concerns Provide mentorship and guidance to more junior members of the team Qualifications: Must-Have: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar, with a minimum of 5 years industry experience Demonstrated excellence in requirements solicitation and translation into effective stakeholder and system level requirements Excellent communicator, comfortable engaging with people at all levels of the organization Effective in capturing current state and conveying future state process and design Demonstrated proficiency in data analysis, report design and development Solid understanding and experience with relational databases like SQL Server or Oracle, ability to write sophisticated queries and perform data analysis Owns the outcome by taking personal accountability for delivering strong results Key Success Factors: Strong understanding of Agile & Scrum methodologies Strong understanding of software development process & lifecycle Nice-to-Have: Experience with Business Intelligence tools/capabilities Experience with Customer Resource Management (CRM) tools and processes Experience with Customer Issue Management tools and processes Experience with Salesforce.com Experience working with geographically disperse teams

SAIT’s Business Intelligence and Analytics department supports the institution with market intelligence and business analysis. Our unique in-house research team, through consultation and the study of industry changes, labour markets and SAIT’s programming and products, helps inform essential business decisions. The Opportunity At the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology (SAIT), we are the shapers. The makers. The originals, driven by a passion for excellence and results that count. We offer action-based learning, solution-focused research and enterprising collaborations with partners from around the world. We are a global leader in applied education, an Alberta Top Employer and a destination workplace empowering people to make a difference in the lives of students. Now is an exciting time to join this one-of-a-kind place … SAIT. Business Intelligence and Analytics creates and oversees institution-wide business intelligence and market research strategies. The Business Intelligence and Analytics team plays an important role at SAIT by conducting research, gathering industry insights and measuring student and customer perceptions to directly support and inform strategic business decisions. Information and analytics are utilized to develop business cases to back institutional investments in support of student success. Reporting to the Manager, Market Research and Product Support, the Senior Market Research Analyst designs, implements and conducts major market research and feasibility studies. This will include conducting primary research using a variety of market research techniques as well as analyzing secondary research. The information collected is used in the decision making process at various levels within the SAIT organization. Research studies are conducted for all areas of SAIT and they encompass a comprehensive evaluation of all issues addressed in the research. The ideal applicant will possess a professional record of accomplishment in market research work, with emphasis on assessment methods, both quantitative and qualitative The Role Determine the appropriate research methodology based on project objectives; devise sampling methods, and design instruments for primary research. Responsible for managing all aspects of market research process, including questionnaire design, data collection, statistical analysis and presentations of the results. Develop moderator guides and recruitment guidelines for focus groups, moderate groups as well as write reports for key stakeholders. Responsible for trend analysis and reporting on a variety of primary and secondary research initiatives such as Satisfaction Surveys, Customer Behaviour surveys and reports, including 3rd party reports. Program and launch surveys using the SAIT Insights research panel as well as other online survey software tools. Manages SAIT Insights research panel including recruitment strategies, panel health monitoring and purging of inactive panelists. Assist with the implementation and management of a student assessment tool. Responsible for conducting competitive scans and analysis as well as market scans as they relate to post-secondary education and SAIT programming. Identify market and industry needs and future trends to assist with development of new SAIT program offerings Conduct research related to the Program Quality Assessment process of SAIT programs. Responsible for maintaining quality control and data integrity. Contributes to the annual market research plan and provides recommendations with respect to potential research initiatives and directions, and methodological improvements. Generate ideas for improving SAIT from the perspective of an unbiased consultant. Keep abreast of current trends in education as they relate to SAIT. Respond to ad hoc inquiries for information and analysis of issue from SAIT’s community. Qualifications The minimum level of education required is a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree with an emphasis on analytical thinking. Preference for those with courses in market research, statistical analysis, data analytics, economics or social sciences. Minimum of 5 years related experience, preferably in a client service capacity, with a professional record of accomplishment in market research work. Advanced knowledge using SPSS statistical software, Excel and PowerPoint. Proficient in online survey programming and study management. Strong problem solving and analytical skills, with ability to synthesize, interpret, analyze and report on data findings. Extensive experience and creativity in reports creation and presentation of data to various audiences. Excellent project management, administrative, and organizational skills, with ability to balance competing priorities. A serious interest in both the educational field and in market research is fundamental in keeping abreast of current issues. Focus group moderator skills would be a definite asset. Experience and/or working knowledge of market research panel management would be an asset. Experience and/or working knowledge of business intelligence tools like Tableau would be an asset. Highly motivated individual, with a strong sense of responsibility, and a high level of integrity. Classification: Research Officer II # of Position: 1 Hours Per Week: 36.25 Salary Range: $72,098 - $78,724 Position closing date: Until suitable candidate is found About SAIT SAIT is a global leader in applied education. Named one of Alberta’s Top Employers, we offer the chance to work with a purpose — preparing the next generation of industry leaders, entrepreneurs, advocates and explorers. Building on our 100+ year history, we’re looking for innovative, bold and collaborative employees who embrace change and deliver world-class customer experiences. Your future starts now at SAIT. Equity, diversity and inclusion (EDI) is essential to achieving SAIT’s vision to be a global leader in applied education. It creates the conditions for a healthy campus where everyone feels welcome, respected and empowered to succeed. SAIT values fairness, shared accountability and the importance of representation. The institution expects a commitment from its students and employees to continuously develop an equitable and inclusive mindset that celebrates diverse experiences and perspectives. Learn more about EDI at SAIT. For information on the collection and use of your personal information, please see our Privacy Policy. BEWARE FALSE POSTINGS AND RECRUITING OFFERS SAIT has been made aware of individuals or organizations posing as SAIT using false postings to attract job seekers and collect personal information. Please be aware that SAIT will never request sensitive personal information beyond what is required for an application. Career opportunities at SAIT will always be posted on the SAIT career site and we encourage applicants to only apply directly through there. When your application is completed you will receive an email confirmation, if you did not receive one please check your junk mail or try applying through the SAIT career page again.

The Position RMA is looking for a Business Systems Analyst to play a key role in the continued development of our systems and processes. RMA is experiencing exciting growth in our business services areas and are looking for an energetic team player who loves the challenge of working with operational experts to develop and integrate foundational systems for the organization. RMA supports professional development for its team members, encouraging career growth. As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for providing technical expertise building and implementing business solutions - toward realizing value through levering tools including, but not limited to, SharePoint and the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI). You would strive for continuous improvement of business processes, incorporate, and integrate existing emerging technologies, enable strong team foundations through leadership, and communicate effectively across all stakeholder levels. Roles and Responsibilities The key responsibilities for this position are as follows: Maintain a deep and current understanding of end-user-facing cloud technologies and collaboration tools including M365, CRM Dynamics, Power Apps, Power Platform, Power BI, Dataverse, SharePoint and others. Develop and maintain visual reports, dashboards and KPI scorecards using SSRS, Power BI, and Excel as required. Create databases and manage database models. Collect, analyze, and refine AI modelling tools, including developing models for categorization of data, form processing, and entity extraction. Interpret stakeholder business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Elicit business requirements for new processes using business analysis elicitation techniques such as requirements workshops, business process analysis, use case creation, data analysis, etc. Liaise with multiple business units, technology teams and support teams to identify requirements, best practices, interdependencies, and opportunities for improvements. Translate requirements to User Stories and create other artifacts (process flow, data model, use cases, etc.,) that provide clarity to the requirements. Design the solution for software products such as SharePoint and D365, keeping with the solution architecture and technical roadmap. Establish and clearly document requirements, develop use cases, and test plans, and create end-user documentation and training materials and demonstrations. Qualifications Post-secondary Diploma in the field of computer science, business administration or another related Information Technology discipline with four (4) years of related Business Analysis experience on information technology and business projects: or Post Secondary Degree with two (2) years of related experience. 2+ years of demonstrated Power Platform Experience (Power BI, Power Automate, Power Apps) ranging from development concepts, governance, creation, monitoring, and maintenance. High proficiency in M365. Certification in the MS Power Platform, SharePoint, Dynamics 365, Dynamics GP, and/or Application security would be considered an asset. Experience with Change Management and/or Project Management. Excellent written, oral, and listening communication skills, and exceptional organizational and planning skills. Manages multiple priorities in a fast-paced and changing environment while able to quickly analyze problems to reach a conclusion. Able to and enjoy working in a team environment including keeping others appropriately informed. Must be eligible to work in Canada. Compensation Commensurate on experience, post-secondary education (degree/diploma), and determined according to the current RMA salary grid. Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Benefits: Company pension Dental care Disability insurance Employee assistance program Extended health care Life insurance On-site parking Paid time off Vision care Wellness program Schedule: Monday to Friday Application question(s): 2 + years hands-on Power BI Experience Education: Secondary School (required) Experience: Business Analysis: 4 years (required) Application deadline: 2022-07-15Expected start date: 2022-08-15

Company: BGE Indoor Air Quality Solutions Ltd.
Summary: Do you want to work for a company that safely delivers clean, healthy indoor air environments? Do you encompass and live our core values of: Together we are Better, Striving for Excellence, and Be the Experts? BGE provides services and products to organizations that care about clean air. Through its focus on strong customer relationships and an integrated service and product offering, BGE delivers industry knowledge and technical and advisory support, enabling organizations to safely build and maintain clean, healthy indoor air environments. Job title: ERP Analyst Job type: Full time, permanent Location: Edmonton or Calgary preferred, with ability to work from home. Job overview: The ERP Analyst is primarily responsible for Developing, implementing, maintaining and supporting AX\D365 ERP systems and acting as the first point of contact for all ERP related issues. Reports to: Director of Information Solutions Tasks, duties and responsibilities: Facilitate the successful migration from Dynamics AX to Dynamics 365, and integrated solutions, to enhance business functionality and overall performance Support existing Dynamics AX environment while transitioning to D365 Work with key stakeholders within all business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies Assist with the ongoing design, configuration support and testing of the ERP system Train users on D365 and system functionality and create and provide knowledge transfer documentation Document the organization’s business or processes or systems, assessing its integration with technology to help in guiding businesses in improving processes, products, services and software through data analysis Collaborate with internal end-users (data owners and department managers) and senior management to identify valid business needs for information, reporting, analytics, and data integration. Resolve data integrity issues, ensuring accurate and detailed testing of problems/solutions are done. Recommend/develop solutions to meet ongoing requirements and paths for improvement Help identify and gather requirements for 3rd party applications and helps to develop strategies for implementing them into our environment Facilitate all data inquiries, import and export requests, including ad-hoc and data analytic reports via Microsoft Excel, SQL, Power BI or similar tools as appropriate Knowledge, skills, abilities and other competencies: Degree/Diploma in a technical discipline 3-5 years of related business systems analyst experience within an MS Dynamics environment (AX\D365) 3+ years of progressively responsible experience in applications and systems support, documenting requirements, as well as business process mapping and analysis Strong knowledge and skillset with commonly used databases, analysis, and programming (eg. SQL, CRM, Data lake, R). 3+ years of progressively responsible experience in applications and systems support, documenting requirements, as well as business process mapping and analysis A comprehensive understanding of enterprise business applications and software standings. Good communication, customer service and presentation skills. Strong organizational and time management abilities. Excellent problem-solving skills. Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Business Intelligence reporting tools Ability to occasionally travel. What we offer: Competitive compensation Benefits package and RRSP matching program Supportive work environment Opportunities for training and development BGE hires on the basis of merit and is committed to employment equity. We encourage all qualified persons to apply. While we sincerely appreciate every application received, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

DESCRIPTION: Reporting to Manager, Fleet Services, this role will be part of the Common Services team, working with key stakeholders to deploy and optimize fleet software tools and dashboards to provide key insights that drive the businesses forward. This role will also perform and manage data analyses and validation processes. We're looking for someone who cares about their work, strives for more each day, challenges the status quo, embraces change, and thrives in a collaborative work environment. If you approach work with passion, curiosity, and the courage to innovate, then this role is for you. WHAT YOU GET TO DO: Design and manage tools and techniques to validate and reconcile data. Develop and maintain high-performance data visualizations, reports, dashboards, and provide ad hoc reporting. Identify and implement reporting process improvements through optimized utilization of reporting systems and tools. Maintain reporting procedures and provide required reports as needed. Collaborate across multiple business units to understand, inform, and implement improvements. Seek input from various stakeholders throughout the organization. Perform on-going analysis of ATCO's fleet operations, suggest continuous improvement measures, and work with the ATCO operators during implementation. Assist in developing operating standards, processes, and procedures, and provide expert support during the implementation to ensure ATCO's compliance with provincial and federals codes and regulations, industry best practices and ATCO's contractual obligations. Establish and maintain positive working relationships with partners, clients, vendors, and sub-contractors to attain goals. Lead initiative meetings with internal and external stakeholders and monitor and support the project's ongoing progression. Monitor initiative performance through regular reviews of functional schedules, project efficiencies and budget KPIs. Develop and manage initiative schedule, budget, and scope while identifying risks, changes, and impacts. Develop system integrations and automation that drives overall software and reporting efficiencies. WHO YOU ARE: A post-secondary diploma in business analysis, business or computer sciences from a recognized institute. A minimum of five (5) to seven (7) years project management related work experience. Knowledge in Maximo, Oracle Cloud Solutions, or Primavera is an asset. PMP® or CBAP® certification preferred. Self-motivated with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Demonstrated skills in organization, time management, and prioritization. Ability to work independently, set priorities, and meet customer needs. Proficiency with Microsoft Office and advanced PowerBI, PowerQuery, and Excel. Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills. Experience in using and maintaining a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) such as Maximo. Experience with Oracle, Oracle Fusion or Oracle Primavera. Proven leadership, business acumen, analytical capabilities, communication and negotiation skills. WHAT WE OFFER: A culture based on caring, integrity, agility, collaboration, and striving for excellence. Competitive compensation. Flex benefits. Tuition assistance program. Data & Reporting Analyst Hey, it’s so nice to meet you! We’re Nude Solutions – and our team is on a mission to empower insurance with our cloud-based, API-driven platform that is (positively!) disrupting the insurance industry as we know it. We’ve developed a simple, but powerful, solution that allows brokers, agents, managing general agencies, mutuals, and insurers to transform their businesses and achieve our vision of delivering the best insurance experience in the world. As Nude Solutions’ Data & Reporting Analyst you will focus on applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products. With your ability to use your experience to implement database design and architecture, we’re already so excited about the things we’re going to accomplish together. What you’ll do: Strong advocate of data governance by ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and security Support software developers and data team with the implementation of data requirements Build and manage data warehouses, data marts, and ETL processes Develop engaging and intuitive BI reports and dashboards using Power BI Assemble large and complex datasets for ad-hoc reports and requests Develop a deep understanding of our data model and the insurance industry What you’ll need to succeed: Solid understanding of database design and architecture including an understanding of dimensional and relational data modeling concepts In-depth working knowledge and experience with relational databases and SQL query authoring Experience with SQL Server development tools including Azure SQL tools Experience with the implementation of analytic solutions Experience with reporting tools such as the Power BI & Power Query Intermediate experience with ETL/Integration tools such as SSIS Knowledge of continuous delivery/integration methods in an Azure Devops environment Experience with Excel (Power Query, formulas, VLOOKUPs, Pivot Tables, macros, etc.) Insurance Industry software experience is an asset Excellent communication skills and willingness to collaboratively work in a fast-paced Agile environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills University degree in the following disciplines Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or Data Science You’re going to love it here. We’re more than just a workplace. We’re a community. Nude Solutions is a place where you can be who you want to be, work on projects you’re passionate about, and grow organically into your dream career with the support of an amazing team cheering you on every step of the way. If all that isn't enough, here are just a few more fabulous things we offer: Competitive salaries and extended health, dental and vision plan Annual professional development allowance Share Appreciation Rights program that gives you skin in the game Community and charity partner volunteer program Team building and bonding events A deliciously stocked beverage fridge That's it! If you like what you see, you know what to do (apply) - we can’t wait to meet you!

Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day Here, innovation is everyone's job. Ready to make your mark? A career in insurance has never been this exciting. What you will be doing: Work closely with varies project teams to understand, document the requirements for the EDP DevOps team Continuously working with stakeholders to analysis and improve the maturity of the various processes. Coordinate among project teams, platform support team related to the incident management, change management and release management. Lead / participate in solution workshops to specify IT solutions, after consulting with all stakeholders. Collaborate between DevOps and Architect team to come up with the right solution. Support the development of solutions and the perform analysis. Work closely with Product Owner and Scrum Master to prioritize, write user stories, use cases, groom product and sprint back log with the team. Analyse and produce reports as needed. Ensure proactive and effective communication at all levels. Strong knowledge of Power BI, PowerPoint and other reporting tools. Knowledge of writing user stories, understanding business priorities and sizing of user stories. A self-starter, who can drive and follow through the initiatives from the beginning to the end. Excellent communication skills, spoken and written. Bi-lingual is a strong asset. Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success An extensive, flexible benefits package An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle Flexible Work Arrangements We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. For more information, check out this video about Working at Bethany Business Analyst - Quality and Resident Safety Summary Reporting to the Director Quality and Resident Safety, the Business Analyst is responsible for leading data management, analysis and reporting activities that assist with the evaluation and monitoring of continuing care operational processes. This integral role supports the achievement of safer, higher quality client experiences. The Business Analyst will work to maximize the benefits achieved from Bethany’s Integrated Quality Management System to ensure quality and safety risks are monitored and addressed, through continuous quality improvement as evidenced by resident, family and staff experiences. In successful candidate will possess excellent organization skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks while handling shifting priorities, be able to collaborate with diverse stakeholder groups and possess proactive problem-solve skills that assist in delivering effective business solutions. Duties and responsibilities Data management, analysis and reporting activities that assist with the evaluation and monitoring of continuing care programs/services and health technology initiatives Conducting business analysis and research to identify key metrics and opportunities for improvement gathering and documenting business requirements and ensuring all continuing care operational standards are met. Assist in the development, operational delivery and implementation of care service technologies for the organization. Responsible for care technology communications with stakeholders, user acceptance test planning and execution, user documentation and training. Responsible to develop processes and procedures to ensure business solutions meet strategic goals. Provide advice on health information systems strategy, policy, management, security and service delivery Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to understand the structure, polices and operations of the organization and recommend solutions and strategies to achieve its goals. Engage with business leaders and users to understand how data-driven changes to process, services, technology can improve efficiencies and add value. Consult with key stakeholders to determine business objectives and success factors Collaborate with team members to collect, analyze, and evaluate information from multiple sources Collaboration with financial and IT teams to establish initiatives and strategies to improve reporting and to optimize costs Qualifications Education & Professional Designation Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Management or Information Technology. Master’s degree would be an asset Experience Minimum of three to five years of recent experience as a business analyst, preferably in the health care sector Demonstrated understanding of change dynamics and change management processes (e.g. Prosci certification); project management experience Knowledge and experience working with senior decision makers Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Project management experience across multiple sites including change management and system level evaluation Ability to utilize analytical and conceptual thinking in the identification and resolution of issues Demonstrated knowledge of business concepts (organization structure and design, business processes, communication planning) Proficiency in the Microsoft suite software package required, and experience in Visio is an asset Working knowledge of SQL, relational databases, and basic computer science Data visualization experience not required but preferred Commitment to continuous learning, by attending and actively participating in education opportunities, learning new skills, and by actively communicating and sharing knowledge and learning experiences with co-workers. How to Apply: Like what you see and think you have what it takes to join our team? Apply Online before 23:00 on June 12, 2022 at: http://bethanyseniors.com/careers/ All applicants are thanked for their interest. Only those selected to move further in the process will be contacted. Bethany Care Society is an equal opportunity employer. Successful candidates will be required to obtain a Criminal Background Check and provide proof of all required immunizations. Bethany Care Society complies with the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA). By forwarding your resume to Bethany you are consenting to the collection and use of your personal information for this job competition. Your information will be kept strictly confidential.

Want to be part of a team that's changing the way Canada travels? As Canada’s largest independent ultra-low-cost airline, that’s exactly what we’re doing at Flair Airlines. By consistently offering airfares that are a fraction of the ticket prices of “those other airlines”, we are making air travel an affordable option for millions of couch-bound Canadians. Yes, we’re an airline, but we truly believe that our product is our people. Low fares are important, but it takes great people delivering consistently outstanding customer-focused service to build brand loyalty. Reporting to the Manager, Airport Applications, the IT Business Analyst is responsible for enhancing the quality of IT products and services, analyzing data to inform business decisions, and finding technological solutions to business needs. The role requires expertise in both information technology and business administration and the demonstration of exceptional interpersonal skills is critical, as the IT Business Analyst will act as a communication link between the IT and other departmental groups. The IT Business Analyst will be based out of Edmonton, Alberta, with the possibility of working remotely. Primary Job Functions: The duties of the IT Business Analyst include: Liaising between the IT department and other departments. Acting as an information source and communicator between departments. Understanding strategic business needs and plans for growth. Enhancing the quality of IT products and services. Analyzing the design of technical systems and business models. Utilizing IT data for business insights. Analyzing business needs. Sourcing and implementing new business technology. Finding technological solutions to business requirements. Gather and document requirements on projects. Work closely with project manager on large projects. Participate in technical projects as a task owner. Manage small projects requiring a single resource. Assisting other IT teams as needed. Must be available to participate in rotating emergency on-call support and weekend projects. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications and Education Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, information systems, business administration, or a related major; a combination of relevant education and experience considered in lieu of degree requirement. Two to five years of relevant experience; airline industry experience an asset. Demonstrated ability in the use of the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Publisher, Outlook, and PowerPoint), and demonstrated ability to learn and implement new programs and software. Clear criminal record check. Ability to work in a high-stress, ever-changing work environment while managing multiple projects and prioritizing tasks and assignments. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to solve problems. Level-headedness, calmness and the ability to think and respond appropriately in difficult situations. Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills. Excellent organizational skills-and a high level of attention to detail and accuracy. Flair Airlines offers a competitive compensation package including medical and dental benefits, short and long-term disability, life insurance, dependent life insurance, employee & family assistance program, a defined contribution pension plan (matched contributions), and a staff travel program. How to Apply: Please apply online directly to the posting. Applications should clearly demonstrate how your skills meet, or surpass, the requirements of the position of IT Business Analyst. Further information about the Company can be found at www.flyflair.com At Flair Airlines, we work together to promote an inclusive environment which attracts talented individuals and signals our commitment to celebrate and promote diversity. We are devoted to creating equitable, inclusive and diverse work spaces and we encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to apply for this role. We wish to thank everyone who applies, however, due to the number of applications received only those shortlisted will be contacted. We cannot accommodate phone inquiries. We look forward to meeting you at Flair Airlines!

About Circle K We know that you can work anywhere. However, working at Circle K is the start of something great! Join a global family of 130,000 people in over 16,000 stores and 25 countries to make our customers lives a little bit easier every day. We set ourselves apart by our culture of pride: pride in our people and their development, pride in serving others, what we've built and what we are striving to achieve. No matter where you come from or where you are heading in your career, there is a place for you to grow at Circle K. When you grow, we grow - together. Summary We are currently hiring for a Pricing Analyst to join our Western Canada team. Reporting to the Price Execution Manager, the Pricing Analyst will be responsible for the day-to-day work of collecting and analyzing data from both internal and external sources to support data-driven decision-making regarding merchandise pricing. You will work closely with our local Marketing team and our Global Data & Analytics team. This is an exciting and important role in our organization as we become an even more data-driven company. Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities: Work with category managers and our Data & Analytics team to develop competitive pricing strategies and maximize data usage in our pricing initiatives Review, analyze and validate deliveries from our Data & Analytics team and propose pricing recommendations Independently carry out ongoing pricing analyses using internal and external data, and play an active role in the annual pricing strategy review process Contribute to automation and improvement of pricing-related processes and embed new processes Actively participate in the annual review of prices, assortments, and campaign strategies in connection with business planning Share best practices and lessons learned about pricing and related processes with other business units and global teams Profile Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Mathematics, or related field Experience in compiling and combining data from various sources Experience with data visualization and presenting data in an effective manner to different target groups Experience analyzing data in the retail industry, preferably from a large organization Experience in pricing and assortment optimization is a plus Experience in SQL or other programming language for statistical calculations (eg R, Python) is a plus Circle K values diversity in the workplace and is committed to employment equity by encouraging applications from the following designated groups: women, aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Couche-Tard/Circle K values diversity and inclusion and aims to create a safe, accessible and rewarding workplace that showcases the unique contribution of our employees to the success of our business. As an employer, we are committed to employment equity, we encourage a wide variety of applications to ensure that we have a diverse workforce that is representative of the customers and the communities we serve. Accommodations are available upon request for applicants who participate in all aspects of the selection process.

At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including Elbow River Marketing and Parkland Refining. We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team. Position Title: Business Analyst Team and Location: Finance – Alberta Position Summary: This position is responsible for analyzing and reviewing all Crude and Risk Management transactions for PRBC. This involves monthly report outs to senior management as well as coordination of monthly meeting reviews. Key Responsibilities: Review all crude entries to ensure the correct accounting treatment has been used – Straight Purchases, Buy/Sells, Derivative Loss/Gains, and Straight Sales (average monthly crude spend is $140 Million USD). Review and post monthly calculation of realized & unrealized derivative L/G and fees for hedging transactions. Perform FX revaluation for GL accounts related to crude accruals and intercompany swaps and ensure month over month variance is reasonable. Provide bridge from Actual Earnings to Mark to Market. Perform monthly account and inventory reconciliations and ensure C-SOX controls are followed. Provide assistance with CSOX Compliance and other Audit Requirements. Maintain updated documentation for relevant processes. Review monthly crude contracts, update Crude Supply Website, update monthly Crude Deals spreadsheet and analyze deals for Withholding Tax for non-resident suppliers. Validate crude pricing with counterparties for invoice settlement, and work with crude analyst to ensure all crude related invoices are validated and settled on time; assist with new crude vendor/customer setup with Master Data; provide crude settlement forecast to Treasury; provide assistance with crude related inquiries. Analyze Average all in crude costs by location (Edmonton vs Burnaby), and create monthly crude water fall charts to show Crude Cost Build Up. Analyze Crude Costs between VL (verified limit) and Non-VL on a monthly basis. Ad-hoc analysis and project support as assigned – i.e. Allegro, NextGen. Support and work closely with Crude Supply & Trade team and crude planner. Qualifications and Skills: Demonstrated power user – Excel (not limited to pivot tables, sum ifs, vlookups, index). At least 10 years of accounting experience with a minimum of 5 in Manufacturing. Analytical skills and experience working with large amounts of data. Accounting designation. Positive attitude. Demonstrate initiative and sound judgement in performance of duties. Strong communication skills – oral and written. Interpersonal skills -ability to work in a team environment. Organizational and prioritization skills. Works well with tight deadlines and under pressure while maintaining strong accuracy. Role models safe work practices. We Offer: Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance. A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching. A flexible group benefit plan that offers health and dental coverage choices to meet the needs of each unique employee. Inclusive of life and disability insurances, Health Care and Lifestyle Spending options, and a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program. Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program. An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral. In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities. Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members. A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training. Please note: Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas. Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity. We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview. Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Employment Type: Full-time Permanent Location: Calgary, AB Division/Department: Leasing Available vacancies: 1 About Avmax: Avmax is a diverse company offering every product and service related to aviation. We have locations, operations, and deployment worldwide. Our vision at Avmax Group Inc. ("Avmax") is to simplify our customers' aviation needs through dependable, globally integrated services with trusted results. Established in 1976, our locations include: Calgary (HQ) and Vancouver in Canada, Great Falls and Jacksonville in the USA, Nairobi in Kenya, and N'Djamena in Chad. Avmax offers the following capabilities: Aircraft Leasing, Airline Operations, Avionics, Component Repairs, Engineering, MRO, Paint and Spares. Avmax's engineering division is a Transport Canada authorized Design Approval Organization (DAO). Avmax's maintenance division is a Transport Canada authorized Maintenance Repair Organization (MRO). Why work at Avmax? Avmax has a diverse workforce with opportunity for growth and career advancements. We offer competitive compensation and benefit packages, flexibility, work-life balance and a friendly working environment. We are proud of our work and commitment to create one of the leading workforce, products and services in the Aviation industry. About the Role: Reporting The Business Analyst for the Aircraft Leasing Division reports directly to the Director of Lease Operations. Core Competencies Accountability Attention to Detail Communication (verbal and written) Creative and Innovative Thinking Critical Thinking Judgement Mathematical Reasoning Professionalism Quality Orientation Time Management Key Performance Indicators / Duties & Responsibilities Data review - analyze and validate existing data for accuracy and update documentation as needed. Identify data or process inefficiencies, recommend improvements, and support meaningful changes. Work closely with department leaders and project stakeholders to ensure alignment and joint accountability for successful achievement of project and operational goals. Prepare concise, logical, and grammatically correct reports suitable for presentation to executives and project stakeholders. Maintain tracking of customer's monthly aircraft utilization and maintenance reserve balances. Track and calculate maintenance reserve claims in accordance with the terms of the Leas and in conciliation with the Technical Asset Manager. Maintain budget forecasting for maintenance reserve events. Calculate and track annul escalations for maintenance reserve rates. Coordinate with Lease Contracts and Accounting to ensure accuracy of client billing activities. Develop and coordinate reporting that alerts to utilization trends and ratio exceedances that may require rate adjustment negotiations with clients. Assist Sales and technical teams with analysis of ROI and residual value for new acquisitions opportunities. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field such as Business Administration, Finance, or Accounting. A Master's degree from an accredited MBA program is considered an asset. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to work with senior decision makers and interact with individuals at all levels of the organization. Ability to accept and integrate constructive feedback. Self-driven individual who embraces change. A positive, "can-do" attitude and customer-orientated approach that will enable you to deal with challenging situations with integrity, empathy, and sincerity. Experience Minimum 2 years experience in a Business or Data Analyst role is required. Airline/ Aviation industry experience strongly preferred. Our recruitment commitments: We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Depending on qualifications, selected candidates may be offered a role at a more appropriate level. Job Description: Business Intelligence Analyst Reports to: Vice President, Business Intelligence Are you a Power BI expert who can plug into any project to create dynamic dashboards? Do you pride yourself on your ability to take complex reports, visualization ideas, or abstract concepts and simplify them utilizing Power BI? Are you looking for an opportunity to extend a growing team’s Power BI capability on an ongoing basis? If you answered yes to all the above, we want to talk to you! Go Auto is a growing Automotive company that configures Microsoft technology to solve real world business problems. We are in need of a great technical staff member that is able to design and build creative solutions using analytical tools. We focus on creating integrated dashboards and reports using Power BI, collaboration solutions using Microsoft Power Automate, Forms and Analysis Services. Experience creating visualizations, dashboards, and other information using Power BI. Proficiency in data modeling in Azure analysis services using visual studio. Our work environment is dynamic and the career opportunities across our businesses offer variety and challenge. This position reports into the Senior Manager, Product Management & Digital Sales and supports Direct Energy’s product management and development efforts to extend our position of leading provider of innovative propositions in the Alberta residential and small commercial retail energy market. This role will be responsible for supporting product teams in product development decisions using quantitative and qualitative data to inform next steps and delivery of products to market. This individual will also have responsibility for metrics, segments, experiments and exploratory data analysis. Essential Duties/Responsibilities: Responsible for researching, analyzing, interpreting and presenting data/analytics related to energy and non-energy product markets and customers. Provide strategic analysis and insights to support the product management team by deeply understanding customer data (including but not limited to usage, segmentation, etc.), product performance (including conversions across the various channels) Inform strategic decisions around which channels to deploy in specific markets to acquire targeted customer segments Using a range of inputs from data, customer feedback and your own judgement to build a prioritized recommendation for the product funnel Work across the organization using analytical principles and structured thinking to: Partner with Sales teams to help improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the top performing channels of product sales Partner with digital and marketing to design experiments and evaluate campaigns aimed at driving customer growth through various product offerings Partner with Retention to quantify the impact of retention improvements on key corporate metrics for product performance Partner with GTM leads to quantify the impact of portfolio growth on key corporate metrics for product performance Be an expert that GTM and product teams across the business can rely on for customer product insights and analysis Working Conditions: Primarily an office environment. Some overtime required as special projects arise. Some travel <10% Minimum Requirements: A post-secondary degree, college diploma or equivalent years’ work experience in analytics or product or marketing or related field 5+ years’ work experience as an analyst in an ecommerce and/or marketing setting Ability to apply structured problem decomposition to identify root causes to complex problems, typically in undefined and evolving situations Strong background in data structures and familiarity with variety of tools, languages, and techniques to bring the right data to bear to solve business problems Advanced research skills Deep understanding of modelling techniques and a demonstrated ability to apply the right approach to the right circumstance Experience with languages and tools such as SQL, Python, R, and Tableau that enable rich analysis Proven capability to tell compelling, insightful stories based on data & analysis that drive decision making, demonstrated experience briefing on outcomes & recommendations, and an interest in teaching others – using PowerPoint or other presentation software Has a proven track record of using advanced analytics and data science techniques to solve complex business problems and advance a rapidly growing business Takes initiative to find solutions to problems that aren’t fully laid out or specified Advanced Excel or Spreadsheets including pivot tables, macros Excellent verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills, with a high comfort level presenting to a variety of audiences. Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Teamwork and cross-functional leadership skills. Problem definition and solving skills. Excellent communication skills; i.e. effectively communicates with internal groups on ideas and resolves issues. Adapts to ambiguity, is open to new ideas, and adjusts plans to meet changing needs Knowledge of visualization best practices Excellent problem-solving analytical skills with the ability to synthesize and communicate complex results Excellent written and verbal communication skill Collaborative approach to issues and problems Ability to work effectively both independently and with teams Ability to manage multiple complex projects simultaneously Ability to use good judgment to make recommendations and decisions Ability to adapt to rapidly changing priorities Physical Requirements: Occasionally requires lifting as appropriate to perform duties and responsibilities Position requires employee to work using a laptop/computer screen. Who We Are Meet Fresh Prep—Western Canada’s most convenient and sustainable meal kit delivery service. As a certified B Corporation, we make convenient eating healthy and sustainable for the communities we operate in. We source quality local ingredients whenever possible, and deliver in reusable, recyclable and compostable packaging. We offer 10 chef-created meal kit recipes each week, with options for many lifestyles and preferences including vegetarian and vegan. Fresh Prep has been selected as one of 2022 BC’s Top Employers and ranked #38 in the Globe and Mail’s 2021 Canada's Top Growing Companies List. Who You Are Curious and technical leader. You like to problem solve business questions with data answers. You like helping others find insights and make strategic and tactical decisions based on the analysis you provide. Self Starter. You are comfortable owning a task from start to finish and you take the initiative to make continuous process improvements. You observe strict deadlines and hold yourself accountable for your deliverables. Strong communicator. Your verbal and written communication skills allow you to get results across easily and quickly, in a friendly and professional manner. Open. You are open to constructive feedback, but aren’t afraid to let your opinions be known. You approach the problem at hand from a strategic and empathetic point of view. What You'll Be Doing Using your sophisticated, superior, and creative analytics problem solving, be able to translate data into meaningful business insights to answer business questions. Work closely with the Data Team and other stakeholders to provide analysis and insights that help inform decision making and drive program improvements. Craft insights into a narrative that can be shared and understood cross-organizationally. Develop company-wide and campaign-specific performance reports and dashboards. Writing SQL pipelines, data wrangling, modelling, and dashboarding. Create, manage, and maintain the tools, systems, dashboards, and data to make the team more efficient, effective, and data-driven. Support the performance and optimization of the Data Team. Work closely with more junior data analysts, mentoring them through the project lifecycle and provide guidance on industry best practices. Migrating and championing adoption in a new BI analytical tool or software within the Data Team as well as non-technical stakeholders. Responsibilities Fluently write expert SQL queries that pull, join, clean, filter and aggregate data (self joins and windows functions). Use these queries to develop and maintain actionable dashboards, analyses, and key insights to increase internal understanding of business drivers. Transform findings into compelling presentations, including graphs, charts, or dashboards, aimed at answering key business questions and present to executive stakeholders. Partner with multiple stakeholders to define KPIs and metrics within Fresh Prep such as Marketing, Operations, and Product. Build and maintain the integrity of reports with as much self-service access as possible. Responsible for data documentation of data assets, ensuring that data assets are created thoughtfully and reliably throughout its lifecycle so that learnings turn into repeatable actions and then into automation. Identify data needs to develop high-value, actionable reporting aimed at answering key business questions. What We Are Looking For 3-5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analysis, data science, and/or business analysis in an eCommerce, SaaS, or retail Experience with working with agile methodologies Expert fluency with SQL (we use Big Query), and Python or R Experience with Business Intelligence software such as Google Data Studio, Looker, Power BI, Tableau or others Highly proficient in G Suite and/or Microsoft Office Tools Proficient in statistical modelling Experience in data consolidation, data migration, and creating data documentation Experience having mentored and trained more junior analysts and working in a team Experience with creating a robust data lake, and pulling in integrations with APIs or third party tools Experience with research tools like Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, SPSS, PSPP is a nice to have Experience managing one or more reports. What You Can Expect An inclusive, fun workplace filled with fantastic colleagues. We’re a certified B-Corporation and our team is passionate about making a positive difference (and also about food!) The ability to work from home or from our HQ located in beautiful East Vancouver Competitive pay and bonuses, as well as the opportunity to participate in our Employee Stock Option Plan. Comprehensive health benefits (including medical, dental, vision and life-insurance) after 90 days of successful employment. Free food! A Fresh Prep meal plan for 2 meals per week and sample meals from our test kitchen at our HQ! Fresh Prep is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and prohibit discrimination of any kind. We value diversity at our company and at all job levels our goal is to be diverse, inclusive and representative of the communities we operate in. We endeavour to recruit, develop and retain the best talent from a diverse candidate pool and truly believe that diversity, equity and inclusion among our team members is vital to our success as a company. We trust that in applying for a role with us you value this as well! Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but don’t necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We’d love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

At CWB , we strive to build value for the people who choose us every day: our people, our clients and our investors. We do this by holding true to the values that guide us. We put people first and build relationships with intention. We seek out and embrace new ideas, knowing that better is always possible. We believe that how we do things is as important as what we do. And we harness the power of inclusion. Our culture is who we are and how we show up - as individuals and as a team - to accomplish our strategy. The opportunity Are you a strategic, big picture problem solver with an excellent record of accomplishment of undertaking and remedying sophisticated operational challenges? Do you excel cross functional project work? Are you someone who has a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer needs, pain points and can translate them into perfectly executed business cases, which result in the fulfillment of exciting operational improvement initiatives? If your immediate response is yes, then you might be a perfect fit for our Centralized Operations Group at Canadian Western Bank (CWB). We are seeking a skilled, experienced, positive, and enthusiastic addition to our team as Senior Process Analyst, Operations. Facilitate discussion and resolution of escalated issues related to policy, procedures, or specific branch or client situations. Drive the use of data for daily management and decision-making using data analytics and reporting tools. Ensure all processes, activities and team members follow Canadian Western Bank’s Code of Conduct, legal, regulatory, and policy framework Task Ownership Ensure a client-centric perspective is incorporated within the Operational Process Management & Improvement activities. Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills that contribute to working effectively in a diverse working environment. Accept responsibility and accountability for actions and results. Prepare and regularly review annual objectives and career development plan with manager/supervisor. Controls and Administration Drive and deliver on targeted benefit realization from projects and initiatives (e.g. continuous process reviews and improvements, end-user readiness and productivity goals, improved regulatory results, the use of Robotic Process Automation; expansion of FileNet usage, etc.). Ensure proper controls are in place and monitor daily operations to ensure controls are working effectively to mitigate risks associated with the processes executed within the Process Improvement team, including a library of Operations and internal policies and procedures, templates and a review calendar. Provide recommendations and solutions that are compliant with laws, regulations and internal policies. Provide direct support to the CWB branch network, Operations team, corporate departments, and partner companies to enable them to deliver a “best in class” client experience. Regularly review and update Operational Process Management & Improvement objectives to ensure regulatory and client needs are met and operational risks are reduced Capabilities that will take you further Customer focused. You’re all about seeing our team succeed and reach achievements and successes for our clients. You will provide guidance and mentorship in areas like risk assessment, credit underwriting, credit structuring and credit presentation skills – delivering results effectively and efficiently. Communication. You are clear & concise – both in written & verbal communications/presentations. A multitasker. As a fully experienced, qualified professional, your day will include balancing multiple tasks. Project Management skills. You thrive when working on a project and possess the knowledge of fundamental project management processes, methodologies and tools & techniques and ability to adapt them to organization. Understanding of formal and informal organizational structures. Ability to drive efficiencies and continuous improvement in processes aligned with corporate culture. Technical savvy in MSOffice products, including Visio, Excel, Word, Teams and PowerPoint. Learning and development including the development and execution of programs an asset. Understanding of change management ADKAR methodology an asset. Darkhorse Analytics is looking for a Director of Data Visualization to act as lead designer as we work with clients to turn data into beautiful, revealing, and engaging visuals.What we do...Darkhorse Analytics is a Canadian consulting firm specializing in predictive analytics and data visualization. Our visualization team is internationally recognized for building custom interactive visualizations with a focus on impact and clarity. We've analyzed hockey, public health, social mobility, housing, and open data, to name a few. We are actively seeking to grow the visualization community's capabilities through our blog with articles and educational material.What you will do...We're looking for a seasoned professional to lead all aspects of the design process as we work with clients to build world class data visualizations.We want someone who is excited by the idea of bringing clarity to the complex and has the design chops to ensure 'clear' doesn't translate to 'boring'; someone who knows how to engage an audience. As a member of the team you will: Work closely with developers and analysts to create stunning custom visualizations and data experiences for our clients Work with clients to understand requirements and develop use cases, user profiles, and visual narratives Work with subject matter experts to explore data sets to discover new patterns and stories within the data Lead the design process from ideation to polished design, using sketches, wireframes, UX scenarios, and mockups to bring your vision to life for clients and team members. Participate and lead in the design and implementation of UI/UX/interaction for data visualizations. Provide visual consistency across different client platforms and act as the opinionated guidance for the visual design of our own organization Keep up to date with the latest trends in data visualization and brainstorm and develop new ideas and methods for visualizing client data Act as a senior mentor to junior employees as you polish, tweak and perfect the team's work Showcase your work at public and digital events and engage in the community to grow your and our reputation as leaders in the field Learn from the talented people surrounding you and work hard to help them learn from your unique skill set What we look for...We're looking for someone who is passionate about data visualization and user experience. You know what good looks like, and you will defend it with vigour. You genuinely enjoy problem-solving and finding patterns, and won't rest until you've found the perfect solution. The perfect candidate should: Have experience designing and developing data interfaces and dashboards that are both easy to use and engaging. Have a portfolio of information designs and data dashboards that express your passion for this field and display your ability to bring clarity to the complex Have experience designing beautiful and engaging software Have a strong opinion on what needs changing in a design and be able to explain how and why those changes will be effective Have experience using your UX/UI skills to gather data and perfect digital experiences Be able to point to one of your favourite visualizations/interfaces and explain what makes it so good Have the skills in Sketch, Illustrator, Figma or an equivalent application to develop high-quality graphics Be excited to find stories in the data and ideally have some basic familiarity with Excel, R, Tableau or Python Be unafraid of code and maybe know how to do a little HTML and Javascript yourself Be well-organized, able to communicate with clients, able to effectively manage development team members Believe in our values Working at Darkhorse…Darkhorse is not like other companies. We eschew titles and power structures. Your career is not a ladder from designer, to senior designer, to lead designer, to chief creative officer. Instead, it is a path toward mastery. You will gain skill, confidence, reputation, and influence all the while having substantial autonomy. Your work will be viewed by millions, and your voice will be heard and respected by the wider visualization community. You will have an impact.Darkhorse provides an environment that enables and recognizes success. Our competitive compensation package will include a salary commensurate with your skill and experience. Remote work allowed. Job Type: Full-time

Trupanion is a leading provider of medical insurance for cats and dogs in North America. Our mission is to help the pets we all love receive the veterinary care they need. At Trupanion, we offer a collaborative, casual, and pet-friendly environment where everyone is encouraged to be themselves. Position Summary: The Customer Insights team at Trupanion is looking for a curious and pet loving analyst to join our team. We need a driven analyst who can creatively come up with data-focused solutions to problems through inquiry, data collection, analysis and collaboration with leaders in customer experience and marketing to drive change. Successful candidates will have unbridled curiosity, enjoy solving complex problems and share our love of data and pets! Candidates for this position have the option to work remotely from anywhere in Canada Key Responsibilities Include: Foster effective working relationships with fellow analysts and business partners to create an environment of knowledge sharing Ability to see to the core of a problem, understanding the “why” behind a question Observant and inquisitive, discovering opportunities to use data to better understand our customers Extract and reconcile data from our robust data warehouse or identify and strategize new data to be collected through third party partnerships, surveys and more Conduct primary and secondary customer research with focus on both quantitative and qualitative analysis Apply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to derive meaning from data with a focus on impact Present findings to business partners, often collaborating to develop and implement action plans Monitor results through performant dashboards, rinse and repeat Qualifications Please include a cover letter with your application. Experience: 5+ years’ experience of data extraction and manipulation (eg SQL), statistical analysis and other modeling techniques 3+ years leading or mentoring junior analysts 3+ years using data to drive strategy Skills, Knowledge & Abilities: Comfortable working on complex and ambiguous problems Highly driven and motivated to work in a fast-paced, high-growth environment Advanced experience with data analysis including applying statistical methods and modeling techniques Advanced experience with data visualization platforms (Tableau preferred) Experience with research and survey methodology preferred Flexible to work independently and in a team-based environment Benefits and Perks: Bonus opportunities Employer-paid extended health coverage for you and your family Four weeks paid time off Five weeks, paid, sabbatical after five years of employment Restricted Stock Units Employer-paid medical insurance for one pet (cat or dog) Paid time off to volunteer at nonprofit organizations Open, casual, pet-friendly, and fun work environment About Trupanion: We’re all about helping pets. We promote a cohesive and nimble team environment, and we hire, develop and promote team members. We trust each other. We are transparent and honest. We care about one another and want to see our team members succeed, personally and professionally. We strive to promote from within and reduce bureaucracy to allow creative thinking. We’re focused on providing continuous training and support to all team members to encourage long-term happiness and success.
