Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday. Description Job Summary: We are looking for an analytical superstar to join our Compensation team as a Compensation Data Analyst. Our employees are the key to our success, and it is imperative that as a business Ledcor is keeping up to date with Compensation trends. By analyzing both internal and external data, this role will support the creation of a data driven understanding of the compensation landscape, which will enable our Leadership team to make informed decisions that will help us to attract and retain employees. As our new Compensation Data Analyst, you will be reporting to the Senior Manager, Compensation & HR Projects (Manager), to provide insightful analysis on compensation data from a variety of sources. This role will be responsible for taking the initiative to find trends, patterns, and opportunities for compensation at Ledcor. Bring your extensive Data Analytics experience to this impactful role and join our True Blue team today! This role can be based in Alberta, British Columbia, Saskatchewan or Manitoba and will be a home-based position with the understanding you may be required to attend office as business needs dictate. Responsibilities: Compensation Analysis and Insight (50%) Collect, combine, mine and analyze disparate datasets and metrics from a variety of sources, including Salary Surveys, Workday, JDE, Recruitment, Business HR, exit Interviews etc to detect underlying labour market trends and Ledcor compensation data trends with a view towards more effective and efficient compensation analytics using statistical analyses, predictive modeling, and forecasting Working with the Manager to develop a plan to incorporate non-traditional data sources into our analysis. Monitor social media (Glassdoor, LinkedIn) to monitor what employees are saying about Ledcor’s pay practices Conducts ad hoc compensation analyses (exploration projects) on Operating Group compensation related concerns Identify key business drivers impacting compensation patterns Monitors the effectiveness of existing compensation practices and recommends changes that are cost-effective and consistent with compensation trends and corporate objectives Compensation Program Enhancements (25%) You will perform analysis on components of compensation, change initiatives and provide support to compensation program enhancements by conducting data analysis to support timely data driven decisions Takes initiative to identify gaps in, or opportunities for improving, our compensation programs, tools and guidance Engage with our internal customers (Business HR and Recruiting) to understand their needs, solve compensation challenges and ensure successful deployment of compensation programs Compensation Communication & Training (25%) Execute on compensation communication plans in order to ensure that leaders and employees have the right level of knowledge (including training across key stakeholder groups and employees) Supports the preparation of reports and presentations of findings for the Board, Senior Executives, Operating Group Leaders, HR Leadership teams with compelling data visualizations and narratives Supports training activities within HR to increase awareness, understanding and capability for compensation practices within the HR team Requirements: 4 years related experience in Compensation, Financial or Data Analysis A Bachelors degree in a relevant field such as Finance, Accounting, Data Science or Statistics Experience working with Workday, SAP and Power BI is highly desirable Experience with applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc. Ability to understand and analyze large datasets. Experience processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis Comfortable with ambiguity and developing creative solutions to business questions Excellent ability to visually present and communicate data, analyses, and findings Experience with Power BI preferred Ability to identify, analyze, and resolve problems logically and systematically Strong attention to detail Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills Ability to work in a fast paced, complex organization and meet deadlines Ability to maintain discretion and confidentiality with sensitive employee information Ability to work independently and be part of a cross-functional team environment Expertise in Microsoft Office Suite Working Conditions: Occasional event-related travel may be required Additional Information: Company Description The Ledcor Group of Companies is one of North America’s most diversified construction companies. Ledcor is a company built on a rich history of long-standing project successes. But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now! Employment Equity At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply. Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging. View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here . VFO Asset Planning & Info Competition No. - S103947943 Posting Date - May 30, 2022 Closing Date - Jun 10, 2022 Position Type - Full Time - Operating Funded Salary Range - $62,877 to $87,627 per year Grade - 11 Hours - 35 This competition is open to all applicants however internal candidates and applicants who were former employees of the University of Alberta in the past 18 months will be given priority consideration before external candidates. Please indicate your internal status using the "Advertisement" drop down menu when applying. This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA). This position offers a comprehensive benefits package which can be viewed on our Benefits Overview page. Location This role is hybrid with a mix of remote and in-person at North Campus Edmonton. Working for the University of Alberta The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Métis, Inuit and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community. The University of Alberta is teeming with change makers, community builders, and world shapers who lead with purpose each and every day. We are home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs, over 13,000 faculty and staff, 260,000 alumni worldwide and have been recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers for over a decade. Your work will have a meaningful influence on a fascinating cross section of people—from our students and stakeholders, to our renowned researchers and innovators who are quite literally curing diseases, making discoveries and generating solutions that make the world healthier, safer, stronger, and more just. Position Summary Reporting to the Manager, Infrastructure Analytics as part of the Infrastructure Information & Analytics group, this position will provide technical analysis, business analysis and reporting support to various users within the U of A Facilities and Operations portfolio. The primary responsibility of this role is to perform analytics and process improvement functions for initiatives that support the Facilities and Operations mission of being a leader in facility operations and management. Working as part of a group of technical specialists, this role will have a direct impact on helping to improve how University facilities are operated. The University of Alberta has a proven track record of being a leader in the field of facilities management, and by leveraging the vast quantities of infrastructure data being collected will it be able to maintain its position as pioneer. The Infrastructure Analyst will play a role in this by improving the analytics and business processes management throughput of the Data Analytics group as well as taking on one or more initiatives as a champion and lead. Duties The Infrastructure Analyst will: Work together with the Infrastructure Information Management team of the Infrastructure Information and Analytics group, acquire and organize raw data from user sources as required Assist in the data analysis using data query languages (sql, DAX, etc...), and to the Infrastructure Information Management team Perform data quality audits as required and as appropriate. Some examples would include document review, building site visits, as well as working sessions with University and facilities staff Document and Analyze business processes and identify opportunities for Improvement/automation Maintain the highest standards of quality assurance and data integrity to ensure that all data being presented and used by stakeholders is accurate and reliable Produce well thought out, accurate, and relevant analysis of various infrastructure data collected by the University Along with the Manager, Data Analytics, provide information, write reports, and produce recommendations for presentation to senior members of Facilities and Operations Maintain the highest standards of professional judgment, ethical behavior, and discretion regarding the sensitive data that may be used as part of analysis Be responsible for the day to day management of the initiative as well as be the main point of contact for the client groups Drive the initiative forward to Job Description: Position: Power BI Report Developer and Service Administrator Location: Calgary, Alberta SUMMARY OF JOB PURPOSE AND FUNCTION The Power BI Report Developer and Service Administrator will be based in the Calgary, Alberta office and reporting directly to the General Manager. In this role you will be bringing reporting together to support operations, finance, and our people and organization departments. The ideal candidate has experience scripting SQL database queries for exploratory analysis and can modify queries based on specific department needs. In addition, the candidate will have experience creating reporting that is easily consumed by a wide-ranging audience. RESPONSIBILITIES/COMPETENCIES Develop Reports Developing visual reports, dashboards and KPI scorecards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) using Power BI. Connecting to data sources, importing data and transforming data for Business Intelligence through Power Query modeling Able to implement and manage row level security on data and understand application security layer models in Power BI Able to develop tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with wide ranging audiences. Develop, administrate, and govern company PowerBI Service accounts Excellent in analytical thinking for translating data into informative visuals and reports. Simplify reporting into more of a singular structure. Design, publish and maintain Power BI data models involving a variety of interrelated tables connections. Business Operations Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business need. Translate stakeholder business goals into sustainable data modeling, delivery, and reporting solutions Provide feedback and analytics on how to best support the goals through reporting Highlight areas of success, challenges, and opportunities Connected with the business priorities and goals SKILLS, EDUCATION, AND EXPERIENCE Undergraduate Degree in business management, computer science or related degree 3+ years in data modeling, reporting, and Power BI data management Hands on experience with DAX formula language calculation development, KPI analytics aggregation and data visualization standardization Extensive knowledge of SQL (Oracle or SQL Server) Problem solver as it pertains to reporting tools and technologies Experience developing understandable reports, dashboards, and useful visualizations Excellent problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail and accuracy What VCA Canada Offers Join our team and you will make a huge difference in the lives of pets and their families! RRSP Employer match program for all associates – planning for your future just got easier with VCA Canada!! Continuing education benefits - we know you love to learn! Career and leadership opportunities Annual membership or certification fees Referral bonus rewards

Overview: KPMG is an industry leading firm that serves clients on a variety of specialized projects that help them to work smarter, grow faster and compete better. Why join our contract workforce? Interesting work: Deliver work that matters to you. We provide the opportunity to get involved in highly technical, complex and interesting projects where you can leverage your specific skillset and expertise to add value. Enrich your skills: Access to best-in-class technology, market intelligence and resources to advance your unique technical skills and expertise. Work alongside diverse, passionate and highly skilled professionals working together to drive innovation. Flexible opportunities: Find projects that match when and where you want to work. The opportunity KPMG has a significant Workday practice in Canada, with team members across the nation (spanning regions such as Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Toronto and the GTA, Montreal and Halifax). Our team includes various Workday Product Leads, as well as some of the very first Workday-certified Consultants in the country. Our Workday practitioners span the breadth of HR functional knowledge, technical know-how and blend the latest trends in HR service optimization with real-world knowledge and understanding of our clients’ industry challenges and opportunities. We are looking for a Workday Data Conversion Analyst (Senior Consultant) to work under KPMG’s Technology Advisory practice who strives to deliver business benefits, helping our clients develop high-performing IT functions and leverage investments in current systems to deliver significant business value. This is a 12 month contract with the 2 main offices being in Calgary and Halifax, however this role will be remote from anywhere in Canada. What you will do: As a Workday Data Conversion Analyst in our Workday practice, you’ll be learning from some of the best in the industry and growing your personal skillset by: Taking accountability for Workday Data Conversion deliverables by leading client engagements and teams to successful outcomes with a focus on supporting your team, client needs and generating value. Participate in Workday implementation activities including discovery, design, configuration, documentation, testing, and project review sessions related to data conversion Lead the end-to-end data migration process from legacy systems into Workday, for various clients across a range of industries. Become an expert in the Workday tools in order to execute day to day data conversion activities Gain a thorough understanding of the Workday product and support the team on tasks outside of the data conversion stream Support and lead business development activities such as identification, proposal development, and other pursuit activities; work with the appropriate KPMG resources from other service lines/industries. Contribute thought leadership to the development and evolution of our methodologies and intellectual capital including publishing articles, whitepapers or performing research, business development, proposals, and demos in support of initiatives. Your qualifications: 2 - 5 years of experience implementing enterprise solutions with at least one full life cycle Workday implementation and thorough understanding of data conversion processes, best practices, and tools Workday Core HCM certification is required. Strong Excel competency and familiarity with ETL Tools. Working knowledge of Alteryx is a plus Understanding of program or project management Knowledge of Workday, especially the implementation tools, is a plus but not required Bilingual French/English spoken and written is a strong asset Our Values, The KPMG Way: Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters KPMG is committed to the health and safety of our people, clients and communities. With this commitment in mind, KPMG complies with all public health mandates (provincially and/or federally, as applicable) and has implemented various safety measures, including a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. KPMG's COVID 19 Vaccination Policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated if they wish to or are required to attend a KPMG office in the course of their duties. As this role requires occasional or consistent attendance at a KPMG office, the successful candidate must be fully vaccinated (i.e. have received all doses that are recommended by Health Canada, including any boosters) and must provide KPMG with proof of vaccination. KPMG will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment. KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice. For general recruitment-related inquiries, please contact the HR Delivery Centre at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca. If you have a question about accessible employment at KPMG, or to begin a confidential conversation about your individual accessibility or accommodation needs through the recruitment process, we encourage you to contact us at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778.

About Athennian Athennian increases trust in business by helping teams be transaction, audit, and compliance-ready. Our software powers organizations to digitize how entities and company structures are managed to meet the accelerating pace of business and corporate transparency requirements. Our vision is for every business entity in the world to be organized and trusted on Athennian. The Role Reporting to the COO, the Sr. Analyst, Strategy & Operations will work closely with the executive team to own strategic projects and operational analysis. This includes activities such as market expansion analysis, improving go-to-market strategies, and researching industry benchmarks to develop operational performance frameworks. We are looking for someone with 2-4 years of experience in management consulting, investment banking, or analyst experience in a growth stage company. Hybrid work model (work-from-home options available) Executive Operations Responsibilities Work with finance and other business units to prepare and circulate materials for quarterly board meetings, shareholder updates, and team town-halls Manage the agenda and follow-up items for weekly and monthly executive meetings Strategy Operations Responsibilities Work with the executive team to prioritize and analyze opportunities to increase business performance Generate evidence to support hypotheses and recommendations via secondary research or running experiments Produce reports, business cases, and decks, to communicate and support the implementation of the results and recommendations from your analysis Develop processes to manage analysis project visibility and performance of the strategy function Requirements 3-5 years as an analyst in consulting, investment banking, or as a strategic analyst Exceptional at communicating complex ideas simply in writing Highly skilled at analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions Experience using effective data visualization techniques and tools Some experience developing low/no code automation (Zapier, Excel Macros, etc.) Knowing how much time to invest in a project to make it the most efficient Economic consulting / market analysis background preferable Education MBA (preferably with a concentration in strategic management) CFA or similar designations a strong asset Our Culture We believe incredible teams can solve any problem and we strive to be an inclusive workplace where ideas thrive. We are first and foremost an organization of people who are passionate about learning, building, and sharing software to transform the legal industry. Our team members thrive when they’re passionate about what they do. We strive to create an engaging environment with challenging tasks, foster meaningful relationships with colleagues, and encourage each other to become the best we can be. Whether you want to customize your workspace, share your latest hobby with the team, or broaden your horizons with a specific project, we have a wealth of opportunities to keep you growing and learning. We’re here to help you become the best version of yourself, all while having fun and connecting with coworkers. Diligent Builder: Ability to design and build scalable systems Focused Creative: Strategic mind with a solution first attitude and uses data to navigate the next steps Ambitious Learner: Eager to take on new challenges and present innovative solutions Benefits at Athennian We offer competitive benefits and perks because we believe that happy people produce great results. We are always adding to this list based on employee feedback: generous vacation/sick/flex days, remote work options, flexible working hours, health/dental/vision/group life/gRRSP/LTD/AD&D/EFAP benefits after 90 days, high growth environment, teambuilding, day-to-day variety (never a dull moment), MacBook for all employees, stock options, and a culture of transparency.

Resolute is a Full-Service IT firm with a multi-disciplined team that can handle every aspect of business IT. The two sides of our business are Professional Services and Managed Services. We are a trusted partner for growing, mid-sized, and enterprise organizations to enable them to achieve their business goals to scale up operations, reduce risk, and get a consistent level of service. -- We guarantee to do IT right for businesses. Whether it is managing a company’s entire IT footprint and operations, leading a project, or conducting an assessment – we bring best best practices at every level of service. Our mission is to help organizations solve their most challenging IT problems through expert analysis, technology solution implementation, and experienced professionals. -- We’re looking for a Business Analyst to join our Professional Services team! This role will require a combination of skills including business analysis and most importantly – a consultative approach to working with clients. You will need to have a strong work ethic, a positive attitude, and the ability to listen, allowing you to efficiently decipher client needs. .What you will be responsible for: Translates customer requirements into functional requirements in a clear and concise manner Analyze existing systems to understand both the business domain environment that the systems support and the technical environment in which they operate Develop solution alternatives leading to recommendations for new applications, technology installations or changes to existing ones Participate in the development of test strategies/plans and where required, execute functional tests Perform impact analysis on the changes to existing systems and processes Develop technical writing materials, including user guides, process guides, operations manuals, business analysis work products (BRD, matrix, etc.) data dictionary, testing reports, training documentation Participate in business process reengineering (innovation or improvement) as required/requested to meet defined business objectives (increased quality, reduced cycle times, reduced cost) Assist to develop project cost and benefit estimates to establish project Identify general data sources and document data flows, including the development of mapping rules to standardize data across systems Support projects through different project stages, including development, quality assurance, user acceptance testing and production implementation Work on both business and technology projects Perform package (software) selection process Create and execute the Request for Proposal process for IT solutions Capable of using Project Management methods to oversee smaller projects Support other Resolute team members with knowledge sharing, brainstorming, coaching, collaboration, etc., as required . What you bring to the table: Post-Secondary Degree, Certifications or equivalent work experience as a Business Analyst focused on Information Technology 7+ years of experience with a combination of business analysis focused work Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Initiative and a passion to deliver results that make a difference Experience with Microsoft O365 suite and providing solutions to business challenges Proven ability to perform in a fast paced and demanding environment Mastery of Microsoft Office Products, including MS Project and Excel . What RTS gives back to you: A collaborative and creative work environment that truly values and cares about their employees as people Bonus Program Comprehensive benefits package Training and education opportunities A fun and inclusive team building environment If you have any questions, please contact our Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist Kam Singh or visit our Careers Page for more opportunities! We are not able to hire (or sponsor) out-of-country applicants that do not have a current Permanent Resident Status or Work Visa. Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Additional pay: Bonus pay Benefits: Casual dress Company events Dental care Extended health care Flexible schedule Flextime Paid time off Vision care Work from home Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Experience: Business analysis: 7 years (preferred) IT: 5 years (preferred)

Job_Title: Contract Senior Business Analyst- Information Technology
Summary: 12-month contract Let’s impact lives for the better! Alberta Blue Cross® is an Alberta based organization dedicated to delivering exceptional customer experience and community leadership. We’re committed to providing the best health coverage to over 1.8 million members and take an active role in promoting the wellness of all Albertans. OVERVIEW: Alberta Blue Cross® is seeking a contract senior business analyst to direct and lead the analysis of business processes and business requirements for projects. The business analyst will be responsible for mentoring junior business analysts in the areas of requirements documentation, testing strategies, modeling techniques, standards and tools. WHAT YOU WILL DO: Consult with clients to gather and effectively capture complex business requirements in the form of use cases at an advanced level. Document requirements using use case modeling concepts. Liaise with the technical staff to provide the business perspective during system analysis and design phases. Work with the project manager to plan the day to day management of the business analysis, design, development and testing tasks. Assists in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules. Support design and documentation of future state processes and data flow. Work collaboratively with Functional SMEs, System Analysts and Solution Architects to design and document data integration requirements between operational systems and core ERP systems. Support planning for and execution of end-to-end integration testing. Participate in the test plan development process by working collaboratively to develop test cases, scenarios, and specifications that assess whether the system satisfies all of the business requirements. Actively participate in project review meetings providing status updates to the business sponsor and project manager. Identify any potential schedule or project problems and provide solutions to alleviate any problems. Support the development of the user training documentation for business users to ensure effective and efficient use of the new systems. Coordinate the efforts of other business analysts. Prepare ad hoc reports WHAT YOU WILL HAVE: Completion of a software development technical institute or university diploma/degree program is required. A minimum of ten years direct experience in the areas of business analysis and user acceptance testing. Experience of ERP implementations in a Business Analyst role. Experience in designing integrations between ERP and operational systems. Knowledge of end-to-end Finance business processes. Experience of the Workday HCM and Finance cloud solution is preferred. Strong facilitation skills that will be utilized in conducting user workshops to define requirements. Demonstrated strong proficiency in Unified Modeling Language (UML), including but not limited to activity diagrams, use cases, sequence diagrams etc. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with both the user community and technical teams. Experience in drawing out requirements from the business teams and effectively communicate those requirements to the technical teams. Superior analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to recognize symptoms, diagnose causes and identify alternative solutions. Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project, Visio, and SQL Navigator. Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment. Decision-making ability and demonstrated leadership potential is essential. Demonstrated ability to pay persistent attention to detail, while maintaining an overall view of the situation and the big picture. Ability to multitask and meet the challenges of a fast-paced changing environment. Working knowledge of/experience with Project Management body of knowledge and software development methodologies would be beneficial. Alberta Blue Cross® is an inclusive employer committed to a workplace that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We empower and are advocates for our employees by welcoming, respecting and valuing their unique perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate is selected. If you have the qualifications we are looking for, apply online at careers.ab.bluecross.ca.

Experience Required: 5+ Years Essential Skills: Business Analysis Role will be focused purely on Business Analyst Source to Target Mapping Specification BRD documentation, JAD sessions Can work along with developers make decisions and guide development team. Hands on experience in BI and Big data projects involving ETL, Hive, Hadoop Managing a team of onsite and offshore developers, AD SME’s and coordinating with BSA/ QA teams POC on upcoming latest tools/techniques Must Have: Minimum 4+ yrs experience in ETL and database Able to work independently Proven end to end delivery experience on 1M+ projects Knowledge of calling APIS from ETL tools Proven ability to self-manage and be able to drive an initiative from inception to closure Attention to details and able to problem solve/analyze Agile way of working. Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Fixed term contract Pay: From $120,000.00 per year Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday
